"DAMN, A BUG," Kevin said in a thunderous voice.

Kevin lifted one of his enormous Converse All-Stats over the scurrying bug.

"DON'T WASTE THE EFFORT," Zac suggested, looking for the TV remote instead of glancing at the tiny form on the floor so near his own feet.

Kevin laughed loudly. "OH, IT'S NO EFFORT," he said. "I LOVE DEALING WITH FILTHY PESTS."

Eric gazed up and saw the soles of the enormous Converse All-Stars, stained with the remains of previous stomped bugs.

"Zac!" Eric screamed. "Help..."

He ran toward the sofa and his brother's two socked feet at rest on the floor. "I've got to make him see me."

"YEAH," Kevin said as he took another drink of beer. "TAKING CARE OF YOUR BROTHER'S PEST PROBLEM WILL BE MY PLEASURE."

No! Not to be stomped like a bug in his own home! "Don't..." Eric screamed as the hovering shoe headed toward him.

Kevin brought his foot down, abruptly cutting off Eric's unheard plea.

"JUST ENJOY YOUR BEER," Zac said. "ERIC WON'T MISS A COUPLE OF THEM."

Kevin and Zac sat on the sofa. Kevin lifted his lethal Converse All-Star, and he and Zac stared at the squished bug's remains littered among all the evidence of previous stompings.

"That's disgusting, man," Zac said, taking a drink from his beer

"Why?" Kevin said and chuckled. "I've owned these shoes for more than three years, and I don't have a problem with pests at my apartment."

"Well, I'll be sure to tell Eric he owes you," Zac said. He laughed and shook his head. "That little bug didn't stand a chance!"

"You got that right," Kevin said.
14311111112.title: Unwelcome Arrival

1431111112.content:
Eric's misplaced relief at finding himself in familiar surroundings vanished when he heard the knock at the front door.

Still in the shadow of his brother's discarded sneakers, Eric watched as Zac went to the door and opened it.

"WHAT TOOK YOU?" Zac said as a huge man entered the apartment.

"I ONLY GOT YOUR CALL A HALF HOUR AGO!" Kevin retorted. "WE GONNA HANG OUT HERE AT YOUR BROTHER'S PLACE?"

As Kevin walked into the apartment, Eric, spying from his lowly perspective on the floor, felt his whole little body grow paralyzed from terror.

Kevin made Eric's brother look small. This hulking behemoth looked utterly monstrous.

Eric watched Kevin enter his apartment. He could not remove his eyes from Kevin's enormous feet housed in a simple pair of flip-flops. The guy's huge toes extended slightly over the front edge of the flip-flops, which slapped the floor loudly with each step.

"SO, GOT ANY BEER?" Kevin asked.

"I'LL SEE WHAT ERIC'S GOT IN HIS FRIDGE," Zac said.

Eric watched as Zac strode from the room. "Wait!" Eric screamed. "Don't leave me here with..."

His voice died in his throat as he saw Kevin take a seat on the sofa. Kevin began a steady drumbeat on the floor, raising and lowering one of his flip-flop-clad feet.

Even a couple of feet away, a powerful odor wafted across the room. "My god!" Eric exclaimed. "His feet stink!"

Eric decided he had had enough. "I've got to get Zac's attention," he said aloud as he sprinted away from Zac's sneakers, across the floor, toward the doorway into the kitchen.

His movement, however, quickly attracted Kevin's attention.

"DAMN, A BUG," Kevin said in a loud voice.

He sprang to his feet and crossed the room in only a couple of strides.

Kevin lifted one of his enormous flip-flops over the scurrying bug.

"WHAT ARE YOU DOING?" Zac asked, returning from the kitchen.

"TAKING CARE OF YOUR BROTHER'S PEST PROBLEM!"

Eric gazed up and saw the soles of the enormous flip-flop, stained with horrid greenish splotches, the remains of previous stomped bugs.

"Zac!" Eric screamed. "Help..."

Kevin brought his foot down, abruptly cutting off Eric's unheard plea.

"I GOT US A COUPLE OF BEERS," Zac said, tossing one to his buddy. "ERIC WON'T MISS THEM."

Kevin and Zac sat on the sofa. Kevin lifted his lethal flip-flop, and he and Zac stared at the squished bug's remains littered among all evidence of previous stompings.

"That's disgusting, man," Zac said, popping the tab on his beer and taking a drink.

"Maybe so," Kevin said. He laughed. "But I've had these flip-flops for more than three years, and I don't have a bug problem at my apartment."

"Well, I guess Eric owes us a couple of beers," Zac reasoned, "since you've reduced his bug problem by one."

"Hell, yeah," Kevin said. He and Zac clashed their beer cans together, then laughed before they took another drink.
1431111112.title: Flip-Flop Finale

choices: They find Josh and Kevin not ready to depart
Picking up their friends, they head for the beach
143111112.content:
Zac arrived at the apartment belonging to his
friend James.

They had been pals since high school.
James, dressed in a pair of red shorts and a
muscle T-shirt, was already dressed for their
trip to the beach.

"We just need to pick up Kevin and Josh and
then we're off to the beach!" James said. "Did
you get some funds from your brother?"

"No. I couldn't find him," Zac said. "But I can
get by."

"We'll have Kevin and Josh buy the beer,"
James declared.

•••••••

Inside the cramped, hot interior of Zac's shoe,
Eric prayed that his ordeal would end soon.
The sound of the conversation between his
giant brother and the equally giant James
failed to make its way to him. "Please, just let
it be over soon," Eric cried.

•••••••

Zac and James walked toward the door, their
bags in hand. "Just a three-hour road trip, and
we're at the beach," Zac said with a loud
whoop.

Trapped in the shoe, Eric was mercifully
spared that bit of information.
143111112.title: Road Trip

choices: Try to gain Josh's attention
Josh's cousin, Adam, arrives
1431111121.content:
James and Zac soon arrived at the apartment
shared by their friends Kevin and Josh.

"Everyone ready to go?" Zac asked.

"Almost everyone," Kevin said in an angry
tone.

Zac took a seat on the sofa. "What's going
on?"

Kevin glared at Josh.

Zac stared from Josh to Kevin. Propping his
feet on the coffee table, he repeated his
question.

"My cousin called and asked me to help him
move into a new apartment this weekend,"
Josh explained.

Zac frowned. "We've been planning this trip for
weeks," he said. He reached down and untied
his shoes, thinking to get comfortable.

"I'm sorry. He also is going to pay me fifty
bucks to help him move, and I could use the
money," Josh said.

Zac reached down and removed his shoes.
He let each of his New Balance sneakers
drop to the floor beneath the coffee table.

"Well, sorry about that,"James said, "but I say
the three of us go on without him."

Kevin gave his approval.

"That's fine, guys," Josh said. "I hope you have
a good time."

••••••

Zac's shrunken brother was unprepared when
Zac removed his sneakers and dropped them
to the floor. The impact catapulted Eric from
the interior of the sneaker to the floor beneath
a colossal coffee table.

The tiny man scrambled to his feet. He heard
loud voices from far overhead.

"We need to hit the road," James announced.
"I'm ready to head for the beach."

Eric recognized his brother's voice. "Are you
sure you can't come with us?" Zac asked.

"No, sorry," Josh commented. "Some other
time."

Zac's huge hand reached down and retrieved
his sneakers.

"Wait!" Eric yelled, trying to think of a plan of
action. Outside the refuge offered by the coffee
table, however, his gigantic brother and his
equally titanic friends were stomping around
the room in their huge sneakers.

Zac, James and Kevin left, and Josh closed
the door of the apartment and walked back
toward the sofa.

Tiny Eric crept to the edge of the
overshadowing coffee table and stared up at
the giant on the sofa. Should he try to get the
giant's attention?
1431111121.title: Left Behind

choices: to check into the Hotel first.
to go straight to the beach.
1431111122.content:
Eric's world was warm, damp and extremely dark. Trapped in the toe area of one of his brother's massive New Balance tennis shoes, the bug-sized man could barely breath. Eric had no idea how much longer he could hang on. If he didn't die from lack of oxygen, one careless wriggle of his brother's jumbo sized toes would surely crush him.

The four young men headed out to James' old beat up green Geo Tracker, loaded up and began their trip to the beach, just three hours away. Zac was completely unaware of his minuscule older brother stowing away in the foul smelling toe of one of his sneakers.

"Hey Josh, did you reserve us a room at the Hilton?" Zac kiddingly asked. "And it better be ocean front, none of that ocean view crap!"

"Sorry Mr. Kennedy, the Hilton was all booked, so you'll just have to settle for a "deluxe" room at the Sand Flea Hotel," Josh replied and then broke out in uncontrollable laughter. "And just three briar patch rows back from the beach."

"Not the Sand Flea Hotel," Kevin cried. "That place is a rat hole!"

"Oh, I don't think any respectable rats would be caught dead in that hotel," James said. "Somebody hand me a brew-ha-ha."

"No brew-ha-ha for you, you're driving," Kevin said as he open a beer and downed half the can in one swallow. "You can have all you want after we get to the beach."

Kevin, Josh, and Zac began to drink the beer, James noticeably peeved about not being able to join in.

About thirty minutes into the trip, Zac decided to remove his sneakers, to the relief of his tiny brother trapped inside the god-awful smelling shoe. Zac propped his smelly feet up between the two front seats.

"Oh my God, your feet stink," Kevin exclaimed. "Get those putrid things away from me!"

"If you think that's bad, just wait," Zac exclaimed as he removed his socks and placed one in each sneaker.

Eric was relieved when his giant brother removed his enormous foot from his sneaker. The bug-sized man was truly afraid he was going to suffocate. But Eric realized his relief was premature when any means of escape from the smelly shoe was quickly erased by the entrance of one of Zac's gargantuan white socks. Even though the tiny Professor could breath a little better and was not as cramped, he was still trapped in his little brother's gigantic sneaker.

After three hours, James and three drunken passengers arrived at the beach.

They decide:
1431111122.title: Beach Trip

choices: Remain where he was, and see what happens.
Leave the confines of his brothers sneaker and see if he can end his nightmare.
14311111221.content:
They pulled up in front of the motel, and it was for sure a real dump. Tall weeds lined the front of the place, and the swimming pool was half full of dirty water.

"Man, I am glad we are only sleeping here," Zak said as he looked around.

Getting out of the truck, Zak grabbed for his sneakers. He pulled his socks out and stuffed them into his pocket. Eric was relieved to see the sunlight again, and get rid of that horrible smell that had been his world for the past three hours. His happiness was short lived, as the NB sneaker began to tilt. Outside, Zak proceeded to put the sneakers on his bare feet. As his world was being turned upside down inside, Eric used all his strength to run back to the toe area. He had made it just in time as Zak's foot came to rest, and his toes came within just inches of crushing Eric. Eric stared at the toes of his giant brother. They wiggled just a bit, as if to mock him.

Zak hopped out of the truck and went to the back to help unload the bags, still oblivous to the stowaway passenger inside his sneaker.

The guys still a little buzzed from all the drinking were trying their best to get all their bags out. It was a hot day, and Eric knew this all too well as his giant brothers foot began to sweat. Having endured the smell from the sock stuffed in by him, this was ten times worse.

Pulling a strap to one of the bags, James went flying backward to the ground on his ass as the strap broke off. The guys all laughed at him, sprawled out on the pavement holding the broken strap in his hand.

"What the hell is that by your hand," Kevin asked speaking to James.

James glanced down to his hand on the pavement and just a few inches away was a small roach sitting there. Kevin ran over, and after raising his leg into the air, brought the sole of his Adidas Shelltoe sneaker down on top of the bug with a loud crunch. He twisted his foot, and then drug his sneaker backwards, just leaving a stain on the pavement of what was left of the bug.

"I hate those damn things," Kevin yelled out. "Damn you show no mercy dude," Zak replied. "They are just pests, and need to be dealt with," Kevin answered. "At least we know who to call on if we run into anymore," James said as he got back up to his feet. "Yea, the Adidas of Doom," Josh chuckled. They all began to laugh at that comment. Kevin finished up wiping his sole on the pavement, getting off anything that was left attached.

They collected all of their things and began heading for the motel office. Inside his brothers sneaker, Eric had no idea what had just happend, or that the wet spot on the pavement that he and his brothers sneaker had just stepped on, could be him if he was not too careful.

After getting the key at the office, they headed to their room to put their stuff away and get ready for the beach. The room wasnt so bad, but they got what they payed for.

"Im ready for the beach," Zak said as he opened his bag looking for his bathing suit. " I think we all are Zak," James replied.

Zak pulled out his suit, and proceeded to kick of his sneakers to put it on. Not anticipating the sudden movement, Eric lost his balance and fell ontop of his brothers sweaty toes. As Zaks foot began to slide out of the shoe, the sweat had made Eric stick. So now he had no choice but to go along for the ride. Eric's tiny heart began to beat fast. He didnt know what to do. As luck would have it, just as Zak's foot went past the tongue of the sneaker, it caught hold of Eric leaving him to drop to the cushioned bottom of the shoe. It was a bumpy ride, that wasnt over just yet. As Zak's foot came out of his New Balance, it dropped to the floor on its side with a thud. Eric bounced around, coming to rest on the inside fabric of the overturned shoe.

"You gotta stop taking those things off in front of us Zak," Kevin said as he held his nose. "Yea, it smells like something died in them," Josh replied. "Look at is this way Zak," James chimed in. "We'll just leave your sneakers out while we are gone, and if there are anymore critters around I am sure the smell will do them in!"

Getting his bearings and getting to his feet, Eric could hear the laughter from oustide. Something about smell, and do them in. He was sure they were talking about his brothers foot odor again. He just couldnt imagine where in their family genes, did his brother get it from.

Eric began walking slowly along the inside of the shoe. He was headed to the opening where bright light was filtering in. He got there and slowly peered out to see where he was. Looking out he could see old brown shag carpeting. Probably a good idea, to hide all the many years of dirt ground into it. He could also the the legs of his brother, and his friends. Looking out there, and then looking back into the darkness of the sneaker, he wasnt sure if he should
14311111221.title: A Walk to Remember

choices: Stomp-happy Kevin returns to the room for something
Something Unexpected
143111112212.content:
"What's everyone standing around for?" Zac asked. "Let's go to the beach!"

He charged from the motel room, followed by his three friends.

Inside Zac's shoe, his shrunken brother heard his brother's voice and something about going to the beach.

"The beach! Where am I?" Eric wondered. He tried to hurry, but by the time he could exit the shoe and drop onto the brown carpet, the gigantic motel room greeted him with an ominous silence.

He stared around the room at two colossal beds, an enormous nightstand located between them and an assortment of huge luggage dropped at the foot of the beds.

What could he do except wait for the return of his gigantic brother and his equally giant friends?

"I've got to get their attention!" Eric said aloud. Everything depended on having them return him to his laboratory.

Surely, he could get Zac or one of his giant friends to notice him...
143111112212.title: Cheap Motel Room

choices: Taking cover in Kevin's stinky Adidas.
Braving it in the open to get his brother's attention.
Remains frozen in fear
1431111122121.content:
Eric just stood there on the carpet. Taking in his surroundings, and wondering what he should do when his brother and friends return.

Just then, he heard the door unlock and it began to open. It swung open, and standing in the doorway was Kevin. Dressed in his bathing suit, t-shirt, and his Adidas with no socks. Little did Eric know the event that took place earlier out in the parking lot, and that he could be in danger.

"Where the hell did Zak say he put it," Kevin muttered as he walked in the door. Eric was over near one of the beds, and he began to see Kevin and his large sneakers heading his way. This could be his opportunity, so Eric began waving his hands and jumping up and down. Trying to get Kevin's attention. Kevin got closer and closer to Eric. Eric began to worry that he would get crushed. Kevin was scanning the room, and didnt even notice small Eric on the floor trying to get his attention. Just as Eric was ready to dive out of the way, Kevins Adidas stopped a few inches from him.

"Let him find it himself," Kevin muttered to himself again. "I drank too much, I need to crash a few minutes."

With the massive sneaker staring him right in the face, Eric was relieved when it made a retreat as Kevin walked to the side of the bed and plopped himself down. At the foot of the bed high above where Eric was, he could see Kevins Adidas hanging over the edge of the bed.

Eric stood debating if he should wait for the other guys, or try to get on the bed and get Kevins attention. Movement from above made Eric look up. The sneakers were moving. Kevin began to use his one foot to pry off his shoe from the other. It was like slow motion for Eric. He saw Kevins foot slowly slide out, and as it did the sneaker began to tumble down to the floor. Eric watched its decent, too stunned to move. It was heading right for him. Finally just before it hit the floor, he dove out of the way. The sneaker landed with a boom. The force caused Eric to bounce a little bit more across the floor. Eric started to get back to his feet when the force of the second sneaker dropping, knocked him back down to the ground again. This sneaker bounced and landed right in front of Eric.

Eric thought to himself he could have been killed if one of those landed on him. Eric looked up to the bed again, looking now at Kevins feet hanging over the bed. His toes wiggling a bit. Oblivous to what could have just happend. Something got his attention, and he looked back down to the sneaker that was in front of him. The odor coming out was even worse than his brothers.

Eric's attention was quickly diverted when he heard voices, and the door squeak open again. In came the rest of the guys. Eric thought to himself as he watched a few sets of giant feet heading toward him.

He was torn between....
1431111122121.title: Kevin Returns

choices: "Go ahead guys without me, I'll wait here."
"Oh Shit, there's a bug in my shoe!"
14311111221211.content:
The thick dirty brown shag carpet made it extremely difficult for the half inch tall man to move about the hotel room. Each strand of the the disgusting carpet was nearly as tall as Eric. The minuscule professor felt as if he were traversing a dense jungle.

After the strenuous journey just to make it to the foot of the bed Kevin had plopped down on, and narrowly avoiding a crushing death by one of the giant's monster-sized Adidas sneakers, the tiny man needed to rest for a minute.

Eric's brief rest was interrupted by the return of Zac, James, and Josh. The bug-sized Professor looked up in awe and terror at the sight of the colossal young men. But the most intimidating feature of the giants were their gargantuan feet. Eric had to avoid being stepped on and squashed to death by one of those powerful monstrosities.

Eric was horrified as he watched James walk in his direction. In a panic, the tiny Professor ran into the opening of Kevin's sour smelling Adidas sneaker. The air felt almost thick with the hideous smell. Eric thought for sure he would pass out. The last place Eric wanted to be was in another giant shoe, but he had no other choice for the moment.

The ground shook as James' massive foot crashed down right next to the Adidas sneaker little Eric was hiding in. His foot came in contact with the sneaker just enough so that it righted itself. Eric tumbled down onto the bottom of the sneaker. He frantically ran and jumped at the side of the sneaker, but there was no way he could get out. He was trapped.

James reached down and grabbed Kevin's ankle and started to pull him off the bed.

"Get up you lazy bastard, we didn't come here to sleep," James said. "Come on and get up, were going to the store to buy some more brews."

"O.K. already," Kevin said, rudely awakened from his peaceful nap.

Kevin, still groggy, sat at the edge of the bed, looked down at his Adidas sneakers and said.
14311111221211.title: Trapped in Kevin's Shoe

choices: Stay put in the Adidas for now.
Try to get Kevin's attention and latch onto his finger.
143111112212111.content:
Kevin sat at the edge of the bed, his foot dangling above the sneaker that Eric was in. Kevin slowly lowered his foot a bit more above the opening in his sneaker. Any light that Eric saw was now blocked by Kevin's massive foot.

The other guys left to the store, leaving Kevin alone in the room. Still half asleep, Kevin sat their debating what he should do in the meantime.

Inside the Adidas, Eric made his way to the heel area. He looked up to see the massive sole that was blocking the opening. He was trying to figure a means of escape when the shoe began to shake back and fourth violently. Above, Kevin had begun to bounce his foot up and down on top of the sneaker. Eric lost his balance and fell down. As he looked up, he saw Kevins foot stomping up and down on the sneaker. Every time the foot came in contact with the outside of the sneaker, Eric's whole world shook sending a tremor and loud thud through the sneaker.

Eric remembered that in his pocket he had a screwdriver. He came up with the idea that if he could poke Kevins foot with the sharp tool, he might be able to make Kevin stop. He dug out the screwdriver from his pocket. He got to his feet in between stomps, reached up into the opening just as Kevins foot came down, and he could hear Kevin above.

"Ouch....dammit....what the hell was that," Kevin said as his foot stopped bouncing. Sunlight finally flooded in to Eric as Kevin removed his foot off the sneaker. Kevin reached down and grabbed the sneaker. Eric could feel himself going up at a high rate of speed. The next thing he saw were huge fingers entering the opening of the sneaker. They were feeling around inside, just inches from Eric. Kevin was inspecting his shoe for the object that might have poked his foot. Feeling the fabric and insides for any sharp object.

Eric watched Kevins fingers probing around and it gave him an idea. It could be risky, but he might be able to latch on to one of Kevins fingers and get the chance to be saved if he is noticed. On the other hand, that might be a bad idea and it would just be safer to keep hiding in Kevin's smelly sneaker. His choice was to....
143111112212111.title: Under Foot

choices: Eric awakened.
Eric still lay unconscious next to Kevin's giant sneaker.
1431111122121111.content:
Eric dodged Kevin's menacing fingers the best he could. The shrunken man decided that he was better off in the giant smelly shoe than to be powerless in Kevin's massive hand. Eric had made the right choice for the moment, without even knowing about how freaked out Kevin got when he saw any kind of small bug. If Kevin saw what he believed was a bug in his hand, he would have probably squashed it to a pulp or slung it to a violent death.

Kevin turned his Adidas in every direction, all the while feeling around inside of the shoe trying to find the sharp object that had stuck his foot. Eric lodged himself as tight as he could in the foul smelling toe of the sneaker and held on the best he could. Somehow, he managed to remain undetected by Kevin's probing fingers.

"Damn it, I know something in there stuck my foot. Where is it?" Kevin mumbled to himself. "I guess it fell out onto the nasty carpet."

Without much thought, Kevin ended his search for the sharp object and tossed his sneaker against the wall. He picked up the remote and tried to turn the TV on. He pointed the remote and pressed the "power" button. Nothing happened. He turned the remote over and discovered the back cover was missing along with the batteries.

"Fuckin damn shit hole," Kevin grumbled as he walked over to the television set and turned it on himself.

Kevin's channel-surfing revealed only two channels clear enough to watch. CNN and the Home Shopping Network. Kevin left the television set tuned to CNN and turned the volume down. He grabbed a pack of cigarettes from a tote-bag and sat down on the bed to have a smoke.

Puny little Eric had been knocked unconscious and thrown violently from the adidas sneaker when it had been thrown against the wall. He lay next to the giant sneaker in a vast jungle of grungy brown shag carpet. Kevin sat on the bed in a daze watching CNN without the sound, smoking and wishing the guys would get back with some more beers.

Zac and the other guys returned, each with a bag in hand full of beer, potato-chips, Oreos and other essentials.

"It's about time you guys got back, I've been bored to tears," Kevin told the guys.

"You could have went with us lazy," James said, and looked over at the television. "When the hell did you start watching CNN?"

"It's that or freakin Home Shopping Network. It won't pick up anything else," Kevin said with frustration. "Hey, I'm starving."

Josh reached into his bag, pulled out a bag of Double-Stuff Oreos and tossed the entire bag to Kevin. Josh and the other guys then dumped their bags of goodies down on a table. Zac began to load up the ice chest with as many cans of beer he could pack inside it.

"Oh cool, Double-Stuff, my favorite," Kevin said with a big satisfied smile. "Hey Zac, throw me a brew."
"Oreos and beer, now that's living the high life," Josh joked.

Tiny unconscious Eric lay precariously next to the wall of the room, vulnerable to any of the giants that might happen to casually walk his way and accidentally stomp out his meager existence.

"No HBO or MTV, what the hell kind of motel is this?" Kevin complained. "I'm going to miss "Jackass" tomorrow night."

"There is not going to be no time for TV you freak," James replied. "We'll either be baking on the beach, or drunk as hell, or both. Besides, CNN is just what you need to expand your horizons a little bit."

At the mention of CNN, Zac looked over at the television set and was startled to see a picture of his older brother put up next to the news anchor. Zac immediately turned up the volume and asked the other guys to keep it down.

"Hey, thats your nerdy brother, ain't it?" Josh asked. "What's he on the news for?"

"Well shut up and lets find out," Zac replied.

The guys listened with great interest to the news story apparently concerning Zac's older brother.

----------"...University Professor and brilliant inventor Eric Brevard has been declared missing by University officials and local authorities. An intense search for Professor Brevard began after he failed to show up for a meeting with an unnamed technology company to discuss funding for a top secret new invention he was working on..."-----------

"Oh my God," Zac exclaimed. "I've got to get home!"

"Don't worry buddy, I'll drive you back," James told Zac. "Kevin and Josh can stay here and I'll return to pick them up later."

"Are you O.K. with that Zac?" Josh asked. "We can all just ditch this hell-hole as far as I'm concerned."

"Nah, it's probably nothing. This is no reason to ruin the trip for all of us," Zac replied. "I'll return with James if nothing is wrong."

Zac and James grabbed their stuff and hurriedly left, leaving Kevin, Josh, and Zac's shrunken brother in the Hotel room.

As Zac slammed the door on his way out:
1431111122121111.title: "This is CNN"

choices: Josh gets up to go to the bathroom
Kevin wakes up and looks for his shoes
14311111221211111.content:
The loud noise made by the slammed door
jolted Eric back to full consciousness.

The teeny man, still groggy, focused on the
nearby humongous sneaker. A distasteful
odor still managed to waft from the interior of
the shoe to be picked up by Eric's nostrils.

Eric heard other noise and noticed two giants
remained in the room. He recognized Kevin
and Josh. There wasn't any sign of his brother
or James.

The giants had flung their enormous bodies
across the motel beds. Kevin looked as if he
might be sleeping. Josh stared at the
enormous television screen.

Eric, too, watched the screen and felt an odd
sense of detachment when an enormous
image came on the screen — a head and
shoulders photo of himself.

"Updating our earlier story on the missing
research scientist," droned a CNN anchor.
"The university where Dr. Brevard is employed
has declined to release details on the nature
of his research. A search of his laboratory has
failed to provide authorities with any leads."

Eric rejoiced. At least the world now knew he
was missing.

"A colleague in the same department told
CNN that Dr. Brevard's work broached some
highly theoretical physics."

"It's no longer a theory!" Eric exclaimed. He
was proof that his experiment worked.

But, now the size of a bug, trapped in a motel
hundreds of miles from his lab, Eric realized
any cause for celebration was premature. But,
he hoped, someone would realize what had
happened to him. And then—

What? Look for him, shrunk to the size of an
insect, hundreds of miles from the scene of
the mishap?

"Where the hell's Zac?" Eric wondered aloud
about his absent brother.

He knew better than to trust Kevin, and frankly
he didn't feel eager to attempt communication
with the enormous Josh.

But his future depended on contacting
someone to help him.

Eric stared at the monstrous youths on the
motel beds.

Suddenly...
14311111221211111.title: Hope?

choices: Josh makes a hasty decision.
Josh hesitates and takes a closer look at the "roach".
143111112212111111.content:
Josh was a typical guy in his early twenties. He was sort of a slacker and never held the same job for long, but he had quite a buff body due to his intense outdoor activities such as skate-boarding, snow-boarding, and water-skiing. High strung but easy to get along with, Josh lived for the moment. He could be ready for any adventure at moments notice.

Typical was not the first word that came to mind when Eric looked up in awe at the gigantic young man sitting on the hotel bed. Josh was as big as a freaking skyscraper to the half-inch tall man. And Eric knew the other giant currently out of sight on the other bed was just as huge and incredible.

Eric started to become fascinated with giant Josh. He wanted to make contact and explore every inch of the young giant. Except for maybe the feet. The shrunken man did not want to have anything to do with any more menacing giant smelly feet.

Eric was so mesmerized by the giant youth as he watched T.V. from the enormous hotel bed, he failed to notice a hideous creature lurking near by.

At three inches, the giant cockroach was about six times bigger than tiny Eric. And this roach was pissed that little Eric was infringing on its territory. The gruesome bug crept up on Eric and silently prepared to destroy the unwanted trespasser.

Little Eric heard a faint rumble nearby in the shag carpet and looked behind him. He was horrified by the monstrous creature rapidly approaching him. In complete terror, Eric began to run as fast as he could through the bulky shag carpeting.

There was no way Eric could outrun the beast. He tripped. The monster was almost on him. It was big and it was nasty. Its horrible antenna was bigger than he was. Eric screamed with all of his might.

"Help me, please help me," Eric screamed and looked away from the horrible creature toward Josh. "Josh, please help me!"

Whether it was coincidence, super-human hearing, or a psychic miracle, it really did not matter. Josh looked over and saw the unusually large roach. Eric was hidden within the dirty brown carpeting, inches away.

In a matter of seconds, Josh jumped up from the bed and within two giant steps, he was on top of the ugly roach. Kevin was startled by Josh's sudden movement and glanced over to see what was going on.

"Oh my God a roach," Kevin exclaimed with a grimace. "Stomp it fast!"

Josh did just that. His gigantic shoe came down on the doomed roach and crushed it instantly. He twisted his shoe and ground the unlucky bug deep into the carpet. Eric stood in complete shock just inches away from Josh's massive shoe. Eric was disgusted as some of the roach remains splattered him.

"That was the biggest damn roach I ever saw," Josh said with a sense of satisfaction from stomping it out of existence. "I wonder if there are any more of them around here?"

"God, I hope not. I can't stand fuckin roaches," Kevin said with disgust. "Oh Yuck Josh, there is another smaller roach right next to your foot. Hurry and stomp it before it gets away!"

"NO! I am not a roach," Eric screamed up at Josh as he witnessed Josh's gigantic shoe begin to lift into the air in preparations for another gratifying stomp. "Josh, please don't kill me!"

Josh looked down at the tiny "roach" as he position his shoe over it and:
143111112212111111.title: ROACH

choices: They try to make a phone call to Zac
They decide to leave for home to find Zac
1431111122121111112.content:
The mammoth sneaker lifted and hovered...

Eric screamed and lifted his arms in an impotent gesture.

"I don't think it is a roach," Josh announced. He lowered his sneaker to the floor a few inches from Eric's location in the filthy brown shag carpet.

"I don't care. A bug's a bug! Stomp it!" Kevin ordered.

Eric, elated by Josh's accurate perception, screamed. "That's right. I'm not a bug. Can't you see that?"

Josh lowered his titanic body over Eric, even getting down on his knees for a better look. "Kevin, it's not a bug. It's— it's wear's clothes! I think it's a little man!"

"Are you freakin' out on me?" Kevin said.

Josh reached out with his huge hand.
"No! No! Be careful!" Eric screamed as two massive fingers pinched about his shoulders and lifted him to an incredible height.

Josh dropped the struggling tiny man onto his open palm. "I am serious, Kevin. Look!"

Eric watched in horror as the unpredictable Kevin loomed closer. The giant squinted. "This is so unbelievable," Kevin said. "It is a tiny man."

On the television screen, there was another segment on Eric's disappearance.

"Still no word on the whereabouts of a missing physics professor," the news anchor announced. "Dr. Eric Brevard, a professor at—"

Josh looked closer. "That's it!" The giant man exclaimed. "Look at him! This is Zac's brother!"

Kevin moved his face closer to the little man in his buddy's palm.

"It can't be!" Kevin insisted.

There was a picture of Eric on the television screen. "I don't understand it, but just look. It is him."

"But he is so tiny!" Kevin said.

"What happened little guy?" Josh asked, looking down at the bug-sized man he held in his palm.

Eric could not believe it. They recognized him.
"Maybe there's a ransom for him," Kevin said.

Josh rolled his eyes. "I think you mean reward."

"Yeah, whatever," Kevin replied.

"How did this happen?" Josh asked.

Eric tried to scream out his story— the accident in the lab, the mishap that landed him in his own brother's shoe — but he could not make himself be heard.

"Why isn't he talking?" Kevin wondered.

"I think he is talking," Josh said. "But he's too small for us to hear him."

"What are we gonna do with him?" Kevin asked.
1431111122121111112.title: Recognition

choices: give dirty little Eric a bath.
play a game of charades with Eric to find out more information.
14311111221211111121.content:
"This is the coolest thing I have ever seen in my entire life," Kevin said as he reached out at the little man Josh held in his massive palm. "Let me hold him."

"I didn't think you liked little things, the way you're always crushing them and stuff," Josh answered, as he pulled his hand and his little captive away from Kevin. Josh looked down at the tiny man in his palm. "Don't worry little fellow, I'll protect you from mean old Kevin just like I did from that nasty roach."

"Oh come on Josh, I hate bugs. But tiny people, that's a different story," Kevin pleaded with Josh. "Please let me hold him!"

Eric was content to stay just where he was. He was beginning to really like Josh, and felt very safe and secure in his giant hand. Had it not been for Josh, little Eric would have ended up in the stomach of some god-awful roach. And Eric did not like what Josh said about Kevin wanting to crush little things.

"O.K. Kevin, but be very careful. Don't squish him or drop him. He is a real person, and Zac's brother," Josh told Kevin as he handed over the miniature man. "I'm going to call Zac on his cell and let him know about all this."

Josh very carefully dropped the fragile little man into Kevin's awaiting hand. Kevin was as excited as a little kid getting a new toy. Eric did not think Kevin would hurt him, but he was quite uneasy as he looked up into Kevin's enormous eyes. Kevin was mesmerized by the little man in his hand. He looked the little guy over while Josh tried to make contact with Zac.

"How did you get so small?" Kevin asked the bug-sized man standing in the palm of his hand. "And how in the world did you end up here with us?"

Kevin's breath was a fierce combination of stale beer and Oreo cookies. And his voice rumbled like thunder. Eric covered his ears as the gigantic young man tried to talk to him.

"I'm sorry little fellow," Kevin whispered as he noticed Eric cover his ears in pain when he spoke. "Are you hungry?"

Eric was starved. He nodded his head and screamed yes at the young giant, and Kevin seemed to understand. Kevin grabbed a piece of Oreo cookie and placed it in his hand next to Eric.

Eric reached over to the piece of Oreo cookie that was almost as big as he was and scooped up a handful of creamy center. Kevin softly laughed as he watched the tiny man eat the cookie.

"Zac, man we found your brother in the motel room, and he's like shrunk. He is as small as a bug," Josh tried to explain to Zac over the telephone. "You and James better get back here quick!"

"I can't believe you're joking at a time like this," Zac replied in a pissed manner. "Are you guys high or something."

"I know it sounds crazy, but I promise it's true," Josh tried to convince Zac. "Your brother is in Kevin's hand, here in the room. He is not even an inch tall. Maybe this has something to do with the secret invention that the news was talking about."

"O.K., I don't believe you, but we will turn around. We are about an hour away," Zac said. "And I know your my best bud and all, but I am going to royally kick your ass for this when we get there. And I'm going to throw all that weed you've been smoking down the toilet."

"You'll see," Josh replied, and hung up the phone. He looked over at Kevin. "Is he doing all right? Zac will kill us if anything happens to him."

While Josh, Kevin, and Eric wait for Zac and James to return, Kevin decided to:
14311111221211111121.title: Kevin is not so bad

choices: Kevin sneezes!
Kevin's sneeze is averted
143111112212111111212.content:
Kevin considered the tiny man in his
hand."Hell, as far as I can tell he's doing all
right," he told Josh.

"Well, be careful with him," Josh cautioned.

"Looks like there should be some way to
communicate with the little bugger...uh, I
mean the little guy," said Kevin, still keeping
his eyes fastened on Zac's miniaturized
brother.

"What would we do? Play charades?" Josh
quipped.

"Hey, that's an idea!" Kevin exclaimed.

He lowered his hand to a nightstand between
the beds, easing the tiny man off his palm and
onto the surface of the huge piece of furniture.

Kevin took a seat on one bed, Josh on the
opposite bed. Both giants stared down at the
terrified little man.

"I've got to stay alive until Zac gets here," Eric
kept telling himself. At least they knew he was
human.

"How did you get so small?" Kevin asked.

"That's a stupid question," Josh snapped. "We
already know that it must have been that
secret invention that's on the news."

Eric leaped up and down. "Yes! Yes! It was the
shrink ray!"

"I think he agrees with me," Josh said in a
smug tone.

"Well, how did you end up here in this motel
room?" Kevin wanted to know.

Eric thought back to how he had accidentally
fallen into Zac's massive sneaker. He had an
idea. He pointed at his own teeny shoes,
trying to pantomime falling into the sneaker.

"He could not have walked here!" Kevin
exclaimed.

"No— not that. I think he's trying to tell us that
he hitched a ride on a shoe. My God! Can you
imagine?"

Eric sighed. Acting out his mishap for the
benefit of the giants had exhausted him. He
sat down on the top of the nightstand.

"Uh-oh— I think something's the matter with
him," Kevin said.

He immediately stretched out his enormous
hand.

"Shit! No!" Eric screamed. "Just leave me the
hell alone!"

His protest went unheard. He soon found
himself back in Kevin's huge hand.

"Don't worry. You're safe now." Kevin smiled
down at him.

Somehow, he doubted that. Kevin didn't strike
him as being blessed with great intelligence.

"Just don't drop him!" Josh warned.

"Who's gonna drop him?" Kevin responded.
"I'll...ahh..ahh..."

"What's wrong?" Josh asked in alarm.

Kevin's huge body was quaking as he tried to
squash down the urge to sneeze — an urge
brought on by a stray collision of a speck of
dust in his left nostril.

"AHH...AHH..." kept coming from Kevin's
mouth.

Eric tried to stay in the center of the enormous
hand as Kevin's body shook violently.

"My God! Put him down!" Josh screamed.
143111112212111111212.title: In Kevin's Safe Keeping?

choices: Josh reached down and took his clothes.
Kevin stuck his finger into the water.
1431111122121111112121.content:
Hurricane Kevin lasted for about one second, but it shook pathetic little Eric to the bone.

In anticipation of the colossal young man's simple sneeze, the miniature man tried in vain to brace himself for what he knew would be an incredible impact. Eric felt Kevin's enormous hand tense up and slightly cup in an effort to protect the tiny man. Eric was horrified as he looked up and saw Kevin's gigantic cavernous mouth slowly open wide while his eyes tightly shut.

Kevin sneezed. Who would have thought a simple sneeze could be so traumatic? But to the insect-sized man cowering in Kevin's mammoth hand, it was spectacular and terrifying.

Just as a reflex, Kevin let the sneeze go right into his hand. Right into the hand where measly little Eric was trapped.

Eric was instantly pummeled by the thunderous force of Kevin's breath. It threw him down in Kevin's massive hand. And just as quickly as it came, Kevin's hurricane sneeze was gone.

Eric was repulsed as he found himself covered with Kevin's saliva and snot. It was gross and disgusting. He wiped some of the horrible sticky substance from his face and looked up at the giant with a defeated and pitiful expression.

"Oh man, that was a monster sneeze," Kevin expressed with pride, but then looked down into his cupped hand with concern. "I am sooooo sorry little fellow. Are you O.K.?"

Eric nodded his head. "I guess it depends on your definition of the word O.K.," Eric pondered to himself with the last bit of humor he could muster. Eric was still alive but far from O.K.

"Oh my God, did you have to sneeze right on him?" Josh declared as he rushed over to check on Zac's tiny brother. "Oh gross man, he's covered with your snot."

"I'm sorry Josh, but he looks like he survived it," Kevin said, trying hard not to laugh. It should not have been funny, but it just was. "We are going to have to clean this little guy up before Zac gets back. Go find something we can wash him in."

Josh located a dirty glass ashtray. He took it to the bathroom and cleaned it thoroughly. Josh adjusted the water ever so carefully in an effort to get a comfortable temperature for Eric, and slightly filled the ashtray with warm water. Josh carefully carried the ashtray and set it down on the night-stand. Kevin began to lower little Eric to the ashtray and said, "you're gettin a bath little fellow."

Kevin gently placed Zac's tiny brother on the edge of the ashtray and said in a mocking tone, "Now don't be shy, we are all guys here."

Eric felt the warmth of the refreshing clean water within the ashtray and jumped right in, clothes and all. The warm clean water was invigorating. The water was about neck level. The bug-sized man submerged his body in an effort to remove all of Kevin's remaining fluids.

The tiny half-inch tall man removed his clothes and set them on the ledge of the ashtray, temporarily oblivious to the fascinated giants looming far above, observing his every move. Eric began an energized swim to the center of the pool-sized bathtub. This was by far the best he had felt since the horrific shrinking accident back at the university.

Eric was suddenly startled from his blissful swim when:
1431111122121111112121.title: A Simple Sneeze

choices: Zac and James return.
The phone rang.
14311111221211111121211.content:
"Ah, no...what are you doing? Stop. Don't," tiny Eric screamed from the middle of the massive ashtray as Josh reached down and gently took his clothes from the edge of the ashtray. "Come on guys, thats not funny."

Josh looked at the tiny clothes in the palm of his hand in total amazement. "I'm going to dry these with my hair-dryer. What don't you find our little friend something to towel off with."

Josh took Eric's little clothes to the bathroom. He was just trying to be nice but now Eric felt twice a vulnerable as before. Naked and a little scared, he looked up and saw giant Kevin glaring down at him. Eric was unnerved and embarrassed as he realized he was in the complete and total control of these mischievous young giants until his brother returned.

"Humm, a towel?" Kevin said to himself, pondering what he could find for the tiny man to use to dry himself off. "Oh, I know."

Kevin took a single Kleenex from the dispenser next to the sink and tore off a small square from the corner. Kevin took the Kleenex pieces back to Eric's temporary giant bathtub and happily announced to his new little friend, "Hey little guy, look what I've got for you."

Eric was happy the guys were trying to take care of him, but they were making him feel like a pet or a small child. He realized he must be a real curiosity for these guys. All Eric wanted now was for Zac to return and take him back to his lab where he could repair his invention and return to normal.

* * *

Meanwhile,

* * *

"No Sir, we have not located the professor yet. We notified the police immediately when he failed to show up for our planned meeting."

"Do not tell the authorities anything. I am going to send in our people for this. Meet the helicopter in forty-five minutes. Do you think the Professor could be negotiating with another company?"

"I was assured we were the only ones he had spoken to."

"Damn, how could this have happened?"

"Don't worry Sir, we will secure the device at any cost."

"Failure can not be an option. Do whatever it takes to get me that device."

"Yes sir."

* * *

Back at the hotel:

* * *

"O.K. little fella, are you ready to dry off?" Kevin whispered to little Eric as he reached down to pull the teeny naked figure from the water. "Don't be scared, I won't hurt you."

Eric was startled as Kevin's massive fingers reached into his giant pool of water and easily picked him up high into the air. Next, he gasped as he fell a small distance onto a giant Kleenex that Kevin had placed in the palm of his hand. He regained his balance, stood up and reached out for what seemed like a towel Kevin was holding out for him. It was sort of thick, but it worked just fine. Eric was happy to be clean again.

"Man, put the little fella down, I'm sure he is getting a little tired of you holding him so much," Josh said as he returned with Eric's now dry clothes. "How about some clean, dry stuff to wear little guy?"

"Oh, man look at how tiny his shoes are," Kevin said with fascination as he reluctantly put Zac's tiny brother on the night-stand. "I don't think he minds me holding him. I just think he is so cool."

"Zac and James should be back soon," Josh said with a sigh. "Do you think you can keep from sneezing on the little guy until then?"

"Very funny asshole," Kevin replied. "When this is all over, I think I will get Zac's brother to shrink you Josh. I need a new pet to play with."

"I don't think so my friend," Josh said with a laugh. "But it would be cool to be shrunk for a while. Snow-boarding down that hill in my back yard would be like snow-boarding down Mt. Everest."

As Kevin and Josh pondered the thought of being shrunk, tiny Eric got dressed.

Then,
14311111221211111121211.title: Clean and Fresh

choices: After three hours, the guys reach the college.
James gets pulled over for speeding.
143111112212111111212111.content:
Eric felt re-energized after he put on his clean, dry clothes. For the first time, the shrunken Professor felt a sense of hope that this nightmare would turn out O.K. after all. Kevin and Josh knew who he was, and they seemed intent on looking out after him. The teeny man just had to wait for his brother to return, and Zac would take him back to the University so he could use his shrink-ray to return to normal size.

Eric noticed the two giants had temporarily neglected him to discuss the prospects of being shrunk. They had become extremely intrigued by the idea. Eric was happy not to be focus of all their attention anymore. He decided to explore the table-top to pass the time a little.

"Wouldn't you trust me to take care of you while you were shrunk?" Kevin asked Josh. "You could really try some extreme sports at that size."

"I don't know, that is really tiny. You could accidentally squish me and not even know it," Josh answered. "And besides, I wouldn't want you to hold me so much like you were doing to Zac's brother."

"Oh man, I promise I would not let anything happen to you buddy," Kevin replied. Kevin was really getting off on the idea of having a tiny Josh in his control. "Except maybe if you were bad, I might have to put you in my shoe or something. You know, just to let you know who's boss."

"Yeah right," Josh said with a laugh. "That would kill me. There is no way I'll be shrunk where you could get your hands on me."

"We will see about that," Kevin mumbled under his breath as he looked down to check on Eric.
"Hey, where do you think you're going little fellow?"

Kevin reached down and put his hand next to the tiny man, blocking any further exploration. He then pinched Eric by his shirt, lifted him and put him back in his original spot on the table.

The tiny man felt a little mad and frustrated that anything he did had to be with giant Kevin's permission. Then Eric jumped back as Kevin's enormous hand reached for him again.

"I better just hold you till Zac gets back," Kevin said with a smile as he returned the bug-sized man to his palm. Josh just rolled his eyes.

A knock slightly startled everyone in the room. Zac and James had returned. Josh let them in while Kevin remained sitting on the bed with his little captive secure in his giant hand.

"O.K., where is my tiny brother," Zac said with a sarcastic tone. "Or should I say where's the bag of weed?"

"Kevin has him in his hand," Josh answered, pointing at Kevin. "Go look for yourself."

"Oh fuck!" Zac exclaimed as he looked into Kevin's hand at his minuscule big brother. "What the hell happened to you?"

Eric was relieved when he saw his brother's giant face, but the boom in his voice knocked him on his back. Luckily Kevin's massive palm was soft.

"Not so loud," Kevin said. "You are scaring the little guy."

"As far as we can tell, he was shrunk by one of his inventions, and got here by hitching a ride in one of our shoes," Josh explained. "And he is pretty lucky, I saved him just before a big ole roach got a hold of him."

"That's it, he must have gotten in my shoe when I went to look for him at his office," Zac thought aloud. "And I did notice a strange machine and a lot of computer equipment in there."

"That must be it. He is nodding his head," Kevin told everyone.

"We've got to get him back there and return him to normal size," Zac said with enthusiasm.

"Sounds like a plan," James said, still amazed. "Let's pack up the Tracker and get the hell out of here."

"Where can we put him for the trip?" Zac asked with concern. "He is so small."

"Don't worry, I'll hold on to him," Kevin answered. "Besides, I think he trusts me."

Josh knew better but decided not to make a big deal about it. Zac agreed to the idea and the guys left without even checking out, Kevin carefully holding Zac's tiny brother in his hand.

"I've got to get away from this guy," the tiny man thought to himself, totally in the control of Kevin's huge hand. "Oh well, it should be over soon."
143111112212111111212111.title: Please Get Me Away From Kevin

choices: The guys reach Eric's office and sneak in undetected.
A man in a black suit stops the guys.
1431111122121111112121111.content:
Even though Kevin's giant palm felt like a sweltering sauna, Eric found himself drifting off to sleep. He was a temporary prisoner to this gargantuan young man, but at least he felt safe.

"This is getting ridiculous," Josh said, breaking the silence. "Hand the little guy over to me for a while."

"But he likes me," Kevin replied, moving his hand closer in a defensive stance. "Besides, he is sleeping. You will just wake him up."

"I'm the one who save him from that fucking roach," Josh exclaimed. "And you just wanted me to stomp on him like some bug. I hate to imagine what would have happened if the little fellow got anywhere near your freaking feet. You would have thought he was a horrible bug and squashed him just like all those other bugs you obliterated."

"Knock it off, you guys," Zac broke in. "What's important now is that we get back to that machine and see if we can return my brother to his old size. Anyway he is my brother. Hand him over to me. I have not had a real good look at him yet."

Kevin seemed to pout for a second, and then reluctantly turned over his little captive to Zac. Tiny Eric fell into his giant brother's hand and looked up into his enormous face. The minuscule man stood up waved with both hands at his king-sized younger brother.

Zac saw his tiny brother waving at him from the palm of his hand and smiled. "Don't worry bro, we are going to get you fixed up." Zac was fascinated as he studied the truly tiny features of his shrunken brother. "So, if we get you back to the machine in your office, can we turn you back to normal size?" Eric nodded his head frantically to confirm Zac's statement. "Cool," Zac said.

* * *

"Authorities still have no leads in the mysterious disappearance of Eric Brevard. An intense search has been going on for hours, and plans are for it to continue long into the night. As you might remember, Professor Brevard was the inventor of the controversial vector-chip, which allowed government satellites the ability to track anyone on earth with pin-point accuracy. Confidential sources tell us that Professor Brevard was on the verge of a break-through discovery, and was in negotiations to sell his invention to the reclusive billionaire H. R. Grumble. Back to you Connie."

"Is there any information on the nature of the new invention?" Connie Chung questioned the on-site reporter. "I mean just between you and me."

"Not as of yet, Connie."

"Please keep us informed......And up next.....The Adkins diet for your pet. Dr. Adkins will be here with his latest diet for pets. So stay tuned."

* * *

The room was dim, illuminated entirely from the lights of a vast array of computers. Several large screen plasma monitors adorned one of the walls. A lone man sat in a comfortable chair behind an expensive desk, and stared out without emotion. He picked up his phone and pressed one button.

"I see there has been a leak. You know I don't like leaks."

"Sir, I don't know how it happened. It was not from our end."

"Have you seen the device?"

"I got a glimpse. Cops are swarming all around the place. And this has become a media event."

"I don't want the government getting involved in this."

"Sir, may I ask, what does the device do?"

"The device will change the world as we know it. That is all I can say over the phone. Has the team arrived?

"Yes sir."

"If the Professor has not turned up in 24 hours, revert to plan B."

"Yes sir, you can count on me."

H. R. Grumble ended the call, put his hand to his face and pondered with an evil grin, "King of Earth, that has a nice ring to it."

* * *

"Fuck, there are cops everywhere," James blurted out as he pulled into the parking lot adjacent to the science building. "How are we going to get into your brother's office?"

"The computer lab is open 24 hours," Zac answered. "We will sneak in from there."

"Oh man, this is going to be a blast," Josh exclaimed, excited at the thought of the upcoming adventure.

Zac gently placed his tiny brother in his shirt pocket. "Eric, you will be safe in here until we get to your office. James, you stay with the tracker until we get back."

"Kevin, Josh, lets roll!" Zac burst out with a confident tone.

Zac, Kevin, and Josh entered the science building through the computer lab. They snuck into a stairwell and headed up to the third floor and Eric's office.
1431111122121111112121111.title: Let's Roll

14311111221211111121211111.content:
"We made it," Josh whispered as the three young men quietly entered the room. "Close the door."

"This must be it," Kevin said as he examined the shrink ray device in the corner of the room. "So cool, now get over there Josh, I am about to shrink ya."

"Stop kidding around you guys," Zac pleaded. "Let's see if we can get this thing turned on."

"This end looks like it's broken. There is shattered glass all over the floor," Kevin informed Zac as he continued his examination of the fascinating device.

Zac had taken his brother out of his pocket and carefully placed him on a counter. He looked down at his half-inch tall brother and noticed him pointing to a cabinet. "Hey Josh, my brother is pointing to that cabinet. Check it out."

"Will do," Josh said and opened the cabinet. He reached in and pulled out a shiny circular glass object. "Look what I found."

"Awesome Josh, now see if you can place that on the machine in the right place," Zac instructed.

Josh went over to the shrink ray, and attempted to insert the focusing lens. "Hey, it screws right in."

"Great, now stand back. I'm going to crank this sucker up," Zac said with heavy anticipation.

All three guys and Eric held their breath as Zac hit the power button on the console. Zac let out a gasp as the control panel lit up and the device made a low humming sound.

"Password?" Josh exclaimed, his eyes glued to the monitor above the control panel. "Your brother is way too small to tell us the password. We can't hear a single word he says."

"No problem," Zac replied with a satisfied grin. "My brother has used the same password since sixth grade. Just type in 3.14159."

"You mean Pi?" Josh asked as he entered the numbers on the keyboard. "That is a lame password."

Eric stared at the young giants in disbelief. They were a lot smarter than he gave them credit for. And his younger brother was really coming through for him.

Zac looked at the monitor and noticed;

OPTION 2: REVERSE LAST PROCESS

"This is way too easy," Zac thought with a bit of relief. "Kevin, put my brother on the platform."

"Just one last time in Kevin's hand. Thank God," the tiny Professor mumbled to himself as Kevin's gigantic hand effortlessly reached for him.

"Here goes!" Zac said as he held his breath and squinted his eyes. Kevin and Josh looked on in amazement. Zac pressed the enter button.

The room filled with bright green light, and a light smoke filled the room. The smoke cleared within seconds and Zac looked over at the platform and his brother. He had been restored to normal size. Zac, Kevin, and Josh stood motionless, in complete disbelief.

After a few seconds of dizziness, Eric looked around the room and his normal surroundings. He pumped his fist and let out an intense "YEAH!"

Eric saw his speechless brother at the console and gave him a great big smile. He then ran over and grabbed hold of Zac and gave him a bear-hug that lasted for well over a minute. Eric was nearly in tears. "You really came through for me little brother."

"Hey, how about some love over here," Josh said with a chuckle.

Eric reached over and gave Josh and Kevin a firm hand shake. "Thanks, you guys are the best!"

Kevin could not believe this was the same man he had held in his hand just moments earlier.

"Let's go to my apartment. I've got a couple six packs in the fridge and I owe you guys a drink," Eric told the guys. "Plus I need to think about things for a while."

"We all need to chill for a while," Kevin agreed. "Let's go. James is waiting for us outside in his Tracker."

As the men entered the stairwell, Kevin noticed a police officer headed in the direction of the office.

"Go on guys, I'll catch up in a minute. I left something in the office," Kevin told the guys already headed down the stairs.

"Just hurry up," Zac said.

Kevin walked right up to the young rookie cop. He looked like he was fresh out of the academy.

"What's up?" Kevin asked the cop.
