But, they also represented his last hope. Without some giant coming to his assistance, he would never be able to return to his laboratory and restore his size.

“Hey, guys!” Eric yelled. He took a few reluctant steps away from the sneaker. “Look down. Here on the floor...” The tiny man gulped. “Here between your feet.”

“Put on your shoes and we’ll go out back and shoot some hoops,” said Kevin’s friend Tony, a tall youth with blond hair and size 14 feet.

Eric saw Frank’s hand reach down. “Oh fuck!” The tiny man ran berserkly.

A red and white Adidas sneaker stomped down inches to his left. He began to run in the opposite direction only to have Frank’s familiar sneaker crash down directly in his path.

Eric hesitated and tried to pick a safe path when he looked up just before the size 14 sneaker sole stomped down directly on top of him.

Tony didn’t even feel the little squish as he stepped down. “And don’t forget my birthday party on Saturday,” Tony reminded his friends.

Although the biggest boy in the group, he was also the youngest. He wouldn’t turn 15 for another two days.

Of course, Tony had no way of knowing how one small step on his part had proven such a big disaster for a brilliant scientist.

Despite his brains and brilliance, Eric lost everything because of one 14-year-old boy who didn’t watch where he stepped.
143111112212112122121222.title: Because of Tony

choices: hands Zac a new bulb to replace the burned out one.
says, "I'll have our handyman take care of it right away."
The clerk promises to see to it personally
1431111122121122.content:
Kevin, perturbed and disgusted at the thought of a nasty bug in his shoe, carried his giant Adidas sneaker with the trapped tiny passenger towards the grungy old cracked tile floor in the bathroom. He lowered his massive sneaker to the floor and quickly tilted the opening upside down in an effort to dump out the unwanted pest.

Eric was terrified as he was thrown violently about the massive sneaker by some unknown giant friend of his brother Zac. The meager little man's frantic screams for help went unnoticed by the four gargantuan young men.

Zac held up his last can of beer in order to guzzle down the few remaining drops, unaware of the gruesome fate about the befall his older brother at the foot of one of his buddies. Though irresponsible and sometimes lazy, Zac loved his older brother. His brother had gotten Zac out of a lot of jams in the past. But how was Zac to know his shrunken brother had stowed away in his shoe all the way to the beach and was now about to be dumped out of his buddy Kevin's shoe and squashed to death like an insignificant little bug.

Kevin's Adidas sneaker lurched upside down and Eric fell to the dirty tile floor. The bug-sized man was briefly stunned by the considerable fall, but when he looked up at the sinister expression of giant Kevin, Eric was shocked back into his nightmarish reality.

The tiny Professor continued his cries for help. He waved his arms at the titanic young man standing in front of him and pleaded for his life. He saw his little brother Zac outside the bathroom and screamed for help. But Eric's faint screams were indiscernible to the giants.

"Damn bug," Kevin mumbled under his breath as he reached over to turn the bathroom light on. "I'm going to take care of you. You won't be crawling in no shoes no more."

Kevin flicked the switch and nothing. The light had burned out. Only the dim lights of the hotel room carried slightly into the bathroom. "Fucking rat-hole," Kevin exclaimed as he toggled the switch a few times. The other guys just laughed at Kevin.

"Just stomp that damn bug and let's go," pleaded James. "We'll stop by the office and tell them about the burned out light before we head to the store."

Kevin looked down with disgust at the bug sized shadowy creature below him, and then smiled.

When Eric saw this, he sensed his impending doom and stopped screaming and waving at the giant. The little man quickly looked around and surveyed the darkened room in an effort to plan an escape route.

Suddenly Eric was horrified as Kevin raised his enormous sneaker directly over him and hesitated for just a second. Eric ran for his life. The hideously large sneaker crashed down on the bathroom floor with a violent crash. A combination of the slight darkness and Kevin's small hesitation enabled the bug-sized Professor to narrowly escape a revolting death. But Kevin was relentless.

"Damn, I missed," Kevin said in disappointment as he saw the small shadowy creature running in the direction of the darkest end of the bathroom.

Kevin stomped again, and missed again.

"I can't see shit in here," exclaimed Kevin as he stood and continued to stomp with his Adidas sneaker on one foot, and holding the other sneaker in his hand. "I'm not staying in this room with a damn bug running around."

"Come on now, we'll take care of the bug when we get back," Zac demanded and then looked over and whispered to Josh, "It's probably not the only bug in this place."

Josh smiled and nodded in agreement. Kevin gave in and ended his pursuit of the obnoxious bug. He put on his remaining sneaker, and headed out with the guys. He was visibly pissed about not killing the bug. He just silently fumed.

Eric breathed a sigh of relief as he watched monster-like Kevin and the other hulking young men leave the hotel room. But his fight for his very life left him completely exhausted. Back in the darkened bathroom he laid down on the tiled floor and passed out.

Zac stopped at the office and informed the clerk of the burned out light.

The clerk:
1431111122121122.title: Almost Squished by Kevin

14311111221211221.content:
Zak took the bulb from the clerk.

"Im gonna go back to the room and take care of the bathroom light," Zak said. "You guys go on without me, and I will be waiting there when you come back from the store."

"Suit yourself Zak," Kevin said. "If you wanna work while you're on vacation have fun. We will see ya when we get back. If that bug should happen to show itself, save it. We have a little unfinished business"

"Bug?," the clerk broke into the conversation.

"Yea, I found it in my shoe back in the room," Kevin said. "Im gonna take care of it though. But you should really get someone into this dump to spray for those pests. I really hate them!"

The guys walked out of the office. Kevin, James, and Josh, went to the truck. Zak headed back to the room preparing to replace the bulb in the bathroom.

Zak got back to the room and walked into the dark bathroom. Eric still passed out on the floor didnt hear or notice his younger brother come in. The light was just a little too high, so Zak went into the other room to get a chair to stand on. As he drug the chair in, the loud noise on the tile floor startled Eric out of his sleep. There was just enough light coming in from the other room that when Eric jumped to his feet, a large letter N was staring him in the face. He recognized it immediately as his brothers New Balance sneaker. He went to reach for it, but just as he did it raised up into the air out of sight. He looked way up into the darkness and was barely able to make out the silhouette of his brother standing on a chair high above.

Eric realized he must be replacing the light that didnt work before when Kevin was trying to squash him. With a few twists, Zak had the old bulb out and the new one in. Eric just stood in awe looking at his brother high above. Maybe since he was alone without crazy Kevin around, he could get his brothers attention.

Zak finished up, but instead of stepping off the chair he jumped down. He landed on the floor with a thump. The impact caused a tremor on the floor for Eric, that knocked him off his feet. He was getting back to his feet, when he was suddenly blinded by the bathroom light. Zak had walked over and turned it on. Eric put his hands up to try and block it, but it didnt help. After a few seconds he lowered his hands and his eyes adjusted. He was standing near one of the legs of the chair. He looked up to see his younger brother towering above. Zak walked over and took hold of the chair. He started to move it and happend to glance down at the floor when he did. Eric saw this and began yelling and waving his hands. Zak moved in a little closer.

"So there you are you little bugger," he said. "Stay right where you are."

Eric continued trying to get his brothers attention. He was just too small to hear his screams for help. He watched his brother walk over to the sink and pick something up. Eric was just too intent on getting to his brother he didnt realize what was going on. Zak grabbed a cup off the sink and was coming back over to Eric. To his dismay, Zak lowered the cup over top of Eric and trapped him inside.

"Kevin will be happy I found you little bug," Zak said. "We would not have heard the end of it if he missed the chance to finally squash you."

Zak lowered himself to look inside the cup at Eric. Eric was beating on the cup. The nightmare that was happening was making him go hysterical. He didnt wanna die.

"Boy, you are a strange looking little thing," Zak said inspecting his little prisoner inside the cup. "I feel sorry for ya little guy. Kevin is not gonna show you any mercy. I guarantee it will be quick though, so it shouldnt be too bad I guess."

Eric just looked into his brothers eyes thru the cup. "Its me Zak, Eric," he pleaded. "Dont let me die....please."

"Well you stay put little guy," Zak said in a semi sweet kind of way. "They will be back soon."

That was the last thing that Eric wanted to hear. He watched his brother get to his feet and exit the bathroom, turning off the light. Eric just sat there, waiting his impending fate.

About 20 minutes later, Eric heard voices from the other room. They were back. He could hear Zak saying something to the effect of I found it. Then he could hear Kevin asking where, as he heard footsteps coming his way. The light came on, and he saw his brother first. His huge New Balance sneakers passing by Eric and his small prison. Next came Kevin. For added effect, Kevin stomped down hard with each step he took.
The two other guys stood in the doorway.

"I found it after I changed the light bulb," Zak said to Kevin. "I trapped it under the cup for you to take care of."

"Good thing you did," Kevin said. "I have a little payback to administer with the help of my size 11 Adidas."

"Quit your yapping and just get it over with," James chimed in. Josh nodded his head in agreement. "Yea, show it whos's boss already, so we can go drink our brews."

Kevin took his sneaker and kicked the cup off of Eric. Eric watched as Kevin raised his foot into the air and brought it over top of him. As it started to come down toward him, Eric took of running toward the door where Josh and James were. Kevins foot came down with a bang. Missing Eric again. As Eric got closer to the other guys, Josh brought his foot down right in Erics path. Eric stopped short. He turned around and was running back in the direction of Kevin. He watched as Kevin raised his foot again, and as Eric ran under him, the foot lowered again with a crash. Another miss.

Eric was now running toward Zak. His brother was his only chance left. He was yelling and waving his arms back and fourth in hopes his brother would finally notice. As he got closer to Zak he watched as his New Balance raised off the floor. Just as he got within a few inches of Zak, the sneaker came flying down.

The last thing Eric saw were the worn treads of his brothers sneaker as it came down on top of him. With a loud crunch, Zak's sneaker came to rest on the tile floor, and on top of what was left of his older brother.

"What the hell did you do that for," Kevin sneered. "That little shit was mine."

"We didnt have all night for you to show how macho you are over a little measly bug," Zak retorted. "It was coming right at me like it knew me. Guess I just have better aim."

The guys all started laughing at that. "You sure its dead Zak," James questioned. Zak looked down to his sneaker and twisted it back and fourth on the tile floor. Grinding it down.

"It is now man," Zak chuckled. "Now lets go have a damn beer." "Hell yea," they all replied.

All that remained of Zaks older brother was a spot on the tile floor along with some goo still stuck in the treads of his sneaker.
14311111221211221.title: Oh Brother

14311111221211222.content:
Eric slumbered in a deep sleep, completely oblivious to the humongous work-boot that had just missed crushing him by a few inches. The gigantic work-boots continued their random movement around the sleeping tiny man, Eric somehow lucky enough to not be crushed.

The worn dirty heels raised high into the air, just inches from the vulnerable teensy-tiny Professor. Then suddenly the room was filled with bright light, and the gargantuan heels came crashing back down to the bathroom floor with a bone-jarring thud.

"Thats got it," the Handyman said to himself quite satisfied with his work.

Just as the Handyman was about to leave, he looked down and noticed a small creature next to one of his massive work-boots.

A violent crash and sudden intense light startled little Eric awake. He looked up in complete awe at the colossal god-like giant that loomed high over him. And then he could not help but notice the threateningly huge work-boots directly in front on him.

Suddenly the giant looked down at tiny Eric and he was petrified with fear. Before he could move, and before he could even scream, the appalling whopper of a boot lifted just slightly off the ground, hovering. Then, in an instant, the nightmarish boot was right on top of the bug-sized man. Time seemed to freeze. The next three seconds seemed like minutes. And then it was all over. The giant casually stomped down, creating an insignificant crunch, barely audible.

The Handyman took a small piece of toilet paper from the roll, and wiped the tiny smear off his work-boot. He tossed it in the toilet, flushed, and headed back to the office.

"Did you take care of the burned out light in 17?" the clerk asked.

"Yeah, no problem," the Handyman replied. "And we've got to do something about all the bugs around here. I just stomped on one in 17."

"I'll get an exterminator in here tomorrow," the clerk promised.

***

"Has anyone seen Professor Brevard?" Don asked a few Professors in the teacher's lounge. "The people from Microsoft are here to discuss the grant for his new invention."

"Microsoft?!" one Professor exclaimed in admiration. "I guess Eric's boat has finally come in. All that hard work paid off after all."

***

Ray removed his work-boots after a long day's work at the Hotel and noticed the little red smear on the bottom of one.

"Yuck!", he thought to himself, and then plopped down in his easy chair to watch some TV.
14311111221211222.title: Has Anyone Seen Professor Brevard?

choices: Eric escapes the tire
Does Eric escape the tire?
14311111221212.content:
As Zac and his friends returned from the beach, teeny Eric was caught in the open among the trio of giants.
As if the three giants didn’t pose enough risk, Kevin got off the bed and grabbed his Adidas sneakers, slipping them back onto his bare feet.
“So, what’s the plan?” Kevin asked.

“We thought we’d go get something to eat,” answered Josh. He walked toward the bed.
Eric, watching the giant’s sneakers stomp toward him, dodged out of the way. He careened through the forest of brown shag making up the motel room’s old carpeting.

Josh took a seat on the bed next to Kevin. “Ready to go, buddy? We’re all starving.”

“Sure,” Kevin said.

••••••

“No! Help!” Eric screamed. “Please, hear me. Help!”

He knew he didn’t have much time to act. Dangling close to him was one of the laces from Josh’s sneaker. Without even stopping to think about his action, Eric grabbed onto the lace and began climbing.

He reached the surface of the massive sneaker without any problem.

But, when Josh lurched into motion, he was forced to hang on for dear life.

••••••

The friends got outside the motel room and started toward the parking lot. Unobserved, tiny Eric tried to remain atop Josh’s bucking sneaker.

A tiny pebble in the path was enough to cause Josh to stumble ever so slightly. He quickly regained his balance.

But bug-sized Eric, unable to resist the sudden braking, was thrown free of the sneaker, landing hard on the pavement.

No sooner than did he make his painful impact with the pavement than he looked up to see a huge New Balance sneaker slam down next to him. His own brother’s shoe had almost stomped him into oblivion.

“Zac! Zac!” Eric cried. “Help me.”

But his brother and friends got into their vehicle.

Eric, listing the inventory of his painful bumps and bruises, was just getting to his feet when he heard the unbelievably loud roar of the engine.

The vehicle was backing out of its space, one of its rear tires heading right toward tiny Eric.
14311111221212.title: Unsuccessful Sneaker Ride

choices: Jack and Rusty go fishing.
Rusty's truck won't start.
143111112212121.content:
Since he knew the colossal tire would pulverize him, Eric had to move, and fast. Bruised and battered, the tiny man limped as fast as he could in an effort to escape the crushing tire.

Somehow, Eric managed to move just out of the way of the life-ending mass of black rubber. The Geo Tracker whizzed by him, creating a whirlwind that blew the pitiful little Professor backwards about ten feet. And in an instant, Eric's brother Zac and his buddies were gone. The helpless half-inch tall man had been left, stranded in the parking lot of run down hotel.

Eric looked up in awe at a colossal red pick-up truck that was parked in the space next to him.
The tiny man was frustrated. Even the curb was about fifty foot high. He had no idea what to do, or where to go. He was so out in the open and vulnerable. Any kind of shelter seemed miles away. The tiny man soon began to realize he was in big trouble.

Eric felt the ground begin to rumble, and heard thunderous voices that seemed to be getting closer and closer. He was getting very scared. He was terrified when he turned and looked in the direction of the voices. Two pairs of enormous, house sized boots were heading right for him. Above the boots were two giants that chilled the bug-sized man to the bone. Eric looked around frantically for some shelter, but there was none. And the four all-powerful crushing forces were just about on him.

Jack and Rusty had checked into the hotel a bit late and were ready to do some fishing and drinking, not necessarily in that order. The two self-described rednecks were in their late twenties, and both guys were pretty buff, since they worked construction. They loved to fish and they loved to drink even more. They got away whenever they could, and this beach was a cheap place to come.

The two guys headed out for Rusty's red pick-up truck, trying to carry all their necessities to the truck in one trip. Arms loaded with a cooler of beer, a tackle box, and fishing rods, the two buddies stumbled their way in the direction of the truck.

"Let's go to that secluded spot on the back water," Jack told Rusty as he approached the curb of the parking lot. "We had a lot of luck there last time."

"Sounds good to me," Rusty replied. " Let's just ah oh no aaah."

Rusty failed to notice the approaching curb, stumbled and fell to the hard pavement. The tackle box he was carrying hit the ground, and all the contents went flying out onto the pavement.

"Oh shit Rusty, are you all right?" Jack asked as he reached out his hand to pull his buddy back up. "You should watch where you are going, you damn drunk."

"Yeah, yeah, just help me get everything back into this tackle box, and let's get out of here," Rusty said with a frustrated tone. "Oh hell, the bait can came open!"

Eric screamed as he saw the giant topple to the ground, seeming to come right down on him. Eric just missed being crushed to oblivion by the falling behemoth. The box the giant was carrying hit the ground with a crash, and flung open, scattering its giant contents all around the bug-sized man. A giant metal can landed with a crash right next to Eric, and the lid had fallen off. Black moist dirt from the strange can surrounded the tiny man, and he found himself covered in it.

Eric was repulsed and terrified as he saw a gruesome monster emerge from the black dirt.

"Oh my God, a giant worm!" Eric screamed as the hideous creature brushed the side of him, leaving a horrible, sticky residue. "Somebody please help me. Get me out of here."

Eric looked around in horror and saw giant worms all around him. And then a far worse horror appeared.

Eric screamed pathetically as a gigantic hand descended from the vast sky and began to scoop up the black dirt and hideous worms back into the metal can.

The tiny man's screams were to no avail as the enormous hand also scooped him up with the rest of the worms. Eric found himself in the bottom of the horrible metal can, surrounded by moist black dirt and hideous giant worms. Just when the bait-sized man thought it could not get any worse, everything went pitch black. And then he felt another worm brush up against him.

"There, thats got it," Rusty exclaimed as he scooped up the last of the bait into the can and tightly screwed on the top. "Let's jet."
143111112212121.title: Bait

choices: The currents carry Eric to land.
Eric floats out into the channel.
1431111122121211.content:
Rusty and Jack loaded up the truck and took off to a favorite fishing spot, unaware of the unlucky little stowaway that had been accidentally trapped in their bait can. Jack cranked up the local country station, and the two men chatted about the upcoming Nascar race.

Eric was repulsed by the sticky residue left by the horrible worms as they continuously brushed up against him. In the darkness, he tried to find a spot in the horrid can away from the nasty creatures, but there were just too many of them. The shrunken Professor tried to wipe off the disgusting worm fluids, but it was like super-glue, and it was also causing the black dirt that surrounded him to stick to his body.

After a while, the horrible giant worms seemed to settle down, giving Eric a chance to rest and ponder this new nightmarish reality he found himself in. Eric thought to himself that once the giants opened the can and saw him, he would be saved. They would surely help him. Eric tried once again to brush some of the dirt off his body, but gave up from pure exhaustion. The super-tiny man wondered what the giants would think when they looked into the can and saw him.

Then a frightful thought came to Eric's mind, but it was just too horrible to even consider. The tiny man tried to brush it aside and think more positive thoughts. "Surely they will recognize that I am a person," Eric hoped. He then tried with a renewed vigor to remove some of the dirt stuck to him, in hopes to look more humanly.

Rusty turned down a dirt road and pulled up to an old forgotten pier, at the end of a back-water channel.

"Finally here," Jack sighed, and grabbed the beer and his fishing rod, and walked to the edge of the wooden plank pier. "Come on slow-poke."

Rusty followed with the tackle box and his fishing rod.

"It's only fair that I give you a head start," Rusty said with a chuckle. He sat down next to Jack at the end of the pier and danged his feet over the side. "Hand me a brew."

The two men had finished their first beer before Rusty opened the tackle box.

"I think I'll use a float today," Rusty said, as he reached into the tackle box. He began to attach the red and white float just above the hook on his fishing rod.

"Whatever," Jack said. "Just hand me the bait."

Without even looking, Jack opened the bait can and reached inside. He firmly gripped one of the worms between his thumb and forefinger and proceeded to bait his hook. The worm thrashed violently as the dagger-like hook was thrust through its body. Jack handed the bait can back to Rusty, cast his line, and opened another beer.

Eric was startled by the bright light that flooded the metal can when the top was removed. He looked up and saw the giant, but the colossal man did not even glance at him. "Please help me," little Eric screamed as loud as he could.

And then the giant man started to reach into the can. Eric was horrified as the intimidating giant fingers searched the can randomly for an object to grab hold of. The menacing fingers brushed against him, but just when Eric thought he was about to be grabbed, the fingers firmly pinched a worm next to him, and lifted it out of the can high into the air. Eric heard the worm seem to cry out in pain as the powerful fingers squeezed and lifted the helpless doomed creature.

Eric watched in horror as the giant effortlessly jabbed his fish hook into the unlucky worm. Suddenly, the can shifted, and Eric looked up to see a different giant.

Just like Jack, Rusty had so much practice, he could bait his hook with his eyes closed. He reached into the bait can, and firmly grabbed hold of what he thought was a worm. In a matter of seconds, he attached the bait to his hook and cast his line. He could see the float bob along in the water.

Eric screamed as this new set of giant fingers firmly grabbed him and lifted him towards the horrible fish-hook. The giant had not even looked at him while attaching him to the horrible razor-sharp fish-hook. Eric thought it was over, but the hook had not pierced his body. It had just caught hold of his clothes. Just as Eric considered his good luck, he was thrust with great velocity through the air. He was flying, but he sure didn't feel like Superman.

Eric landed with a tiny plop and submerged into the water. He tried swimming to the surface, but the the hook he was attached to was just too heavy. He managed to pull himself up by the fishing line. Eric gasped for air when he reached the surface. Suddenly, the float began to move along in the water, pulling the tiny man with it. Rusty was slowly pulling the line in an effort to attract the fish.

Eric tried to get free of the horrible fish-hook, but it was attached too thoroughly throughout his shirt and pants. Then Eric looked down into the murky water and was horrified to see a mammoth monster-sized fish headed right for him, with its mouth wide open.

The tiny man had one last hope. He frantically removed his clothes and swam off just as the hideous fish greedily bit into the hook with Eric's little clothes still attached.

"Hey, I got one!" Rusty exclaimed, as he pulled in his line.

Eric, naked and exhausted, pulled himself up onto a floating twig and hoped the currents would carry him to land.
1431111122121211.title: The Hook

choices: clacking crab claws!
giant feet in the squishy mud!
14311111221212111.content:
The exhausted little man clung to the bit of
flotsam, hopeful he could remain afloat long
enough to reach shore.

The twig bobbed up and down with each
passing wave and ripple. The shore looked
impossibly distant. Turning his head in the
other direction, Eric saw the old wooden pier
at the end of the back-water channel. He saw
the two giants standing on the colossal
structure.

Eric felt so defeated. How could he ever get
back to the motel room where his brother and
his friends were staying?

Suddenly, the breeze picked up speed,
blowing the twig along the surface of the
water. Eric held onto the precarious twig,
watching as the breeze blew him toward the
pier.

Soon, the sun disappeared, as Eric and the
twig were blown beneath the wooden planks
of the pier. In the dark shadows, choppy
waves, broken up by the posts supporting the
pier, churned the water into a turbulent froth.

Eric held on for dear life. Just as he was
certain he would be too weak to hold on any
longer, a wave tossed him against the muddy
shore beneath the pier. The little man tried to
stand, found himself too weak, and collapsed
in the mud in the shadow of the pier.

He wakes to the noise of...
14311111221212111.title: On Shore

choices: Arriving at Rusty's brother's trailer
Friends in another truck pick up Rusty and Jack
1431111122121212.content:
Jack placed the can of worms into the bait-tackle box, then closed the lid on the plastic container.

Lifting the tackle box into the bed of the pickup truck, Jack failed to hear the stream of thin, feeble screams for help.

In the darkness, Eric's screams continued as he tried to push through the black dirt and shove away the hideous, slimy worms that thrashed in the rusty metal can. His throat was hoarse from screaming and his mind filled with abject terror at the thought that he had just been separated, perhaps permanently, from his brother. Despite the obstacles Zac and his friends had represented, they also formed in Eric's labored mind the only possible lifeline he could imagine for getting himself extricated from his nightmarish situation.

Then, to add to his terror, Eric heard an extremely loud grinding noise that came through the plastic walls of the tackle box and the metal walls of the can.

"Dammit to hell," Rusty exclaimed as he put the keys into his ignition and tried to start the engine. The harsh grinding noise signaled to Rusty and Jack that their plans for an evening of fishing might not take place after all.

Rusty, stretching tight his white muscle shirt across his pecs, tried a few more times. "Forget this," he said. "My brother lives about a mile from here. Let's go to his place and maybe he can help us out with a tow or something."

Jack, dressed in a green T-shirt emblazoned with a Mountain Dew logo, shrugged. "Whatever, man," he said. "Your truck's a piece of crap."

Rusty spit on the pavement and adjusted the crotch of his faded, skintight jeans. A bigger guy than his friend, he ran a hand through his shaggy blond hair.

"Just get your butt out of there," Rusty said. "And grab that tackle box. I'm not leaving it here for somebody to steal."

The two redneck youths left the hard-scrabble truck and walked down a weedy lane that led away from the beach-front property to a nearby residential trailer park.
1431111122121212.title: Mechanical Problems

choices: Try to get their attention
One of the giants notices something tiny
14311111221212121.content:
The tiny shrunken scientist was tossed to and fro within the giant tacklebox when Jack grabbed it from the bed of his buddy's truck.

Rusty filled out his tight white muscle shirt as he strode down a weedy pathway. "Let's just cool off in my trailer," he said. "I think my step-dad left some beers in the fridge."

"Sounds good to me," Jack said.

The two young men walked to a nearby residential trailer park. They bypassed several of the better-looking mobile homes in the park until they came to the most unkempt, dilapidated trailed in the entire park.

Rusty pushed through a screen door, followed by his friend, who let the door slam behind him. Jack dumped his buddy's tackle box on the floor just inside the door.

The inside of the trailer was crammed with garbage, such as discarded containers and bags for fast food. Clothes, ranging from boxer briefs and socks to T-shirts, were draped over furniture or dropped on the floor.

"What about those beers?" Jack asked.

Rusty checked the fridge and found a six-pack with three remaining beers. Grabbing one for himself, he tossed one toward Jack.

Surprised, Jack took one step back, caught the beer, but upended the tackle box.

Rusty snapped the tab on the beer.

Jack stooped down to re-arrange the contents of the tackle box that had sprawled on the floor. "Leave it," Rusty said.

The two titans settled into two well-worn recliners, and Rusty grabbed the remote control to look for a wrestling match to watch.

At no time did the two youths notice the tiny pale speck that crawled from the debris spilled from the tacklebox.

Bug-sized Eric stared up and tried to determine his surroundings.
14311111221212121.title: Rednecking It

choices: Eric follows the path to look for his brother
Eric decides to head toward the beach to seek help
14311111222.content:
The four friends leaped from James' Geo
Tracker as soon as he pulled to a stop in the
parking lot of the run-down motel where they
had booked a room.

"Let's check out the beach before we check
in," Zac said, grabbing his shoes from the
floor of the vehicle and carrying them with him.

His friends agreed and followed Zac toward
the beach.

••••••••

Within the New Balance tennis shoe, trapped
in the toe region by Zac's smelly white sock,
Eric realized that something had changed.
Each of Zac's steps jolted Eric within his
warm, dank prison.

••••••••

"Ouch!" Zac exclaimed after stepping on a
thorny bur on the path to the beach. "Better put
on my shoes."

His friends continued on their way. Zac
removed the socks from his shoes and
stuffed the socks into a pocket.

He then lowered the shoe containing a tiny
stowaway, turning it upside down in the
process.

••••••••

Everything changed in the blink of an eye for
tiny Eric.

First, the wretched-smelling sock was
removed, letting in a flood of light and fresh
air.

And then, without warning, the shoe lurched,
turned upside down, sending the bug-sized
man falling, screaming, toward the ground,
which rushed up to meet him with a savage
impact.

••••••••

"Wait up, guys!" Zac shouted as he finished
putting on his shoes. He ran to catch up with
his buddies.

•••••••••

Eric felt painfully bruised and battered all over
his teeny body. He tried to determine what had
happened.

He had been dropped on a hard, weathered
path of trodden sand and rough bits of shells.
In the distance, he heard a loud, muffled roar
that he could not quite recognize.

He saw a gentle slope of what appeared to be
sand. He scrambled to the top of the slope,
slipping and falling a few times, tripped up by
large boulders of sand.

Finally, he reached the rise on the slope.

"No!" Eric cried, gazing at the horizon. The
muffled roar came from the crashing of the
surf against the shore of the beach, still some
great distance away from the shrunken
scientist. "How the hell?"

The university wasn't located anywhere near
the coast. Eric tried to determine how he had
been transported to a beach when he saw
four huge giants approaching. He recognized
his brother.

"Zac!" Eric screamed. "Help me! Help."

He tried to run back down the face of the dune.

But, in horror, Eric watched as the giants
returned along the path, soon leaving him
alone and far, far behind.

•••••••

"Let's get checked in," James suggested. "And
then we'll come back down to the beach."

"I'm all for that!" Zac said enthusiastically.

Kevin and Josh, too, were eager to dump their
bags in their room and then get back out on
the beach for some sun and surf.
14311111222.title: Free of the Shoe at Least

143111112222.content:
Eric felt infinitesimal in his new surroundings. As he looked up into the vast blue sky and listened to the thunderous roar of the nearby ocean, the half inch tall man realized just how small he really was.

The shrunken Professor was disheartened as he watched his brother Zac and three other giants fade away into the distance.

"Zac, please come back!" Eric thought to himself in desperation. He was in a strange place and all alone. The tiny man tried in vain not to think about the dangers awaiting someone as small as him.

Suddenly a giant hungry seagull swooped down towards the tiny man thinking he would qualify as a tasty snack. Eric was horrified as he watched the monstrous winged nightmare diving right at him.

As luck would have it, the beach path was littered with trash from the negligent beach-goers. Eric saw an empty beer can nearby and ran for it's tiny opening with all of his might. He just managed to dart inside as the horrible seagull lunged at him with its hideous beak.

Eric's little heart raced from the excitement of almost being gobbled up by a common seagull.

The disappointed monster bird pecked at the beer can in rage, sending Eric's aluminum sanctuary hurtling in the direction of the beach. In a fury, the awful bird continued its pursuit of the beer can, sending it further down the beach, ever closer to the crashing ocean waves.

Eric was pummeled violently within the beer can as it was knocked down to the beach. Just when Eric thought he could endure no more, the can's movement came to a halt. The seagull had moved on to more tasty endeavors.

The tiny man peered out of his hiding place with distress as he witnessed a truly shocking site. His can had been thrust down onto the beach dangerously close to the ocean waves.

But what really made the tiny man uneasy was that he was surrounded by GIANTS in every direction. Sun-bathing giants, walking giants, running giants, frisby-throwing giants, swimming giants, and even surfing giants. Giants were everywhere. Eric was terrified. He remained within the safe confines of his beer can and pondered his dreadful situation.

Suddenly, Eric's beer can was slightly jarred and his heart sunk as he heard a giant say:
143111112222.title: The Seagull from Hell

choices: Environmentally aware Russ picks up the can to stow it in a bag

1431111122221.content:
"This is a good place to set up the vollyball net," declared 18-year-old Russ, a freshman member of his college's soccer team.

He was enjoying a weekend break with three friends, Jason, Matt and Taylor.

Russ and his friends were all dressed in their swimtrunks. Russ was a short guy, standing only 5' 7". His friends were all six feet and taller.

But he was undeniably attractive. He had brown hair and green eyes. He had a very defined, athletic body.

•••••••••

From Eric's reduced point of view, one giant was very much like another. The only thing special about Russ was that he happened to be the giant closest to Eric's hiding place in the old can. He spied on the giant.

The young man looked incredible. Despite the everpresent danger posed by all the giants, Eric could not help but admire Russ's body and even begin to get turned on by the huge, powerful, muscled youth.

Suddenly, Taylor stepped forward and drove one of the poles for the volleyball pole deep into the sand.

He stabbed the pole into the sand only inches from the can where tiny Eric was hiding.

Eric looked out at this giant. He looked even bigger, more monstrous than the others.

•••••••••

Taylor followed the belief that bigger was better. He constantly worked out, building up his body. He was also the tallest guy in the group, standing 6' 6" tall. He had short, spiked sandy blond hair. He wore a coral chain around his neck. His bulked-up body was chiseled and shaped into a massive display of masculine perfection.

His foot, nearly twice the length of the can where Eric was hiding, stomped down on the sand.

Taylor impatiently barked orders for Jason and Matt to get the other pole secured in the sand.

••••••••

Eric watched all this progress with much apprehension. Soon, these strong, awesome giants would be throwing their huge bodies about with careless disregard for any tiny creatures in their path. Perhaps he should beat a hasty retreat.

He was almost ready to leave the can when he saw one of the giants headed his way.
1431111122221.title: Russ and Friends

14311111222211.content:
Russ spied a discarded soda can near their area of play.

Being a firm believer in the benefits of recycling, Russ decided to stow the can until he could find a recycling bin and dump the can into it.

••••••

Eric saw the giant's approach. The giant's enormous bare feet kicked up a storm of sand with each step. Eric shrieked and fled back into the interior of the can.

••••••

Russ grabbed the can and dropped it into a bag that held, among other items, his sandals, a T-shirt and a beach towel.

"Are we ready to play?" Taylor shouted.

"Yeah," Russ said.

••••••

At that opportune moment, Russ and his friends noticed four other guys walking in their direction.

"We could really get a game going with some more players," Taylor said.

Without waiting for approval from his friends, he waved. "Hey, you guys. Up for a game of volleyball?"

Zac, Kevin, James and Josh, having already downed a few brews, were not in their best competitive state, but none of them were ever keen on turning down a challenge.

"Sure," Kevin answered for himself and his friends.

••••••
Inside the can that Russ dumped into the bag, poor little Eric began to regain consciousness. The impact had caused him to black out.

Strange. He was certain he could hear his brother's voice. But the last thing he had seen was that giant youth walking toward him.

He needs to get out of the can and see what's going on.

Eric peers out from the can opening as the titanic Taylor heads towards him. At first he appears as a figure on the horizon, coral chain and red trunks. Then everything gets obscured by the jock's sandy feet. Now all he can see is the sandy callus of his big toe.

SLAM!

He clearly doesn't hold back as he sends the can speeding along the beach. Eric falls and gets carried along for the bumpy ride, the motion of the can hugging him close to the sticky aluminum - the residue of whatever was in it before. The rolling continues until it hits a rock. The jolt sends him sprawled against the surface, sliding towards the bottom once gravity resume its work. Stomach in knots and brain rattled by the unwanted journey, it takes Eric a bit for him to get back on his feet. He should be safe.

Outside, a shadow looms over the kicked can.

"Dude, we're ready to play!" shouts Jason

"Hold on a sec," Taylor responds, eyes on the can. "I gotta finish this."

He raises his foot onto the metal surface. It buckles under his weight...

1431111122222.content:
(This chapter was co-written by Small1 and GulliverUT.)


Eric spun around inside the can to peer out in order to see the source of the voice. A pail the size of a water storage tank crashed down beside him, dropped from the hand of a near-naked, well-tanned giant. The giant wore a pair of tight square-cut red swim trunks.

Eric stepped outside the tab opening in the can to stare up and get a better look.
A light trail of sandy hair ran down the giant's stomach, past a tight navel that could contain Eric's entire body.

The giant wrinkled his nose. "Damned litterbugs!" He snatched up the soda can before Eric could move, and stuffed it into his bag.

The enormous figure dropped down to his knees and began surveying the wet sand before him.

His shelter gone, Eric was left exposed and vulnerable on the sand in the shadow of the huge and awe-inspiring giant. Two enormous hands dropped toward the sand and began smoothing out a large area of sand to prepare a foundation for his creative sand-sculpting.

Eric scrambled backward to try to avoid the sweeping motions of the human earthmover. Sand particles the size of coarse gravel cascaded all around him, pelting him painfully but not causing much actual damage. Still, he desperately wanted to find some shelter until he could find a way to communicate with this new stranger.

He thought it fortunate when he spotted the huge structure a short distance from him. There was a smooth vaulted opening into the huge structure. Part of the structure was buried in the sand, but some large spirals extended out from the sides of the enormous seashell.

Eric shuddered slightly as he approached it. He did some quick calculations in his mind. Considering his half-inch stature, the shell was most likely no more than three or four inches long, but it loomed before him like a pop-art architectural fantasy.

The giant swept away more sand from the intended base of his creation, and the grains once again scattered over Eric.

The tiny scientist darted inside the shell. Clearing the sand encrusted near the opening, his bare feet touched onto the smooth, polished surface of the shell's interior.

His entry into the shell soon led to twists and turns as Eric made his way deeper into the shell. The narrow, smooth tunnel did eventually began to widen as he reached the center of the shell.

Outside, the giant was beginning his creation. He took the pail and began scooping up loads of sand and water from the surf's edge, and depositing them onto the smoothed foundation.

Eric rested against the interior wall of the shell. Sunlight filtered through the calcium walls, producing dim, eerie colors that enhanced the claustrophobic effect he was experiencing. He had more than a little trouble getting his mind to accept the fact that he was standing rather comfortably inside an ordinary seashell. He reached out and ran his hands along the smooth walls.

Eric found himself grateful that the mollusk was no longer occupying its former home. He was admiring the polished texture of the structure when it suddenly toppled sideways as the giant dragged it along with a load of sand meant to be deposited on the growing heap that would become his sand castle.

The shell was turned to a degree that Eric found it impossible to retrace his path through the shell's tunnel. He could not know, but he did suspect, that the giant must have turned the shell over.

"Hey! Let me out of here!" Eric began shouting, although he doubted his tiny shouts could possibly be heard.

"Hey, this one's kind of nice," the giant said as he spied the shell in the sand. He set it aside, open end up, and he resumed shaping his sculpture.

As the castle took form, Eric kept scrambling to climb the smooth, slippery, curving walls of the spiral shell. Each attempt led only to yet another humiliating slide back to where he had started.

Meanwhile, the giant looked down in satisfaction as his elaborate sand sculpture began to assume a pleasing shape. He used his pail, shovel, sticks and even his fingertips to pack and scrape the sand into a rather impressive mediæval structure.

"And now," he pronounced, picking up the shell, "the pièce de résistance!" He pushed the shell into the sand at the top of the center tower.

The shell was now positioned in a way to allow Eric an exit, but high above the sand's surface. The tiny man now found himself stranded inside the shell and atop a towering parapet of sand.
1431111122222.title: Structures In the Sand

144.content:
All he could do was cower in the confidence-shattering presence of the mammoth student.

He was able to recognize the titan as a jock in one of his science classes. He believed his name was Scott.

At the moment, the jock looked more than 850 feet tall! Maybe it was only his imagination, but Eric felt the floor shudder with each step Scott took into the lab.

"Professor!" Scott called in a voice that rumbled through the room. "I've got to talk to you about my grades. Professor!"

As Eric witnessed the giant's movements, he noticed Scott walk toward his desk. The giant lowered his backpack to the floor and began to write a note.

Eric began racing across the floor. As he drew closer, Scott's enormous sneakers, looking 170 feet long, commanded almost all of Eric's attention. He swallowed, beginning to recognize the futility of his plan. How could he ever attract attention from such a giant?

Instead, he noticed a dangling thread that led into a side pocket on Scott's backpack. The pack towered more than 250 feet into the air, but if he could manage to climb the thread only about 70 feet, he could slip into the open pocket. It might be his only chance.

Eric seized the thread and used it to scale the side of the backpack. He reached the lip of the pocket. He looked into the shadowy interior, suddenly uncertain.

About that time, Scott finished writing his note. He reached for his backpack. The motion as he hoisted the pack settled everything.

Loosing his balance, Eric toppled into the pocket, which was like falling into a 24-foot deep pit.

Scott left the laboratory, unhappy about not finding the professor, completely unaware of his tiny passenger.

Scott hoisted the backpack high up over his strong shoulders and began to walk away. Eric felt like he was aboard the space shuttle at liftoff. The initial g-forces pinned him to the bottom of the backpack pocket, and he just kept from throwing up.
"Oh God, what have I done," Eric thought to himself suddenly terrified of the situation he had just chosen for himself.
Eric was now being carried far from his laboratory by one of his students that to him resembled a godlike titan. At least now Eric felt more like he was flying in a plane than being in a rocket.

Suddenly Eric felt a JOLT, and all motion stopped. Scott had stopped to talk to Kirk, one of his football buddies.
"Whats up man," Kirk said, "are you ready for the big game on Saturday?"
"Actually I'm pissed as hell," Scott exclaimed. "I'm gettin a C in that bastard Professor Brevard's class. I've got to get a B to be eligible for the all academic, all conference team."
"Jocks like us don't need to be taking no Physics classes," Kirk teased Scott. "You knew Professor Brevard was a hardass, and wouldn't give you no special favors just because your the prettyboy star quarterback."
"Shut the f--- up," Scott blurted. "If I can just find the bastard, I'll convince him to give me a B. Man I'm so pissed right now, I would love to just pulverize that guy. Well anyway, I'm headed back to the house, I'll talk to you later."

Eric heard all this and was now completely terrified. He was being carried away by a hulking jock football player that was pissed at him about one of his grades. And he was so tiny. He couldn't believe he was just half an inch tall. He was truly minuscule. Just one careless move and Eric might be crushed by one of Scott's massive hands or arms.

Having totally lost his appetite, the huge jock tossed the Tootsie Roll into a nearby trash can.

Like a projectile, the small candy roll rocked down toward the half-filled trash can. A layer of debris rushed up to greet the onrushing object. Tiny Eric, screaming through the whole descent, felt a severe impact that tossed him free from the sticky confines of the candy and its wrapper. His puny body landed on the curved surface of a huge beer bottle dropped into the trash earlier by another of the frat house's titanic occupants.

The huge bottle, half-buried in the rubbish tossed into the trash can, curved beneath the tiny scientist's shrunken form.

Eric tried to stand. He gazed up toward the distant rim of the trash can. "Hey!" Eric cupped his hands around his mouth. "Somebody! Help!"

The tiny man realized no one would hear him, no one would be coming to his rescue.

And he realized that, under his own power, he was unlikely to make his way out of the trash can. It's sleek plastic walls loomed impossibly overhead.

What was next?

Even these jocks, he imagined, would eventually get around to tossing out the trash.

"I've got to get out of here!" Eric said. He took a step, slipped and slid over the curved glass surface. He landed on a discarded envelope— a credit card company pitch for some luckless student to open a credit card account.

He felt terribly tiny at that point, discarded with other unwanted bits of trash.

"This is what I mean," Rich declared in irritated fashion. "You guys need to take care of your own trash. That's why we have a dumpster behind the dorm."

The other guy, looking uninterested, shrugged. His mountainous shoulders moved beneath the tight T-shirt that covered his torso. "Fine," Mark said shortly. "I'll take out the damn trash!"

As Eric peered from the depths of the trash can, he saw one of Mark's muscular arms reach for the can. "No, please," the shrunken man shouted. "I'm in here!"

The speck-sized man began sliding along the sleek envelope as the good-looking college student effortlessly grabbed the trash can. He screamed as he plunged off the envelope and fell into the rest of the trash, which was launched into motion as the college student carried the small waste can toward the back of the dorm residence. As Eric fell deeper into the mix of trash, he recoiled from the horrible smells. He cried out in disgust as he landed in a pool of some sort of sticky, slimy liquid.

"I've got to get out of here," he screamed. He had to get help. He must return to his lab.

His declaration was cut short when Mark turned the can upside down, dumping the tiny man and an avalanche of garbage into the enormous dumpster located on a concrete slab in back of the dorm.

The tiny man landed on something hard that robbed him of his breath. He could only gaze skyward, getting one last glimpse of Mark's handsome face before the titan smacked the side of the can to empty the last of the garbage. Eric watched as a crushing volume of garbage headed toward him.

"Yah, I saw some bug run under there. I almost crushed it," Scott exclaimed.

Frozen in fear, the tiny Professor peers out from under the couch to see Greg's titan size bare foot hovering in the air, his toes wiggling almost in a mocking manner to inform him of his impending doom.

Eric is trapped. There is nowhere to run and his hiding place is about to be moved.

"Leave me alone," Scott said in irritation.

Suddenly, the couch, lifted by the two gigantic brutes, began to shift.

Eric shrieked and ran blindly. Directly in his path was a scrap of paper. He dashed beneath that meager shelter just as the two titanic jocks finished moving the sofa.

As Eric raced beneath the tent-sized scrap of paper, he collided with something large and covered with scaly armor. There was a horrid scuttling sound as the cockroach, startled by this tiny human's arrival in its hiding place, fled to look for a more private hideout.

"There's your bug!" Scott exclaimed in a loud voice.

"God no! They've seen me!" Eric cried. He curled into a ball and whimpered.

Greg's huge bare foot crashed down. The entire floor shook from the force of impact.

A few seconds passed before Eric realized he was still alive. He peered from beneath his hiding place.

Greg had slammed destruction down on the puny cockroach. He now lifted his foot. "Gentlemen, the exterminator strikes again!"

Eric stopped whimpering. Greg had stomped the cockroach!

"Now, can we put the couch back?" Scott demanded in an irritable tone.

"Sure, man."

The mountain-sized piece of furniture was lifted back over Eric and his tiny hiding place, plunging him back into near darkness.

He was trembling so badly he could barely make himself move.

The fate of the cockroach refused to leave his mind. Sure, he had escaped this time. Next time, he might not be so lucky.

He can't spend the rest of his life under this couch. He must get back to his lab. He must use his machine to end his shrunken nightmare.

What should he do now?

Eric felt a sense of relief as the huge frathouse jock pulled a pair of thick woolen socks over his enormous feet. Those were the feet which had nearly crushed him, and had splattered a cockroach more than twice Eric's size. But Eric was sure the man was putting footwear on to take him somewhere.

Greg had decided on the boots. Those were his stomping boots. He had bought them when he started a part time job as a builder. Greg was the kind of guy who stomped on bugs, lizards and frogs just for fun. Once he even stomped on a nest of tiny, squeaking baby birds which had fallen out of a tree during a storm. Wearing his boots, he could hardly feel the crunch. He liked that, because it made the tiny creature so insignificant to him that he could hardly feel it. And now he had a real live human.

An ant the size of a decent sized dog ran past. Eric began to get scared as the giant lifted himself to his full height.

Greg, although shorter than the lanky Scott, still stood well over six feet. To Eric that made him around 900 feet tall. He placed his boots heavily on either side of the tiny man, who was now lying on the ground.

Eric could see the huge jock-giant towering over him, and he could see the bulge in the front of his shorts. Fear gripped Eric once again as he realised the huge man was getting off on some kind of sick power trip. He scrambled to his feet, but had nowhere to run.

Greg decided to toy with his victim. He stomped down hard on the floor with both boots. And stomped closer to the tiny Eric. Eric ran away from the huge boots with their heavy tread, nearly tripping in a crack between two boards. The giant's boots stomped repeatedly behind Eric as he ran for his life across the room. He was heading for the shelter of the wall, but a boot dropped down in front of him, blocking his path. Eric doubled back, and realised he was being herded around the huge room. His heart was racing, and he was growing weary, and then he stumbled when his foot caught in the crack between two floorboards. He dropped and rolled onto his back, tears streaming down his face as he looked up at the cruel giant above him. He clutched his hands together as if to pray and screamed as loud as he could "Please, let me live", but Greg's face remained malicious. Eric realised that nothing he could do could save his life. This monster was going to kill him so he could feel big and powerful. Then the heavy sole of one of Greg's boots moved into position above him, and then came thundering down with an earth shattering sound, bringing darkness.

But Eric wasn't dead. He was under the giant's instep. Eric was in shock, and shaking uncontrolably. But then the boot boot lifted and came down quite gently on top of him, and slowly it pressed down until the bones in Eric's body cracked, and he became a tiny little stain shared between the floor and the tread of Greg's boot.

The End
144112111111122.title: Under his boots

144112111112.content:
Eric's leap, combined with the momentum from a shockwave of displaced air, tossed him to the left of the giant's massive foot in the instant before Greg smashed his bare foot to the ground.

"DAMN! MISSED!" Greg complained.

"HEY, WHAT ARE YOU DOING, MAN?"

Eric, stunned by the sudden entry of another giant into the crowded corridor, looked up from the floor at the other jock.

Greg turned to Scott. "I SAW ANOTHER DAMN BUG!"

"GIVE IT A REST, MAN," Scott said, laughing. "JUST ENJOY A BEER AND WE'LL CALL IN A PROFESSIONAL TO DEAL WITH THE PESTS."

Eric gazed up at the colossal, powerful titans. As much as he felt in awe of them, he knew he could not remain here. Eric's mind remained focused on escape. "I've got to get out of here!" Eric exclaimed aloud.

On his feet again, Eric began to scurry over the floor. From overhead, words from the giants' conversation continue to roar down from above.

"THERE'S ANOTHER ONE!" Greg said. "WELL, I CAN HANDLE THIS MYSELF."

He raised his colossal foot and, in one smooth movement, brought it down on the fleeing bug.

"OH, MAN!" Scott laughed and made a disgusted face. "YOU'RE MERCILESS."

"THEY DON'T CALL ME THE EXTERMINATOR FOR NOTHING," Greg said in a bragging tone.

Greg laughed again and adopted an "Ahr-Nald" accent. "I GUESS THAT WAS HASTA LA VISTA, BUGGY."

Eric thinks that contact with Greg might be risky, but if successful, hopefully he can escape this giant madhouse and grow back to normal size.
