Cross the room toward the long corridor
144112112.content:
Greg continues to balance on one foot, his other foot raised in the air and ready to stomp!

"Come on, get off your ass and help move this couch!" Greg repeats again.

Scott frowns. "Not until after Sportscenter. Now sit your ass down."

Greg brings both feet back to the carpet. He takes a seat on the sofa, but punches Scott's shoulder. "Bug lover!"

"Keep it down," Scott complained. "I can't hear the program."

Beneath the couch, tiny Eric breathed a huge sigh of relief. Scott had bought him a reprieve. He knew he had to get away before the conclusion of Sportscenter. But where could he go?

He crept from beneath the sofa. Across the room was an open doorway that led into a long corridor. To his left was a closed door. But, being no bigger than a bug, Eric realized he could easily crawl through the space between the bottom of the door and the floor. He had no idea what was on the other side of the door.

It had to be better than staying in the same room with a stomp-happy jock with feet that looked more than 200 feet long to the shrunken college professor.

Greg's giant bare feet were still so close that they caused a tingle of fear to run along the tiny length of Eric's spine. At any moment, one of the giant jocks could decide to get off the couch and stomp toward him. He should act fast.

Eric decides...
144112112.title: A Reprieve

choices: a recreation room.
a sports gear storage closet.
1441121121.content:
The miniature Professor, trembling and weak from his traumatic encounter with the mountainous monster-jocks, decided to undertake the daunting challenge of trying to reach the enormous closed door, and escape impending doom from the exterminator (Oh God, now even Eric was thinking of Greg's colossal foot as an entity all to itself looming all-powerful, and ready to stomp out his meager existence at any moment.

The task was quite overwhelming and terrifying. The mammoth door seemed distant and miles away. The five hulking jocks were surprisingly quiet and still, with the exception of Scott's titanic sneaker, which would tap the floor an random intervals, creating and earth-moving pounding that almost knocked Eric to the ground several times.

The television was blaring the Sportscenter theme. It was time for the football segment of the program and this had the giant jocks undivided attention.

Eric decided it was time to make his move and try to escape this terrifying room of gigantic creatures. The trek was going to be long and Eric started to run as fast as he could. Within minutes, Eric found himself exposed in the open, praying some massive monster jock would not stomp his way. He kept running. And running. "No time for fear now," Eric thought to himself. Eric was actually in pretty good shape.

Eric was making excellent progress and was minutes away from approaching the gigantic door. The minuscule Professor was actually feeling a little cocky about his escape from those stupid jocks. He had no idea what awaited behind the door in front of him.

Then suddenly from out of nowhere, Eric was horrified to see a giant pair of sneakers thundering down the corridor, headed straight for him. There was no way Eric was going to reach the door in time. All he could do was hope that the random steps of the giant jock wouldn't squish out his tiny existence.

In an instant, the hulking figure was on top of Eric, bearing down on the bug-sized man. And then he was gone. Eric had been spared.

Then an eruption of thundering whoops and hollers from the giant jocks back in the living room startled Eric. Something on the television must have pleased the colossal young men. Eric had reached the skyscraper sized door, and it was now or never. The tiny Professor quite easily crawled under the massive door and discovered:
1441121121.title: Escaping the giant jocks.

choices: A herd of colossal jocks stomping into the room.
An empty soda can had crashed to the floor.
14411211211.content:
The room was massive. It was as big as a city to the miniature Professor. Eric stood dumbfounded and marveled at all the enormous things he saw in the room. The center fixture in the room was a titanic sized table, capable of seating around 15 giants. To say it was impressive would have been a grave understatement. Against one wall stood three massive foosball tables. Against another wall was an enormous bar in which Eric was way too small to see over to the other side, but he assumed it must have been a kitchen area. The bar stools were strewn randomly about the room. A pinball machine and old video game sit isolated in one of the corners of the room.

The room was a god-awful mess. These titanic jocks were complete slobs. The floor was covered in grime and dirt, making each step difficult for the tiny Professor. An endless supply of nearly empty pizza boxes and empty soda cans littered virtually every area of the room. The table and bar were covered with empty beer bottles, and the nauseating smell of stale beer filled the room.

Eric noticed an open pizza box extremely close by, and his hunger forced him to investigate. The lip of the pizza box was flush with the floor, so climbing up and in to the box was quite easy for Eric. Eric was rewarded with a leftover tiny piece of pizza. But it would have been enough to feed a hundred men of Eric's reduced size.

Eric gorged himself, and soon found himself quite full, and very tired He was exhausted. The mini-professor just curled up into one corner of the house sized pizza box and fell fast asleep.

About an hour went by and then, CRASH. Eric was abruptly awakened to:
14411211211.title: Giant jock's reck room.

choices: The colossal jock looks down and spots Eric.
The colossal jock jumps up to grab some more beers for everyone.
144112112111.content:
Sportscenter was over. The colossal jocks yapped about the upcoming game on Saturday for several minutes. These jocks were extremely confident and cocky as hell. Their football team had cruised through the conference without a loss, beating opposing teams by an average of twenty points. Scott had received national accolades all year and was even the front-runner for the Heisman trophy. Ironically, his stiffest competition was the running back from his own team.
Greg was the field goal kicker and the punter on the team. His massive foot had kicked 27 straight field goals without a miss, a school record.

"Hey, hows about me and Scott beat your asses at a game of foosball," Greg challenged two of the other macho jocks in the room. Scott rolled his eyes but his competitive nature was apparent at any task he undertook, even a simple game of foosball.

"Your on!" the other two jocks answered.

The four colossal young men jumped up and stormed into the recreation room that was adjacent to the living room.

"Oh God, an earthquake," Eric thought to himself as he was awakened from a semi-peaceful slumber.

The minuscule Professor was petrified to see what seemed an endless parade of giant sneakers, boots, and bare feet. The entrance of the unearthly colossal beasts was frightening. Eric's box shook violently as the gargantuan feet thundered past him, crushing everything in their path.

Eric was frozen in fear as one of the mega-giant's massive boots came crashing down on the edge of the old pizza box he was in. Frustrated and very scared, Eric could not bring himself to accept he was in a room with the same terrifyingly huge giant jocks he had just earlier successfully escaped from.

The colossal jocks stomped over to a foosball table and began a quite spirited game. In desperation, Eric realized he might have to try and get the attention of these behemoth jocks, and hope they would help him. But he was so small. Maybe they wouldn't even know that he was a human being. Even Scott earlier thought he was a bug and tried to crush him. The thought of being casually crushed by a cocky young jock was quite repugnant to him. Anyway now was not the time anyway. The massive creatures were jumping up and down, and hollering in what was quite an intense game of foosball. No way Eric was going to allow himself to be subject to that, defenseless to those gigantic feet, out in the open.

And then the game was over. Eric looked out of his hiding place and saw that the mammoth jocks had grabbed some beers and were sitting down at the gigantic table. Eric's stomach grew queasy as he realized he had a life altering decision to make. The tinsy-tiny Professor was going to try and attract the attention of the hulking monster jocks, and try to get them to help him.

Trembling with fear, Eric ventured from the safety of his hiding place, and began cautiously walking in the direction of the massive table the jocks were seated at.

The sheer size of the giant young men was hair-raising. As he approached the god-like titans, their massive voices were intimidating and deafening. Eric was beginning to realize just how small and insignificant he had become.

Eric had walked dangerously close to one of the giant jocks and began screaming and waving his arms as frantically as he could. Eric was terrified as we watched the giant's massive boot shift position every so often, pounding random areas of the floor. Eric seemed a safe distance from the life threatening boots, so he continued to scream as loud as he could.

No one could hear Eric's tiny voice. He was too tiny. Eric dared not move any closer to the titanic youth, but he stood his ground and continued to wave his arms.

Suddenly:
144112112111.title: Pizza and foosball.

choices: takes little Eric back to his room to be thoroughly examined.
shows Eric to the other giant frat jocks.
1441121121111.content:
Eric was trying to get the attention of a hulking young jock named Joe. Joe was a defensive lineman on the football team. He was six foot four, had brown eyes, long wavy black hair and was built like a rock. Joe's boots were massive and black. He wore size 16. And his shirt could barely contain his bulging muscles. When it came to football, he was an intense maniac, but otherwise was an easygoing very nice guy. He wasn't the smartest guy in the world, but basically everybody like Joe. He was just really down to earth.

Joe was sitting isolated at one side of the table, and was beginning to become bored with the macho conversation of the other jocks. Greg was rehashing his story about twins that he dated at the same time. Joe had heard this story a million times.

Bored out of his mind, Joe glanced down at the floor, and noticed the movement of a tiny object. "Must be some bug," Joe thought to himself, continuing to focus his total attention on the incredibly small "bug". Well within the reach of his massive leg, Joe thought about casually reaching over with his monstrous boot and crushing the little thing. He brings his massive boot directly over the little "bug", hovering, and then hesitates. He moves his foot back. Joe would definitely stomp on the little "bug" later because they didn't need no bugs in the frathouse, but he let the little creature amuse him for now.

Eric was relieved and slightly terrified as he saw Joe drop his head and look right at him. His intense glare was intimidating. The tiny Professor was confused when Joe did nothing but just continue glaring down at him, so he just kept screaming and waving his arms.

"Hey you stupid Jock, help me," screamed Eric.

Well Eric got a reaction from the "stupid jock", but not quite the one he was hoping for. Without warning a gigantic black boot belonging to the behemoth had come from nowhere and was now hovering directly over him. Eric almost pissed his pants. Then then colossal boot began to lower and Eric did piss his pants. His life was over. He was just some bug that a guy wanted to step on. Eric just hoped it would be quick.

Just as quick as it appeared, the boot was gone, back to its original resting place. Eric was relieved but quite humiliated to know that the giant jock had just played with him. Could he not recognize that his was an actual human being. Eric decided to go for broke. He started walking closer to the giant jock in hopes he would see what he was. A real man. Tiny, but real.

Joe watched intently as the little "bug" moved closer to him.

"You're a brave little thing," Joe thought to himself, as his immense eyes focused on the little creature.

As Eric moved closer to him, Joe began to make out the form of the little creature better. Joe was astonished at what he saw.

"What the fuck?" Joe whispered to himself, and bent down to the floor on his knees to to get a better look at this. Joe thought his mind was playing tricks on him. He moved in close on the tiny figure, and realized he was looking at a miniature human man. The little man seemed to be screaming something but Joe could only hear a very tiny squeak. The other frat jocks were so into Greg's story that they didn't even notice what Joe is doing. Joe decided to examine the little guy closer so he slowly reached down to pick him up.

Eric was excited Joe recognized him, but when he saw the massive hand of the jock headed for him, he wasn't so sure. It was chilling to realize that the gigantic jock was going to hold Eric in his hand.

After Joe has Eric securely in his hand he:
1441121121111.title: Eric..........meet Joe!

choices: a jar.
a small cage.
14411211211111.content:
Eric trembled as Joe's enormous hand slowly approached him. It was quite disheartening for Eric to realize that he was now under the complete control of this colossal muscular football jock. As the massive hand began to close around him, Eric was terrified as he discovered that he was not even as big as one of Joe's gigantic fingernails. Just one careless move, and Joe could have squashed Eric without even realizing it.

Joe's beefy fingers lifted Eric into the air, and then Eric found himself in the palm of Joe's hand. The enormous hand was as big as a basketball court to Eric. It was warm and slightly damp with sweat. Even the lines in Joe's hand seemed huge, and Eric could even make out the pattern of Joe's fingerprints with great detail. Eric was completely fascinated by Joe's enormous hand.

Eric's fascination soon became terror as the monster-sized hand began to close around him. The last thing he saw before complete darkness was Joe looking down at him grinning.

"I'm outta here guys, see you later," Joe remarked to the other titan jocks, as he closed his hand, stood up and walked out headed for his room, with his new little prized possession safe and secure. Scott said, "later gator," and continued listening to Greg's yapping.

Eric felt like he was in a gigantic moving sauna as he was quickly whisked through the frathouse in a direct path to Joe's room. Joe was excited in the anticipation of examining his tiny captive in a much more private setting. Eric was beginning to dread this colossal jock might have more on his mind than just being a good Samaritan.

Joe entered his room, closed the door and locked it. He walked over and sit down at his desk, and took a deep breath. He slowly opened his hand to reveal a trembling, scared little human creature. At least he thought it was human. Maybe it was an alien or even a mutant insect that escaped from some horrible cloning laboratory.

Eric tried to communicate with Joe, but he was just to small to be heard. All Joe could hear was a very faint squeaking noise. Eric realized that not being able to be heard by Joe was a terribly bad development. Without the extremely important humanity of communication, Joe might be inclined to treat him as just an interesting creature instead of a real person.

"No, No, Please not the hand again," Eric screamed as Joe gently reached down and picked him up again.

"Don't worry, I won't hurt you little one," Joe said, as he effortlessly lifted Eric into the air and set him down on top of a CD storage case. "Now stay there, I'll be right back. And don't go too close to the edge. Wouldn't want you to have an accident," Joe instructed Eric, and slightly chuckled. Joe left the room leaving Eric all alone trapped atop the mountainous CD case.

A few moments later Joe returned with:
14411211211111.title: Joe's fascinating discovery.

choices: Leave his little pet in the glass mug in his room
Take the mug and his little pet downstairs with him
144112112111111.content:
Eric's eyes fastened on the massive glass container in Joe's hand when the immense jock returned to the room.

Joe sat the huge glass mug on the CD case. The glass container completely dwarfed Eric's tiny form.

And then he saw Joe's huge hand coming for him again. Before Eric could think, before he could attempt to scream at the giant, before he could do anything, he felt Joe grab him.

He struggled and screamed in vain as Joe raised him over the glass mug. "No! Don't" Eric shouted.

He felt himself dropped. He hit the glass bottom of the jar. The impact jolted him, but he felt reasonably sure he wasn't injured.

He heard a loud tapping echo in the glass confines of the mug. He looked through the thick glass and saw Joe's huge finger tapping on the glass. The huge jock wanted to get his attention.

How could he get through to this thick-skulled jock? He ran to the glass and began to pound ineffectually with his tiny fists.

Joe, watching the tiny thing scrambling against the glass, laughed.

Eric, viewing the giant jock through the thick glass, had a somewhat distorted view of Joe's colossal face. He could not believe that he was a prisoner in a empty glass mug.

Joe tapped again on the glass walls. The loud noise echoed in the confined chamber. Eric put his hands to his ears, shocked at the painful level of the noise from some simple taps.

Joe found amusement in the little bug's antics. He raised his hand and glanced at his watch.

He decided to go downstairs and watch some television. He also decided to...
144112112111111.title: Dropped in a Glass

choices: Nate is very thirsty!
Nate begins to flip through channels before taking a drink
1441121121111112.content:
Joe grabbed the glass mug and his little "discovery" and headed downstairs.

He found the den empty at the moment, so he grabbed the remote and began flipping through the channels. He placed the mug on the coffee table.

Before he found a program that interested him, Joe felt the need to go to the bathroom.

"Nature calls," Joe said, standing to his feet. "Be right back, little thing."

What? Eric watched as the huge giant strode from the room. Where was he going?

Not much time passed before Eric heard the ominous sound of footsteps as his giant returned.

But, even through the distortion of the walls of his glass prison, he quickly realized that this giant was a newcomer, not Joe.

Nate was a small guy, only 5' 7" tall, but he still looked terrifying in his immensity to the imprisoned little professor. He was dressed only in boxer shorts and a T-shirt. He had a can of beer in his hand.

"Great!" Nate exclaimed. "No one else around. I've got the television all to myself."

He looked toward the coffee table and saw the mug. "Just what I need."

He grabbed the mug. Eric slid across the glass bottom of the mug. "Hey! What are you doing?" Eric screamed.

Nate gave the mug a cursory glance. It looked clean enough he decided.

He popped the tab on his beer. Eric watched in shock as the giant tilted the open can and spilled the amber liquid into the mug. He was suddenly caught up in the tempest, awash in an incredible volume of beer.
1441121121111112.title: Nate

14411211211111121.content:
Eric surfaced in an immense pool of beer —
enough to last the typical frat boy their entire
college career.

He splashed and tried to stay afloat.

Nate grabbed the mug in his hand. Eric was
sloshed toward the edge of the glass mug. He
looked up at the titanic youth.

Nate had a slight frame with a wiry body. He
wasn't as buff as many of his fraternity
brothers. He still looked immense and
terrifying to tiny Eric.

"Help! I'm a college professor!" Eric shouted.
He swallowed a mouthful of beer.

The television's volume drowned out what
was, in reality, a teeny insignificant plea from
Eric. Nate kept flipping through channels as
he lifted the mug toward his open mouth.

Eric was subject to the shifting waves in the
mug. He saw the top of the mug lift toward the
titan's enormous lips. The huge lips parted to
reveal rows of white teeth the size of fortress
walls.

"No!" Eric tried to swim against the current as
beer flowed into Nate's mouth, dragging him
along. "Stop! Please don't."

Nate continued to chug the mug of beer. The
liquid felt very refreshing to his parched throat.

Eric was thrown into Nate's cavernous mouth,
and a vortex dragged him down with the beer.
"No! I'm a college professor!" Eric protested.

It was the final protest at the absurdity of his
ending— trapped in a mug of beer and
swallowed by a frat jock that wasn't even high
on the scale among his own peers.

••••••

Nate placed the mug back on the coffee table.
Maybe he had drunk the beer too fast. His
stomach felt suddenly upset. He stood and
went to look for something to relieve his
nausea.
••••••

Joe returned and was extremely disappointed
to find the mug empty and his little "bug" gone.
He gave a half-hearted search of the vicinity
and was still looking when Nate returned.

Nate upended a bottle of foul-tasting medicine
to soothe his indigestion.
"I think there was something bad in that beer I
had," Nate remarked.
14411211211111121.title: Undignified

choices: Joe lifts the cage to his ear
Joe gets a magnifying glass from his desk
144112112111112.content:
Eric had moved close to the edge of the top of a CD storage case. Looking over the edge was like looking down from the top of a skyscraper!

Seized by vertigo, he had moved well away from the edge of the black tower when he heard the colossal footsteps that signaled the return of his titanic captor or, perhaps, savior?

Joe carried something in his hands. To tiny Eric, it looked like the enormous jock was carrying an entire house!

Joe placed the square-shaped object on top of the CD rack next to Eric.

"No!" Eric cried as the giant's enormous hand came for him again!

Joe tried, as gently as possible, to transport the tiny man into the small plastic cage. The jocks in the frat house had kept a pet iguana. Joe's job had been to feed the lizard. He had used the small plastic cage to hold crickets and other small bugs. Unfortunately, the lizard had disappeared several weeks ago. One of his fellow jocks had probably stupidly let the iguana out of its cage.

Eric found himself inside the plastic cage. It was as big as a gymnasium. Its plastic walls were solid and at least 70 feet tall. The lid, however, was perforated with a fine mesh to allow the transfer of air.

The hulking jock had caged him! "Let me out of here!" Eric demanded as loudly as possible.

Joe stared down at the incredibly tiny man. He wasn't certain, but he thought he could tell that the little man was trying to yell something at him.

"Might as well save your breath," Joe said. "I just can't hear you."

Joe stood over the cage. Eric stared up at the jock's monstrous body. The muscles were geographic in their immensity! "Damn! I'm getting hard." Eric realized.

"I hate to do this to you, but you're much safer in here," Joe spoke. His words sounded like muffled thunder on a summer day. "I'm surprised no one stepped on you before I found you."

Joe moved his head closer, squinting for a better look. "Can I get you something? Are you hungry?"

The jock was trying to communicate with him. But, because of his pathetic size, Eric could not make his replies heard.

Joe's brain was working overtime. He wanted to know how he could have some meaningful interaction with his teeny discovery.
144112112111112.title: Some Guys Are Hard to Get to Know

choices: CHARLIE'S  FOOD
LIZZARD  FOOD
1441121121111121.content:
The pitiful little college professor just stood in his plastic box prison in awe of the Hurculean young jock staring down at him. The giant jock effortlessly clicked the dreaded prison lid over the tiny bug-sized man, and Eric was trapped in the repugnant insect cage until a giant decided to let him out.

Eric felt so meager and insignificant. He had lost all control of his very life.

Until now, Joe's every waking thought concerned the big game on Saturday. But Eric now had Joe's undivided attention. Joe was fascinated at every move the little Professor made. He took the cage in one hand and brought it close to his face until his colossal nose was actually touching the finely meshed lid.

Eric grew faint as carbon-monoxide from Joe's massive breath filled his tiny new home. Joe turned his head and held his ear up to the box, listening intently for any sound from within.

"Help me, Please help me," Eric screamed as loud as he could. "I'm a Professor at your college and was accidentally shrunk during an experiment."

"Please hear me, please oh please," Eric prayed as he continued to scream the same message over and over.

Joe still only heard a faint squeaking sound. "If it were human, why wouldn't it talk to me", Joe pondered to himself. Joe did not understand that his eardrums were not sensitive enough to pick up the insignificant sounds made from pathetic little Eric's vocal chords.

"I guess it really is just some sort of insect that looks human," Joe rationalizes out loud to himself.

Horrified little Eric hears this and falls to his knees in sheer terror. Eric knows he'll never be let go if the titanic jock thinks of him just as some cool bug.

Just for the fun of it, the hulking football jock blows into the Professor's little cage, knocking him down with typhoon sized winds.

"Your just a cool little bug," Joe teases. "You're MY cool little bug."

This horrific statement from the giant jock chilled Eric to the bone. For now, everything was hopeless. Eric was merely a tiny creature whose sole purpose in life was to amuse a colossal young football jock. Eric wondered what would happen when giant Joe no longer found him "amusing and cool"?

Suddenly Joe got a great idea, and he grabbed the phone. Eric was glad to finally not have so much detailed attention directed towards him. When Joe talked on the phone, he was nearly oblivious to the world. The massive giant leaned way back in his chair, propped his monster-sized 16 feet up on the desk where Eric was, and hit speed-dial.

The way in which Eric propped his feet on the desk, his super-colossal white-socked toes hovered directly over the lid of poor little Eric's prison, his only source for fresh air. Eric was repulsed by the stench. Eric had never smelled anything worse than this. And it just got worse. Joe's toes began to wriggle slightly and lowered even more towards the lid. Eric's one and only source for fresh air was now almost completely blocked by Joe's mammoth socked foot. Tears formed in the pathetic little Professor's eyes from the sheer stench. Then Joe began playing with the little cage with his giant foot, moving it around here and there as he yapped on the phone. Eric listened intently at Joe's booming voice. He was curious to what was going on. Might he be calling someone to help him? No such luck for the insignificant little Eric, but the conversation definitely did concern him.

".....hey what's up little bro?........hows mom?.........yeah............nope.......you bet I'll be home for Christmas, and man, little bro do I have a surprise for you this year. I'm bringing you the best present ever!"

On the other end of the phone, Joe's little brother shuttered with excitement. Joe had always gotten him awesome presents, and now this one was going to be the best one ever!

"What is it, what is it, please tell me, please, please," Joe's little brother begged.

"Now it wouldn't be a surprise if I told you little bro," Joe teased. "Lets just say its a lot smaller than a bread box, and is really "cool"!

Joe hung up the phone, and removed his feet from the desk, just before the minuscule little Eric thought he would suffocate.

Joe brought his enormous face right up to the lip of Eric's tiny prison, grinned and casually remarked, "my little bro is going to love you!" Joe then put his headphones on and jumped on his bed to take a little nap. Eric's little universe bounced slightly in the air and shifted about three inches when the behemoth creature landed on his bed.

Eric just stood there stupified. He was truly doomed.

As Eric pondered his ghastly fate, he noticed a piece of masking tape stuck to the outside of his cage with writing on it. It must be a label of some sort. The brilliant, but minuscule professor could just make out the letters from the backside of the tape. He started to decipher the letters and was frozen with fear when he realized the label read:
1441121121111121.title: Just a cool little bug.

choices: No. All out of bugs. I'll pick some up later...
...Well, I do have this one strange bug
14411211211111212.content:
An intense, all-consuming desire to be free of his plastic prison didn't change anything. He was still trapped, a prisoner of a friendly but none-too-bright jock.
For Eric, reality had changed.
He was nothing more than a bug in a world of monstrous giants.
To make matters worse, his own misguided zeal about his experiment had landed him in this dire situation.
He watched giant Joe through the walls of his plastic cage. He tried to ignore the chilling label that had told him that the last occupants of this cage had ended up as food for someone's pet lizard.
Joe dozed off to sleep. Eric watched the giant's massive chest rise and fall with each breath. Soon, with not much else to do, Eric also slipped into sleep.
••••••••
Eric awoke in fright with the loud arrival of one of Joe's giant jock friends. He ran to the front wall of his cage and pressed his hands against the plastic.
The huge jock greeted Joe, who raised up in bed and removed his earphones. "What's going on, Seth?"
"Some of the guys found the lizard, man. They've got him downstairs in the rec room."
"That's good," Joe said. "Wonder where he's been hiding?"
"I don't know," Seth said. "But they sent me to see if you've still got any of those crickets. They said the lizard looks hungry."

Joe tries to think fast. He really wanted to give his cool bug to his kid brother as a present.

Eric is listening to the conversation with a sinking feeling in his stomach. He suddenly realizes there could be worse fates than ending up as a pet for some jock's kid brother.

"No! No! You can't feed me to a damn lizard!" Eric screams.

But kind-hearted Joe is torn. The poor lizard, missing for all this time, probably is hungry...

Joe turns to Seth and says...
14411211211111212.title: Pet...or Pet Food

choices: Tickle Joe's feet.
Other.
144112112111112121.content:
"Sorry, all out of bugs." Joe said. "I'll catch some later."
"Ok, but bring some of them soon!" Seth answered before leaving.

Eric sat down on the plastic floor of his cage, with a sigh of relief.
But his relief was short lived...

Joe didn't went back to his nap: he instead looked at his tiny captive, musing.

"What the hell he have in mind?" Eric wondered, fearing to know the answer.
His fear increased when his titanic captor gave him a mischievous smile, and reached his top when the jock said: "Well, little guy, to be a good pet for my little bro you must learn a few tricks!"

"NOOOO!" Eric shouted, while the lid was lifted, and titanic fingers approached him again...
144112112111112121.title: Joe has another "good" idea...

choices: Massage Joe's ass
Massage Joe's cock
1441121121111121212.title: Other.

choices: Joe storms in and yells...."WAIT"
One of the jocks notices something strange about the little bug.
144112112111112122.content:
Eric peered out of his cage, and focused on Seth. The guy looked like he had just stepped out of an Abercrombie and Fitch catalog. He was tall, lean and and had dirty blond hair that looked liked it had not been combed in a month. He wore baggy jeans and a bright orange sweatshirt.

Seth was not on the football team. He was a soccer player, but he and a couple other soccer players lived in the frat-house which was a majority football players. A true jocks' jock, Seth loved all sports, and was pretty good at all of them.

"Well Joe, got any bugs left?" Seth asked again impatiently. "The lizard needs something to eat. He probably hasn't eaten in days."

"Well I do have this one strange bug that I found," Joe said, still half asleep. "But I was going to take it home to my kid brother for Christmas."

Seth erupted in laughter, "You've got to be kidding, you cheap ass. You can't give your brother no bug for Christmas. He'd probably kick you in the balls for doing that. I know I sure would."

"I guess you're right," chuckled Joe. He realized the absurdity of giving his little brother a bug for a Christmas present. "But it is such a cool little bug!"

"Bugs ain't cool," exclaimed Seth. "The only good bug is one that I've squashed under my foot."

"No, no, no, please no," Eric screamed at the top of his lungs. He grew petrified as he knew where the giant jocks' conversation was headed.

"Yeah Seth, the bug is in that little cage on my desk," Joe said. "You can have it to feed to the lizard. I bet it is half starved to death."

"Cool, man," Seth said, and looked over at the small cage. "As long as its alive. The lizard won't eat anything dead. It's got to be alive and kicking."

"I guess it's still alive," Joe said. "You'd better check and make sure though."

"I've got to play dead," Eric thought to himself. "It's my only hope."

Eric laid down in the cage as motionless as possible, as the mischievous young soccer jock approached the little cage to check him out. Eric froze and looked up in awe as Seth's face hovered over the tiny cage and began to lower to get a more detailed account.

"The damn thing sure is tiny, and it ain't movin," declared Seth.

Suddenly and with no warning Seth yelled, "BOO" into the little cage, and the thundering boom caused Eric to jump up, trembling with fear.

"The little fucker was just playing possum," Seth chuckled. "O.K. little fellow, you're coming with me. I want to introduce you to Mr. Lizard."

Seth grabbed the small cage in one hand and headed briskly back to the reck room where the other jocks were, huddled around their hungry little pet. Joe went back to sleep.

Eric never would get used to being carried through the air by a giant. He was rocked violently and slid from one side of the cage to the other. Seth was none too gentle with the tiny Professor. But why should he be? He thought he was just carrying some bug, not a human being.

"He had one left," Seth exclaimed to the other giant jocks, holding the cage out so everyone could examine the contents.

"That damn thing is too small," one of the giant jocks said. "It will barely be a mouthful. We've got to get this lizard some real food. Somebody go outside and find some crickets or something!"

Eric was humiliated but a little relieved. He was so small , he was not even adequate enough to be lizard food.

Greg was kneeling down looking at the lizard and then grabbed Eric's little cage from Seth and glared down at the measly "insect".

"The lizard has to eat something now," Greg said. "We'll just let this little bug be the appetizer until we can find something more filling."

"No, God no!" Eric cried, as he witnessed Greg effortlessly remove the lid from his cage and begin to reach for him with his terrifying, jumbo sized fingers.

Greg grabbed the tiny insect-sized man with his thumb and forefinger, and lifted him out of the cage. Eric looked down and saw his fate. It was a prehistoric creature from hell. His very own Jurassic nightmare.

The other jocks laughed as Greg dangled the helpless little Professor over the gargantuan reptile, and very slowly began to lower him to his doom.

The lizard sensed it was dinner time and opened his mouth wide. The lizard was hungry and a little peeved at the giant jock for teasing him with the tasty morsel, so he leaped into the air in hopes of gobbling down the bite sized piece of meat. Eric almost had a heart attack.

"Not so fast my lizard friend," Greg teased the hungry reptile, and jerked the little Professor higher into the air. "You know the drill....beg!"

So the lizard waited patiently with it's mouth wide open, and Greg continued lowering Eric towards the awaiting open mouth of the revolting reptile. Eric feared his life was truly over.

Just as Greg was about to release the tiny Professor into the jaws of the lizard.....
144112112111112122.title: An appetizer.

choices: A Glass Jar
A souvenir whiskey shot glass
An empty M&M tube
1441121121111121221.content:
"Wait!" Joe yelled.

Greg's hand froze, halting Eric's descent toward the lizard's gaping mouth. From his diminished perspective, the reptile was bigger than any long-extinct carnivorous dinosaur.

"What the hell is it, man?" Greg demanded, still holding Eric pinched between two fingers.

"Yeah," some of the other assembled jocks protested. "Get on with it. Feed the lizard!"

Eric could not believe this. They were all chanting for his demise in the jaws of the reptilian monstrosity. "No! Help! Help!'

"That's just it," Joe said. "I found a grasshopper and a beetle out in the yard. They'll make a better meal than that weird bug."

"Oh, man," Seth chimed in. "You're not still wanting to give that bug to your brother for a present."

"It is a weird bug," Joe said.

Greg spread open his palm and dropped Eric into the center of it. The giant jock merely glanced. "Doesn't look that special to me."

Joe held out a paper cup with the grasshopper and beetle. Greg took the cup, and turned his palm up for Eric to drop into Joe's waiting hand.

Eric dropped for what seemed like 20 or 30 feet, screaming all the way, into Joe's extended palm.

"There is your precious weird bug, man," Greg said. "Come on, guys. Let's give our lizard his dinner."

Joe turned to leave, but Seth stopped him. "See that you pick up some crickets or something now that we've found the lizard," Seth instructed. "Otherwise, next feeding time we'll have to let him sample your bug, whether or not is weird."

Joe nodded. He hurried back to his room.

In his room, Joe looked for something else to use to keep his tiny "bug" safe and contained. He decides on...
1441121121111121221.title: Joe to the Rescue Again

choices: Wait for Joe's return and do something to get him to recognize you
Oh no! Someone else enters the room
14411211211111212211.content:
Before Eric could think, before he could attempt to scream at the giant, before he could do anything, he felt himself sliding down a steep, sleek surface. He hit the bottom and got to his feet.

At the same time, Joe righted the small glass jar. He then looked down at his strange bug. "I'll take better care of you," Joe said. "You don't gotta worry about getting fed to no lizard. I'm gonna keep you safe until I can take you home to my brother."

Eric's fears rose as his hope sank. How could he get through to this thick-skulled jock? He ran to the glass and began to pound ineffectually with his tiny fists. Looking through the thick glass, his image of Joe's colossal face was distorted.

The big jock raised his hand and Eric heard a raspy sound as Joe began to screw a lid on the jar.

"No! My God! You moron! I'll suffocate!"

WHAM! WHAM!

Eric fell to his knees, assaulted by the explosive sound as Joe used a pencil to stab holes in the jar lid.

Joe tapped on the glass, but Eric continued to writhe on the floor, the concussions of deafening noise still rumbling in his brain. "Bet you thought I'd forget to make some air holes, hey little bug?"

Eric, still weak, tried to regain his senses. A brittle ringing continued to sound in his head. He watched as Joe rose to his feet.

"Well, I got places to go, little bug. Be back soon!'

Joe tapped on the glass one final time, grinned at his little bug, and left.
14411211211111212211.title: In A Jar

choices: Joe mails the package.
Joe stops to eat before mailing the package.
Joe loses the  package
144112112111112122111.content:
Eric felt powerless as he sat in the small glass jar and pondered his horrific circumstances. His blood-curdling encounter with the dinosaur-sized lizard had exhausted him. The tiny Professor tried unsuccessfully to block out the fact that those giant cocky frat-guys had almost fed him to their hideous pet. The thought of being chewed up, swallowed and ending up in the stomach of a gargantuan lizard angered and repulsed the measly little man. Eric was frantic to figure a way out of this ghastly nightmare.

Eric stood and walked to the wall of his glass prison and gazed out upon Joe's massive bedroom. Seeming as big as the Grand Canyon, the room was impressive and quite ominous. The ceiling loomed vast and far away. The mountainous walls were covered with various posters and what looked like newspaper articles. One shelf contained many trophies, and several old looking ratty footballs. Clothes were strewn randomly about, and the room had a strong musky smell of some sort.

Eric was desperate to figure out a way to communicate with the hulking football jock. His only hope for survival and restoration to normal size rested with Joe.

An eerie silence fell over the room and then suddenly Eric was jolted from his deep thought as the bedroom door rushed open. The colossal football jock had returned. Joe casually walked in carrying a number of curious objects in his massive hands. Joe walked over and sat down at his desk, plopping down the items he was carrying.

Eric's little jar had been set on the desk close to the back part. From this vantage point, the little Professor could see everything Joe was doing. He seemed to have brought scissors, tape, and some kind of box. The box had something printed on one side but Eric could not quite make out the words. But the colors and style of the box seemed familiar.

Joe took a deep breath, sighed, and grabbed a big black pen from a drawer in his desk. Tiny Eric was curiously taking in the current events with a bit of uneasiness.

"What in the world is he doing?" the bug-sized Professor thought to himself.

Joe turned the box on its side in order to write something on it. As the box shifted, Eric was horrified as five gargantuan letters came into his full view.

F e d E x

"Oh my God what is he doing?" the minuscule Professor said to himself in a panic. "That box can't possibly be for me, can it?"

After Joe finished writing on the box, he glanced at his little captive and said, "well my curious little bug, just to be on the safe side, I'm going to mail you to my little bro before one of my crazy buddies decides to feed you to the lizard behind my back. And don't worry, my little bro is crazy about bugs. He loves to experiment on them and dissect them and stuff....oh but I'm sure you'll be too "special" to dissect." Joe shook his head and laughed, as he realized he was talking to a bug.

Joe took the little jar and unscrewed the lid. He dropped a few bread crumbs and a cotton ball into the jar.

"Here's a snack for the trip, and hopefully the cotton will prevent you from being jostled around so much," Joe explained with concern to the soon to be traveler. "And don't worry, with FedEx, you'll be in my brother's hands by tomorrow."

Joe screwed the lid back on and also stuck a strip of tape across it for an extra precaution. He then carefully placed the jar inside the box and surrounded it with crumpled up newspaper. Joe then closed the open end of the box and taped it securely shut. With a pen, Joe punched a couple small holes in the side of the box.

"O.K. its time to get you in the mail," Joe said as he grabbed the little box and headed out.
144112112111112122111.title: Special Delivery

choices: Lost in the mail
Special delivery package arrives
1441121121111121221111.content:
Eric was more terrified than he had been since the accident that shrunk him.

Here he was, half an inch tall, trapped in a jar that was packed securely in a FedEx package being shipped to a colossal jock's kid brother.

Fortunately, Joe had packed the jar securely in the package. The jar didn't shift much, but each step by the giant jock caused Eric to slide around on the floor of the glass jar. He collided from time to time with the crumbs Joe had dropped into the jar.

"Help! Help!" Eric screamed, although he knew the futility of the effort.

Inside the package, Eric was in complete darkness except for a few pinpoints of light that shone through the holes Joe had made in the package to allow his tiny "bug" to breathe during shipment.

••••••

Joe dropped off his package, pleased that he would be making his kid brother so happy with this gift of the strange bug he had discovered. Maybe his brother could figure out what sort of bug it was. His brother was smart about such things.

And, in about a week, he would be seeing his family for the holidays. He would get to visit with his little "bug" again...
1441121121111121221111.title: When it absolutely must get there overnight...

choices: Joe's brother opens the package
Joe's brother hears his parents downstairs...and doesn't open package
14411211211111212211112.content:
The next 21 hours proved...an experience.
At one point in his journey, the temperature in the package became downright frigid. Tiny Eric huddled in the wad of cotton until eventually conditions in the box became somewhat more hospitable.
He fed on the meager crumbs that Joe had dropped into the jar before packing it in the mailing package.
He never got any real rest, not with the almost constant jostling. Occasionally, he managed to drift in and out, experiencing a fitful sleep.
••••••
Through the walls of the package, Eric was alerted to a strange ringing. Sort of a melodic chime. A doorbell?
Eric heard a male voice announcing that he had a package.
"It must be from my brother!" The reply sounded like an excitable high-pitched boyish voice.
"Have a good Christmas." The male voice said.
Eric felt the package jostled again.
••••••
Joe's little brother took the package directly to his room. He knew he should have added the package to those piled beneath the family Christmas tree, but his parents were out of the house and he didn't feel like waiting. He could always sneak a peek and re-wrap the package.
14411211211111212211112.title: Don't Open Before Christmas?

choices: the scalpel.
the tweezers.
144112112111112122111121.content:
Jeremy was excited and curious as he carried the small FedEx package to his bedroom. He noticed the return address was from his big brother Joe at college. Jeremy remembered a call from Joe about some special present he was going to give him for Christmas, but he thought his big brother was going to bring it himself during Christmas break.

Jeremy put the small box on his desk and grabbed a pocket knife. He thoroughly cut into one end in anticipation of the mysterious contents. The box was filled with crumpled newspaper, obviously protecting something within. The first thing that caught his attention was a folded piece of paper directly at the top of the box. Jeremy took the paper and unfolded it. It was a note from his big brother Joe. Jeremy read the note.

"Hey Jeremy,
What's up bro. Hope things are going good for you. I found this strange little bug in the frathouse and thought you might like to have it for your collection. I hope it's still alive when you get it. I had to get it out of here because the guys wanted to feed it to our pet lizard. If it's nothing special, just flush it down the toilet or something, no big deal. See ya in a couple weeks.
Joe"

"Cool!" Jeremy said to himself out loud.

Jeremy had a fascination with insects, and had a large collection of different species. Several large shelves in his room were cluttered with various sized jars of many different kinds of insects. Jeremy had become quite the professional collector. He had many of the tools necessary for the examination, experimentation, and preservation of insects.

Jeremy eagerly reached into the FedEx box and pulled out the small jar containing the minuscule, scared college Professor.

Darkness turned into a blinding light as Eric's prison jar was pulled from its transport by the gigantic youth. Jeremy was not gentle with the jar so Eric was violently thrown about. When the motion stopped, Eric looked out to see two enormous, ominous eyes fixed directly on him. Eric felt uncomfortable as Jeremy examined him from all directions within the tiny glass prison.

"What in the world are you?" Jeremy said, as he slightly tilted the jar and gently tapped it with his giant finger.

"O.K. lets try this again," Eric said to himself, intimidated by the jumbo finger tapping curiously at him. The tiny Professor jumped up and down, waving his arms in a desperate attempt at communicating with the young giant. "Please, you've got to help me. I was accidentally shrunk during an experiment."

At Eric's meager size, he was just too small to be identified as a human being. Jeremy thought he was just some curious little insect for him to examine.

"You are an interesting looking little thing," Jeremy said with a mischievous smile. "I'm going to have to give you a thorough examination. But first I'm going to have to finish up with a current patient."

Eric was terrified at the thought of an "examination" by the extremely curious young giant, but he was powerless to prevent it. The bug-sized Professor's only hope was that a close examination by Jeremy would reveal that he was actually a human being.

Jeremy took Eric's small jar and put it on an enormous work table of some sort. Eric was petrified as he took in his new surroundings. To his left were five jars that contained different kinds of insects. Only one insect appeared to be alive. Next to the jars was a small vial that appeared to contain a small bug being preserved in some kind of liquid. Several ghastly looking metal instruments were neatly arranged to one side of the table. Eric recognized several instruments as forceps, tweezers, and an enormous shiny razor sharp scalpel. Farther to one side of the table were two plastic bottles. Each were labeled, "POISON---KILL JAR".

Directly in front of the now extremely uneasy tiny Professor was a strange board. Eric was repulsed to see an unrecognizable insect secured to the board with horrific giant metal pins. The pins had been pierced directly through the insect. Jeremy loomed menacingly far above. Eric shuddered as he realized he had become a specimen for this young mad scientist.

"Just be patient, I'll get to you next," Jeremy said to the trapped little Professor he thought to be an insect.

Jeremy looked down at his current specimen on the spreading board. It would occasionally twitch trying to free itself of the deadly sharp pins that had it secured.

Jeremy reached down and picked up
144112112111112122111121.title: Waiting to be Examined

choices: Jeremy calls Joe to quiz him for details on the "bug"
Jeremy decides it is time to remove the "bug" from the jar
1441121121111121221111211.content:
Eric watched as the giant youth picked up a scalpel. Its metal blade gleamed in the light.

"What the hell's he going to do with that?" Eric wondered.

He watched as Jeremy lowered the blade toward the still-twitching insect's carapace. He made a quick incision along the insect's abdomen.

Eric felt sick. He watched in horror as Jeremy continued his gruesome surgical procedure on the helpless insect. It's twitching grew fainter and finally stopped.

Jeremy looked up from his work. He smiled as he looked at the jar containing the "bug" his brother had sent him. He still held the ghastly scalpel in his hand.

"I wonder where Joe found such a weird bug?" Jeremy whispered.
1441121121111121221111211.title: Witnessing a Procedure

choices: he reached for his magnifying glass.
his dad yells at him to get ready for soccer practice.
14411211211111212211112112.content:
Jeremy was a good kid. He did not have a mean streak in his body. Unless you were an insect. His experiments on the poor little creatures would make most people cringe. He was fascinated by all aspects of the tiny creatures. He would carefully remove an insect's wings with tweezers while it was still alive to study how it would react to its environment without wings. None of his specimens lived very long after an experiment began. But Jeremy's favorite activity was dissecting the little insects. He liked to see what they looked like on the inside.

Jeremy finished the gruesome examination of his current specimen. He removed the metal pins from the spreading board, wiped up the remaining mess with a kleenex and tossed it into a trash can. He disinfected the board with some rubbing alcohol, and then glared directly at Eric.

Jeremy picked up the little jar Eric was in to have a look at his new interesting little bug. After witnessing the horrible procedure on the previous specimen, Eric was scared half to death.

"Very interesting...what am I going to do with you?" Jeremy said aloud. "You are too tiny to dissect, but I would like to do some experiments before I "preserve" you. What should I do?"

Jeremy put the jar back on the table and picked up a thin paperback book and began to read to himself aloud, "Killing bottles -- Once the insect has been captured, it should be killed quickly and in a way that leaves it relaxed. This is usually achieved by placing the specimen in a killing bottle moistened with a killing agent. Only one or two drops are needed to charge the jar with vapour sufficiently concentrated to effect rapid death..."

Tiny Eric heard every word. His new surreal circumstances were just too much to handle. From a combination of mental terror and exhaustion, he fainted.

Jeremy finished reading and decided it was time to remove his new little bug from its jar. He unscrewed the lid and carefully turned the jar, and what he thought was a little bug fell right into his hand. He examined the tiny creature the best he could, but it was so small. He touched it with one of his fingers, and turned it over, examining it from all sides. It was motionless.

"Oh no, it's dead," Jeremy said with disappointment. "I'd better get you in a vial of alcohol immediately so that you will be properly preserved."

Eric lay unconscious in Jeremy's giant hand as he prepared the vial of alcohol with the other. Eric was unaware he was about to meet a gruesome fate at the hands of this curious youngster.

Eric looked out from his small glass prison into the vast expanse of Jeremy's bedroom. The brilliant college Professor was truly humbled. He had gone from the inventor of a device that would surely change the world and win him a Nobel Prize, to a meager addition to a boy's insect collection. And he was the smallest of all the specimens. The next smallest insect seemed over twice his size. The gruesome spider in the jar next to him was gigantic. The pitiful little man would have no chance if he encountered such a monster. At least it was dead. Eric stared at the nightmarish spider, intimidated by the sheer size and horrific appearance. It almost seemed to be glaring right at him.

Suddenly the frightful spider came alive and pounced savagely at the glass wall in an attempt to get at the tiny man. Eric fell back onto the glass surface and crouched in complete terror as his horrific neighbor continued its futile effort to reach the half-inch tall man.

"Please someone help me. Get me out of here!" Eric screamed, trying not to look at the awful creature that wanted to have him for dinner. "This can't be happening to me!"

Eric felt his glass prison begin to shake as if an earthquake had begun. The ground beneath him continued to rumble as he witnessed two rambunctious boys storm into the room. Joe's brother had returned with a friend.

"Hey Jeremy, ya got any new bugs I can torture?" Patrick asked with a laugh as he threw a soccer ball to Jeremy and kicked off his sneakers.

"Just one, but the darn thing is dead," Jeremy replied, tossing the ball back to Patrick as he kicked off his sneakers. "It's in that jar next to the spider."

"Cool," Patrick said as he threw the soccer ball into a corner and walked over to the shelf housing Jeremy's collection. "Something has got that spider all riled up."

Patrick looked over into the jar next to the spider and studied Jeremy's new little "bug".

"That spider sure does want to get at that little bug," Patrick said with fascination. "Maybe the spider is hungry. Let's feed that bug to the spider."

Eric listened to Patrick's words in complete horror. He began to panic. The tiny man stood up and pounded the glass wall. He yelled at Patrick with all of his might. "I am not a bug! I am a man! Please help me!

"You can't feed the spider a dead bug," Jeremy explained to Patrick.

"This bug is alive and kickin," Patrick responded, as he reached for Eric's little jar. "Come on Jeremy, I want to see the spider eat it."

Eric's pitiful pleas were ignored by the mischievous youth, as he effortlessly picked up the little jar and began to unscrew the lid.

"No, please don't put me in the jar with that monster," Eric pleaded as Patrick turned the jar on its side and let tiny Eric fall into the palm of his hand.

"No way Patrick," Jeremy said. "If it's still alive, I want to study it for a while. I have some new experiments I want to try out on it."

Patrick removed the lid of the spider's jar. He lifted the tiny "bug" with his thumb and forefinger, and dangled the helpless creature directly over the much bigger spider.

"Please Jeremy, let me feed the spider," Patrick pleaded, slowly lowering Eric closer and closer to his doom. "This spider is really hungry."

The gymnasium was state of the art. Athletics, especially football, brought in millions of dollars to the school, and school officials and alumni had every intention of making sure the athletic department wanted for nothing.

There were also eight other football jocks lifting weights, making sure their muscular bodies were in top shape for the incredibly huge game on Saturday.

I freaked out when I thought it looked like a tiny little man, so I took it and showed it to Seth. We looked at it through his magnifying glass, and sure enough, it's a real tiny little man."

"He is so small, his voice is probably too faint to hear," Scott explained. "Here, I brought him with me, why don't you have a better look. Oh, and before I forget, crazy Seth wants to buy him from you. He wants to keep him as a pet or something."

"Oh yeah, I saw him Scott," one of the muscular brutes said with mock concern, and then lifted his huge sneaker so that Scott could see the bottom. "I accidentally stepped on your tiny friend, and this is all thats left of the little fucker."

Scott looked at the bottom of the guys sneaker in horror as the other guys laughed. Scott did not know if the guy was serious or just kidding. The bottom of his sneaker did look disgusting. "What a waste," Scott thought somberly, imagining the tiny man's horrible demise.

"He's not anywhere around here," Joe yelled to Scott, still on the floor searching frantically. "Did any of those guys see him?"

Scott slowly walked back over to where Joe was searching, his head lowered and gloomily said, "One of those assholes squashed the little fellow with his sneaker."

"We should have never left him here alone," Joe said. "Something that little did not even have a chance against these careless brutes."

"I'm going home," Scott said, visibly disturbed. "I'll see ya later."

"O.K. buddy, see ya," Joe said and gave Scott a consoling pat on the back. Not feeling like working out any more, he went to take a shower.

The towering mass of muscles reached down and grabbed another impressive mound of cotton and proceeded to put it on one of his frightfully large feet.

"Oh God, I've got to get off this thing before he puts it on his foot," Eric thought to himself in a panic as he crawled frantically trying to escape the seemingly endless and horribly smelly sock.
144112112111112122112122222111111.title: Oh my God what a big sock!

Under his toes

It doesn't take long at all for you to tumble all the way down into the putrid, damp toe of the sock. Before you can even get your bearing, you see 5 giant toes headed your way. As his foot settles into place you find yourself...

The giant stood
14411211211111212211212222211111111.content:
"No," Eric screamed as the row of toes, each bigger than his puny body, advanced toward him.

Certain he would be crushed, Eric felt temporary relief when he didn't immediately face such a prospect.

Instead, he found himself lodged in a crevice, the space between the two largest toes on the giant's foot.

He threw his arms over the top of the largest toe in an attempt to pull himself out of the crevice.

He failed when...

Play Tackle Football
