One of the Giant Jocks say to Max "Do you want go for a pizza?" and Max says "I am not sure now maybe we can play tackle football instead but I am going to turn in at ten because I was up really late last night." After Eric realizes that he is not going to take his shoes off for at least for five more hours because he does not get back to the dorm room until 10:00PM.
144112112111112122112122222111111111.title: Between Toes, In A Sock, And Also In A Shoe

choices: Coach Smith.
A giant he did not recognize.
Several giants
1441121121111121221121222221111112.content:
Still dazed from being doused with jock-itch spray and the horrendous fall, Eric tried his best to escape the damp, smelly sweat-sock before the frighteningly large football jock grabbed it with his enormous hand. Max's hand descended in what seemed almost like slow motion to the frantic shrunken man. Just as Eric thought he was about to escape the awful sock, he slipped into the open mouth of the sock. He was able to grab the edge just before falling into the deep moist cavern for which he knew there would be no return. With all the strength he could muster, Eric pulled himself out of the sock opening and jumped off to the locker room floor. A split second later, the giant scooped up his sock high into the air and proceeded to put it on his truly monster-sized foot. Eric watched in horror and gasped as he realized how close he was to being smashed between the toes of that behemoth.

Afraid the giant football player would mistake him for some awful bug that needed to be stepped on, Eric ran and hid at the edge of one of the giant lockers. Eric looked on with fascination as the giant got dressed. He was truly living in a world of giants. He felt very small and insignificant.

Eric looked off into the distance of the vast locker room and noticed a door. It was labeled with building sized letters that read, "COACH'S OFFICE".

"Oh God yes, Bruce will help me. I have got to get in there," Eric thought to himself with a renewed sense of determination. "Bruce, please be in there!"

This was coach Bruce Smith's fourth year as head football coach. Eric and Bruce had become very good friends the past couple of years. Coach Smith's first year was filled with turmoil as the team went winless and the star primadona quarterback transferred to a rival school. Alumni wanted him fired, but Professor Brevard was one of only a few supporters that wanted to give him a fair chance to turn the program around. And this year it was all coming together. The team was undefeated, ranked number one in the country, and only had to beat Michigan this Saturday to get a chance to play for the National Championship in the Fiesta Bowl.

Eric estimated the door to be about nine feet away. "Just about a quarter mile for me," the half-inch tall man thought to himself.

Max had dressed and wondered over to talk to one of his football buddies. Eric began his sprint. He ran across the dull-green concrete floor, avoiding small pieces of dirt and lint that seemed as big as small boulders to him. Half way to his goal, Eric was startled as he looked up and saw a giant walking his way. One of the wrestlers was headed in to take a shower after working out. Eric was helpless as he saw the enormous wrestling shoe pound his way. He just crouched, held his arms over his head, and waited. The tiny man would be no match for the colossal shoe. It would squash him to a pulp if it landed on him. Eric held his breath as the horrific shoe landed right next to him. He felt like he had just felt a magnitude ten earthquake. Then the powerful shoe effortlessly lifted into the air and the giant was gone.

Eric stood up and continued his sprint to the door of the coach's office. He reached the door and stopped to catch his breath. Eric easily slipped under the door and entered the office. He looked over and saw;
1441121121111121221121222221111112.title: Trying Not to Get Stepped On

choices: Max storms into the office to tell Coach something.
Coach slams one of his feet to the floor.
14411211211111212211212222211111121.content:
Eric peered over to the far corner of the office and saw Coach Smith sitting on an old ratty couch watching game film. Coach had spent many a night on that couch. Developing game plans lasted till the very early morning hours, so it made no sense to go home. He would just work until exhaustion, and then crash on the couch.

Eric was exhilarated when he saw Coach Smith. Bruce would definitely help him. Too tired to run anymore, Eric began walking towards the giant coach.

"Bruce, hey Bruce, it's Eric. You've got to help me!" Eric yelled in the direction of the giant coach, but his screams were so pitifully faint, Coach Smith could not hear them. "I have got to get closer so he can hear me."

As Eric approached his giant friend, he could not help looking up in awe at the magnificent man. The mega-giant coach was huge. Coach Smith was about 40, but was in great shape. Tall and muscular, the thing Eric always noticed the most was his piercing blue eyes. His blonde hair was buzz cut military style, giving him a slight drill Sargent look. He was not mean to his players and did not yell a lot, but he did demand their respect, and undivided attention.

Eric reached the giant couch, still attempting to get Coach Smith's attention, but the giant coach was oblivious to Eric's meager screams. Eric had to find some way to get his attention.

Coach Smith had his grey athletic socked feet propped up on a table, and his old grungy Nike sneakers were sitting at the foot of the couch.

"I've got to get closer so he can hear me," Eric thought, so he began climbing one of Coach Smith's gigantic sneakers. "God Bruce, these things are worn out. You'd think on eight hundred thousand a year, you could afford some new sneakers."

Eric made it to the toe of the sneaker and yelled once again with no effect. "Why did I have to shrink so damn small?" Eric thought to himself in frustration. "I've just got to get higher."

The tiny man climbed up across the laces and made it to the edge of the opening of the shoe. He started to crawl around to the heel of the sneaker. He looked over the edge and gasped. It was a very long way down into the shoe. And the smell emitting from the dark cavern was horrible. "Just don't fall in...don't fall in," Eric kept thinking to himself. He looked up at the giant and yelled once again, "Bruce, you have got to help me, please help me!"

But Eric was just too small to hear. Coach continued watching the Michigan game film with his remote control, rewinding any interesting plays that caught his attention. Eric realized his attempt at climbing the shoe so he could be heard had been futile. Now came the daunting task of getting down from the gigantic shoe.

But before Eric could contemplate how he was going to get off the shoe, Eric was shaken violently when:
14411211211111212211212222211111121.title: Coach Smith

choices: Max and Bruce leave
Max and Bruce keep stomping around the office
144112112111112122112122222111111211.content:
Max, the colossal football team captain, stormed into the office.

"YO, COACH!" The young behemoth bellowed. "HAVE YOU SEEN THE LATEST RANKINGS?"

Eric, still stranded atop Bruce's reeking sneaker, could only watch in horror as the unstoppable force rushed toward him.

Max stumbled, tripping on a sneaker belonging to the coach.

"CAREFUL," Bruce joked. "CAN'T LOSE MY TEAM CAPTAIN BEFORE THE PLAYOFFS."

Neither man saw the tiny figure flung off the sneaker by the impact of the jolt delivered by Max.

Eric felt himself propelled through space. Then, the floor rushed up to meet him. Something snapped.

"WHAT ARE YOU DOING?" Max asked.

"WATCHING SOME GAME FOOTAGE," Bruce replied.

Eric tried to move, but he felt a sharp pain in his right leg. Suddenly, a huge socked foot slammed down inches from him. He felt displaced air deliver the rank stench from Bruce's sweaty sock.

"Bruce!" Eric screamed as he recognized his friend's enormous socked foot. "Help!"

The tiny scientist could not run. "Crawl, dammit," he told himself.

He decided to get out of the office. He should never have deluded himself into thinking he could successfully attract his friend's attention. He rolled over on his back, trying to prepare himself for a way to get out from underfoot.

"NO!" Eric screamed as he saw the bottom of Max's enormous sneaker shadow him.

He tried to flee, but the injured leg proved useless.

The sneaker came down.

Eric gasped. He could almost stretch out his hand and touch the wall represented by the sole of Max's sneaker.

That was way too close!
144112112111112122112122222111111211.title: Deadly Office Space

1441121121111121221121222221111112112.content:
Eric, in pain on the dirty tiles in his friend's office, managed to gaze upward as the enormous athlete spread his legs and stood like an unbelievable colossus in front of the desk.

Max wore a pair of flimsy workout shorts. Not knowing he had attracted an audience, the jock dropped one of his hands to the front of his shorts and adjusted himself.

Looking up at the spectacle, Eric saw Max adjust a massive package that would have dwarfed the shrunken scientist. The imagery burned into his tiny brain and reinforced how insignificant he had managed to make himself in the universe.

Eric continued to stare at the massive, hairy columns supporting the majestic torso and head of the giant athlete until—

Another crash alarmed him. He jerked his head to the side and saw his friend on the move again.

"Bruce," the tiny scientist whimpered. "Please, look down. Here! On the floor!"

He tried to imagine them finding him, lifting his teeny body off the dangerous floor, keeping him securely in an enormous hand. He almost lost himself in that appealing fantasy until the terribly loud world intruded again.

The shrunken man listened to their shockingly loud voices. "I did have something I wanted to show you," Coach Smith told his team captain.

"Oh yeah?" Max inquired.

"Nooo," Eric cried. "Please, stop moving..."

Everything went dark. One of the giants had taken another step.

In his terror, Eric struggled to even identify the foot about to obliterate him.

In the final second before the impact, he saw the bottom of a tremendous sneaker speeding toward him.

••••••

"I need to get going," Max told the coach, completely unaware of the destruction wrought beneath his foot.

"All right, big guy," Bruce commented.

Only later, when he went to put on his own shoes, did Bruce notice the tiny red stains showing in the grime of Max's sneaker prints.

"Hmmm, must have stepped in something," Bruce commented aloud to himself.
1441121121111121221121222221111112112.title: Crushed Hope

choices: Bruce grabs sneaker, turning it upside down
Bruce shoves his huge feet into his sneakers
144112112111112122112122222111111212.content:
A massive gray-clad object slammed down, sending a violent concussion through the grungy sneaker. Tiny Eric, perched precariously, pitched forward, plunging headfirst into the interior of the coach's Nike sneaker.

He hit the bottom of the sneaker hard, but its spongy surface cushioned the blow. He quickly rolled onto his back and looked up.

The coach had now placed both feet on the floor and crossed the floor to reach into a compact fridge to remove a bottle of cold water. He unscrewed the cap on the bottle and gulped down the water.

From inside the shoe, Eric watched his giant friend tilt back his head and swallow the water. "Bruce! Bruce! Help!" Eric shouted.

The tiny man looked around. The sides of the sneaker enclosed him. There wasn't any way back out. And the smell— it was overwhelming. His eyes stung and he found it difficult to breathe.

"Now you've done it," Eric muttered. He hoped his friend wouldn't soon put on the shoe.

For once, luck smiled on him. After finishing the water, the coach resumed his position on the couch and resumed watching videotapes football plays.

Suddenly, there was a knock at the door of the office.

"Come in," Bruce called out.

The door opened. To Eric's shock, he saw himself looking up at his student, Scott. The massive football player still looked immense and powerful.

"Hi, coach," Scott said in a dejected voice.

"Scott, something the matter?" The coach turned off the television.

"I took your advice and went to talk to my science teacher about my grades," Scott confided. "But he wasn't in his lab."

"That's because I shrunk!" Eric shouted, desperate to get the attention of one of the giants. "Help! Help!"

"You had anything to eat?" Coach Smith asked his star player.

"No."

"Let's grab a bite," the coach suggested. "I just need to slip on my shoes and we'll be on our way."
144112112111112122112122222111111212.title: Coaching Duties

choices: Wait in the office
Venture out of the office for a look
1441121121111121221121222221111112121.content:
As Bruce grabbed his sneaker, he happened to turn it upside-down, catching an unprepared Eric by surprise.

The tiny man fell from the sneaker and smacked into the floor before he had a chance to scream. Stunned by impact, he lost consciousness.

When he regained awareness, the office was empty and silent. He cataloged a variety of aches in his muscles as he pushed himself off the floor and onto his feet.

He figured the coach and Scott had left for his meal. With a shiver, he realized he was fortunate one of the huge lugs hadn't stomped on him on their way out of the office.

No matter how hard he tried, Eric had simply had no luck contacting any giants. He tried his best not to get discouraged.

He now faced a new dilemma. Should he wait for the coach to return to his office or should he take his chances once again in the locker room?
1441121121111121221121222221111112121.title: Eric takes a tumble

choices: Eric makes it out of the way!
Eric is stuck between the basketball giant's toes!
14411211211111212211212222211111121212.content:
"No, I'll find someone. I can't stay like this forever!"

With his determination renewed, Eric squeezed himself under the door of the coach's office. He wasn't sure what would happen next, but it couldn't be worse than almost getting stomped by one of his friends.

Looking around the locker room, he realized just how wrong he was. Eric had been out much longer than he thought. The football players were gone, but the basketball team had taken their place! Eric looked up in both fear and awe at the enormous giants above him. The football players he'd been with so far had been giants, but the basketball team was even bigger.

Most of them hovered around the seven foot mark although some looked to be taller still. These giants would be even more difficult to get ahold of. As Eric was lost in thought, a shadow covered him. Looking up to see what caused the shadow, Eric saw an enormous bare foot overhead. The sweaty reddened sole was long, but also wide which made escape rather unlikely. Eric still had to try. He'd survived too much to die now!
14411211211111212211212222211111121212.title: Basketball Nightmare!

choices: The front of his athletic briefs
His massive sock
144112112111112122112122222111111212121.content: Eric jumped in a last ditch effort to escape from the foot of the giant and to his surprise he made it. The thud caused by the foot is enormous. You just lie on the ground in shock staring up at the massive face. The giant seems to be East Indian with a nicely grimmer black beard. He has large biceps and well defined abs and pecs. Your so lost in awe of the beautiful giant that you don't notice him bending down. He bends down to pull on his sock and sees you lying on the ground. Before you can do anything his massive hand picks you up and brings you to his face. He stares at you until another player asks what are you starring at Raj? Nothing he responds as he shoves you in
144112112111112122112122222111111212121.title: A new ally?

choices: He felt an itch between his toes
He'd rather go home and shower
144112112111112122112122222111111212122.content:
Nathan had a lot of things going for him. He was 6'4, brown hair, and striking blue eyes. He'd been working out since he was 15, and at 20, he was ripped. All this, plus playing on the basketball team, made him a very attractive man, and boy did he know it. After years of girls complimenting his amazing body, he couldn't imagine a single thing about himself that wasn't perfect. Sometimes he felt truly above everyone else.
         Eric, was in no position to argue with that, although he could think of one imperfection that Nathan had. Although he avoided being killed, Eric was now stuck in between Nathan's toes, and the stench was far from heavenly. With no other option, Eric clung for dear life to the sweaty skin in between Nathan's big and second toe, as it radiated a smell that made Eric want to vomit. As Nathan's feet rose and fell Eric wondered if maybe his shrink ray had just killed him, and all his experiences afterwards were just hell.
         As Nathan, wearing only a towel, headed to the showers he realized...
144112112111112122112122222111111212122.title: Nathan's toes

choices: Scott looks closer at the "bug".
Scott hands the shoe back to Coach Smith.
1441121121111121221121222221111112122.content:
"Oh my God, he's going to put on his shoes. I'll be crushed!" Eric thought to himself in a panic. "Please Bruce, you have to look down here and see me!"

The tiny human man jumped up and down and screamed in wild desperation to get the mammoth coach's attention. A colossal foot encased in a massive grey cotton sock lifted over the old worn out sneaker Eric was trapped in. The minuscule man ran to one of the sneaker walls, and dug his fingernails into the smooth surface in a futile attempt to climb out of the horrible sneaker that was about to be his tomb. Eric looked up in horror and gasped as he saw Bruce's monstrous toes descending into the shoe. The bug-sized Professor could not scale the smooth walls of the gigantic sneaker and he fell on his back, the enormous approaching toes filling his entire vision. Just when Eric thought he was about to be smashed, the enormous foot paused.

"Scott, which teacher are you having a problem with?" Coach questioned his star quarterback, delaying putting his sneaker on just for a moment.

"It's Professor Brevard," the impressive young jock answered. "I don't think he knows how important it is for me to get a good grade in that class."

"You mean Eric, Eric Brevard?" Coach said with a big smile. "Eric is a good friend of mine. I will have a talk with him. I am positive we can work something out."

"Awesome Coach. That is a huge relief," Scott replied as he glanced down just as Coach Smith was about to put on his sneaker. "Coach, man you need some new sneakers. Those have had it."

Coach Smith reached down and picked up one of his old sneakers and held it proudly in the air as if he were presenting it to Scott. It just happened to be the shoe his buddy Eric was trapped in. Temporarily saved from being squashed like a bug, the lifting effect of the sneaker was traumatic. This and the revolting aroma that permeated the sneaker made Eric even more queasy.

"These are just barely broken in," the coach said turning the sneaker around so Scott could take in the view at all angles. "And anyway, these are my lucky sneakers. They ain't going nowhere."

In an effort to humor his coach, Scott grabbed the sneaker and pretended to examine it with fascination. Just as he was about to hand it back to his coach, he glanced inside and spotted something that looked like a tiny bug.

"Coach, you've got a bug in your shoe," Scott exclaimed.
1441121121111121221121222221111112122.title: Coach's Lucky Sneakers Really Stink

choices: A small, insignificant move...
Dinner with Bruce and Scott...
14411211211111212211212222211111121222.content:
To Eric's shock, Bruce only laughed. "A bug, heh?"
Scott handed the stinking sneaker back to his coach.
Bruce tilted the shoe, sending Eric tumbling back into the shadows toward the heel region. He saw a glimpse of something tiny falling deeper into his shoe.
"Well, we'll see if this shoe's lucky for that little bug," Bruce commented, lowering the shoe toward his foot.
Scott frowned. "Gross, coach! Why would you want to walk around with a bug trapped in your shoe?"
"He's not hurting me," Bruce said, chuckling. "We'll see what kind of stuff's this bug's made of after he spends some time in there!"
•••••
In the dim interior of the sneaker, Eric was horrified to see the back of Bruce's gray sock-clad foot rush toward him. He felt like he had been slammed into a wall at high velocity. There was precious little space between the back of Bruce's sock and the wall of the sneaker.
And then his giant friend began to move.
••••••
"Let's go get something to eat, Scott, and we can discuss your situation with Professor Brevard," Bruce commented.
Bruce followed his hulking football player out of the office and headed toward the parking lot outside the building.
••••••
He could not breathe. The pressure on his puny body and the stench inside the shoes combined to torment the shrunken professor. Eric could not believe he was in such intimate proximity with one of his best friends, yet he was helpless to convey his situation to the coach.
One small, insignificant move on Bruce's part, and Eric knew he would become a smear inside the coach's lucky sneaker.
14411211211111212211212222211111121222.title: A Crowded Space

choices: Greg and Joe arrive with the amp.
Greg and five other football jocks show up with the amp.
144112112111112122112122222111111212221.content:
As Coach Smith rambled on about Michigan's defensive line, Scott's mind wondered as he thought about the tiny man that had met his demise at the feet of his buddies in the weight room. As the two men reached the steps that led to the parking lot, the young quarterback suddenly stopped and gave the Coach a concerned look.

"What's wrong Scott?" Coach asked. Scott just stood there motionless in deep thought.

The sweltering sneaker was about to finish off the helpless Professor. The pressure from Bruce's foot was powerful and Eric felt he could not last much longer before he suffocated. The pitiful shrunken man was worn out. He had no fight left in him. He was ready for it all to be over.

"Take your shoe off Coach, and be careful," Scott said. "I want to have a look at that bug again."

"You gotta be kidding me."

"I'm serious Coach, take your damn shoe off!"

Coach Smith was startled. His star quarterback had never cussed him before. Bruce sat down on the steps and slowly removed his shoe that he had trapped the unlucky bug in. Coach was concerned about Scott weirding out on him just before the big game. Coach lifted his shoe and glanced at the tiny creature trapped inside.

"Here ya go Scott, here's your little bug," Coach said as he tilted his sneaker over Scott's hand and let the little bug topple into his grasp.

Scott lifted the little man close to his face and exclaimed, "I don't know how, but I had a feeling that it was you little buddy. I hope you're okay."

Groggy little Eric looked up and realized he was once again in the massive hand of one of his giant jock students. It sure beat Bruce's sneakers.

"You're starting to worry me Scott," Coach said as he put his grungy sneaker back on.

"Coach, let's go back to your office. I have something incredible to show you," Scott said with a sudden burst of happiness. "This is really going to freak you out."

The muscular football player carefully enclosed the tiny man within his hand and hurried back to Coach Smith's office, the Coach following close behind, wondering what the hell was going on.

The titanic football jock gently placed tiny Eric on Coach Smith's desk and switched on a lamp that was on the desk. Eric looked up at Scott and his giant friend Bruce and waved. "Hey Bruce, it's me, Eric."

Coach Smith took his reading glasses from his pocket and took a look at Scott's little bug. "Whaddaya think Coach? You ever seen a man this tiny before?"

"It just can't be," Coach Smith replied in disbelief, and moved closer to get a better look. "Oh my God! Eric is that you?"

"Yes, yes, yes, it's me!" Professor Brevard yelled at the giant coach. "Oh, thank God!"

"You know this little guy?" Scott asked as he examined the tiny man even closer.

"This is Eric Brevard!"

"You mean Professor Brevard?"

"Yes!"

"Eric, how the hell did this happen to you?" Bruce asked and his hurricane strength breath knocked the little guy to his butt. "Oh, I am sorry."

"Coach, you have got to be careful. He is really fragile. I can't believe this is Professor Brevard. This is so feaky."

Eric yelled up at the giants hovering over him, but his meager voice was inaudible to the behemoths.

"We have got to figure out a way to communicate with him," Coach told Scott. "You got any ideas?"

"Hey, Greg has a amp for his electric guitar," Scott thought out loud. "We could hook up a microphone to that and maybe we could hear him then."

"Great idea!" Coach said as he grabbed the phone from his desk and handed it to Scott. "Give Greg a call and tell him to get his butt over here right now with that amp."

"Hang tight Eric, we are going to get to the bottom of this."

"Oh no, not Greg!" Eric thought in a panic as he remembered the cocky jock known as the exterminator that tried to feed him to their horrible pet lizard. Eric shivered at the thought of meeting that giant again.
144112112111112122112122222111111212221.title: Among Friends

choices: Everyone heads to the lab.
They will help Eric return to normal after the big game.
1441121121111121221121222221111112122211.content:
Eric rested on Coach Smith’s cluttered desk while the two hulking behemoths discussed him as if he were not even there. The tiny man could only watch in bemused fascination as the animated muscular jock quarterback rambled almost incoherently to Coach Smith about the day’s events and his bug-sized college professor.

“I mean…this is the most incredible, freakin thing I have ever,” the buff college athlete excitedly expressed his thoughts to his somber and more rational football coach. “I can’t wait till Greg gets here with that amp so we can find out what the hell happened to him.”

“Just calm down Scott,” Coach Smith urged his star quarterback as he tried to juggle the thoughts of the upcoming biggest football game of his life, and the horrific fate of his friend and colleague. “We will get to the bottom of this.”

As Eric waited anxiously for yet another colossal college jock to arrive, he could not help but look skyward at the two magnificent, all-powerful giants that loomed over him. Scott was truly an impressive young man. It was all his ultra-tight shirt could manage to contain his overly muscled torso and bulging biceps. And his friend Bruce wasn’t too bad either.

Eric felt a little bad that all this was happening right before the huge game. Even though Eric wasn’t the biggest football fan, he knew how much this one football game meant to his friend. One win here against their fiercest rival Michigan meant a guaranteed spot in the National Championship game at the Fiesta Bowl. And now tiny Eric knew he had become a major distraction.

Suddenly Joe and Greg rushed into Coach Smith’s office with the amplifier Greg used to jam out with his electric guitar.

“So you found my little bug man?” Joe asked excitedly as he walked up to Scott and Coach. “Where is he?”

“Are all of you insane?” Greg asked with a mocking laugh as he held on to his amplifier. “Okay, where can I set this fucking thing? It’s getting really heavy.”

“He is right there on the desk Joe,” Scott told his jock buddy. “And you ain’t going to believe this, but your little bug man is actually Professor Brevard.”

“Oh fuck!” Greg exclaimed in complete disbelief as he saw a tiny man standing on Coach Smith’s desk. “That is not possible.”

“Let’s watch the language Greg,” Coach Smith informed his athlete sternly. “Set that amp on the edge of the desk, and be careful.”

“Sorry coach,” Greg apologized remembering the unofficial rule of cursing in the coach’s office. He carefully set the amp down on the edge of the desk and plugged in a microphone. “There, that’s got it.”

Eric cringed as Greg set the enormous black box on the desk. Even though Greg was extremely carefully, the impact knocked the shrunken Professor to his butt. Eric watched in awe as Greg plugged a microphone into the monstrous amplifier. Greg then placed the tractor trailer sized microphone next to the minuscule man as Coach and the two other muscular college athletes watched with intense curiosity. Greg then plugged the amp into a nearby outlet and turned it on.

“So how’s my little bug man doing?” Joe asked the tiny Professor in the same manner he would talk to a pet. “Can you talk?”

“He is not a bug man! He is my friend Eric Brevard,” Coach Smith gruffly informed Joe as he gave him a rough shove on the head. “He is to be treated with the utmost respect! Got it?”

“Yeah, sorry coach,” Joe said a little surprised Coach had roughed him up a bit. “I got it.”

All four giants then focused all their attention on the shrunken man next to the microphone. Coach Smith spoke as the other behemoths held their breath with anticipation.

“Eric, how did this happen to you?” Coach softly asked and then waited anxiously for an answer. A few seconds of total silence followed.

“Well Bruce, you know that important project I have been working on so hard for the past several months,” Eric began what he knew would be a lengthy explanation. “It was a shrink-ray.”

All four mega-giant men listened in complete awe as tiny Eric began the saga that found him here in Coach’s office, shrunk to a mere half an inch tall.

“And I got it to work. I used the device on myself with the intent that I would only be shrunk momentarily, and then the machine would return me to normal,” Eric continued. “But something went wrong and I was stuck like this.”

“Incredible!” Scott mumbled. “So how the hell did you end up in that jar in Joe’s room?”

“Actually Scott…when you visited my office, I stowed away in your backpack in that pocket with the tootsie rolls,” Eric answered the curious giant jock. “You almost gobbled me up when you ate one of them.”

“Oh, sorry man,” Scott sheepishly apologized with a smile as he was told of the bizarre events. “I had no idea.”

“No problem Scott,” Eric consoled the muscular college guy. “You actually saved my life by getting me out of Bruce’s shoes. I thought I was definitely a goner.”

The object of Joe's derision frowned and stared at the man-speck in Joe's hand. The jock sniffed, "Looks more like some bug than a man."

Another jock reached out and slapped the side of his buddy's head. "No, it is a teeny-little guy!"

Joe smiled and said, "Told ya!"

The offended jock frowned even more intensely. "So, what good is he?"

Eric, the focus of so much intense speculation by the colossal jocks, began to feel nervous.

Joe wrinkled his brows in deep thought. Exactly what good was a bug-sized man?

"I don't know," Joe admitted, but he stared down in fascination as the tiny man began to leap and dance on his palm.

"Just take me to my lab, you moron!" Eric screamed as loudly as he could.

Another jock slid his face close to Joe's hand and the little guy. "I can think of some fun possibilities," the jock said, wetting his lips with a massive tongue.
144112112111122.title: What Do You Do with a Bug Like That?

choices: Eric yells at the giant
Eric pleads with the giant
1441121121111221.content:
Joe reacted automatically when he caught the drift of his buddy's intentions.

"No way, dude!" Joe exclaimed, making his hand into a fist, protectively enclosing the teeny-tiny man to shield him from the too-intent interest of his fellow jocks.

"Aww, c'mon," one of the jock's complained.

Inside Joe's fist, Eric tried to squirm while also gasping for air. Why had the giant closed his fist? Was he trying to crush him?

"I can't breathe!" Eric screamed.

"We've got to look out for the tiny guy," Joe scolded his fellow jocks. "He's so tiny, he must be terrified."

Joe's friends laughed until they noticed he was serious.

He unfurled his hand and was distressed to see the tiny guy lying on his side, gasping.

"ARE YOU ALL RIGHT?" Joe bellowed down into the palm of his hand.

"Ohgod, stop!" Eric begged as Joe's words, uttered out of concern for his well being, pounded against him like physical blows.

"Well, we will leave him in your good hands, won't we?" The two other jocks poked each other and then left the room.

Joe didn't mind to see them depart. "IT'S ALL RIGHT," he said. "THEY ARE GONE!"
1441121121111221.title: Protection?

choices: Yeah - he carefully puts you next to your ear and you finally talk
No - he thinks you meant talk louder!
14411211211112212.content:
Eric decided there was only one thing he could do to communicate. Abandoning all dignity, he knelt down and clenched his fists together, raising them in a worshipping, begging, pleading pose. Joe looked down at him in amazement.

"IT'S OK!" he bellowed again. "I WON'T HURT YOU!"

Eric wondered what sins you had committed in a previous life to deserve being found by such an idiot. The tiny professor unclasped his hands and, very obviously, covered his ears.

"Ohhhh..." he breathed quietly. "I'm so sorry."

To stay on his good side, Eric now brought his hands together, palms flat, and raised them - as if to say "oh god, thank you." Joe chuckled.

"You really are fragile, aren't you? Well, don't worry. I gotcha. You can live with me. I'll get you a nice place to live where those nasty bugs won't getcha."

He was talking to you like you were 5 years old. Eric rolled his eyes, shook his head and tried to communicate, this time by pointing to his ear. He figured if Joe could just put him in there, Eric might have a shot at being heard.

But did Joe get Eric's meaning?
14411211211112212.title: Eric pleads with the giant

choices: The tossed beer can is fumbled...and falls toward Eric
Joe's steps take him back toward Eric
1441121121112.content:
The giant jock stood from his seat at the table.

In a single step, the giant jock brought his huge boot over the terrified tiny professor.

Eric, caught unprepared, could only scream as the boot crashed back down as the giant took another step out of the room.

The boot missed him by a fraction, but the impact as the giant landed all his weight so close to the shrunken scientist caused a violent backlash that hurled Eric a few inches across the floor.

Knocked nearly senseless, Eric did a mental examination of his body. His left shoulder felt wrenched, and he had landed hard on his right knee as the giant's boot had stomped down so close to him. Nothing broken, he decided, but he felt sore as hell.

"Here's some more beers, guys!"

Oh no! The giant jock was returning, and Eric still remained in his path back toward the table and the jocks buddies. With a desperate cry, he struggled to his feet, determined to remove himself from danger.

"Toss me one, Joe," one of the jocks shouted.

Joe took a couple of steps into the room. He stopped for a second...
1441121121112.title: In His Path

choices: A titanic jock on clean-up duty, collecting all the garbage
An enormous rat hunting for more scraps
144112112112.content:
Something loud crashed outside the pizza box where the tiny researcher had been enjoying a slumber.

The noise caused him to spring to full alert. He crawled out of the box. He saw that a huge soda can had crashed to the floor. He approached the can. It looked like a huge aluminum silo had turned on its side. The tab provided an entry into the can bigger than his entire body. He touched the cool aluminum skin of the mammoth can. Eric thought of entering the can. But a random question occurred to him. What had sent the can crashing to the floor?

Eric decided to investigate. He soon learned his answer. He heard another noise. He turned and saw...
144112112112.title: Rudely Awoken

choices: is happy to see Seth has come to help him clean up.
continues chewing and spitting.
1441121121121.content:
Eric turned and was startled to see an enormous young jock way over at the the side of the room with a trash-bag in hand. As big a a skyscraper, the giant jock was moving about the room gathering up various garbage and depositing it into the massive garbage bag.

The tiny little Professor gazed up in awe and amazement at the colossal youth. He wore baggy jeans that revealed the top of his boxers, and a loose t-shirt with the school logo. A baseball cap turned backwards coolly topped off the magnificent creature. As the young giant moved closer, Eric was alarmed as he gazed upon the jock's gigantic sneakers. Eric was quite intimidated as the powerful sneakers pounded closer and closer.

Justin was a star player on the baseball team. He was tall, lean and muscular. He was the only baseball player living in the frathouse and had become best friends with Seth, their common bond being neither was on the football team.

It was Justin's turn to clean up the god-awful mess in the reck room. This was not Justin's idea of fun and he dreaded it.

"I'm going to need a bulldozer to clean all this shit up!" Justin exclaimed. He looked around the room and pondered his seemingly endless task.

Justin began filling the oversized extra strong trash bag with old pizza boxes, beer bottles and soda cans. He moved randomly about the room, and was walking dangerously close to where the tiny professor was cowering, next to an empty soda can.

"Oh no, he's coming this way!" Eric said to himself.

Eric trembled as the ground-shaking colossal jock sneakers pounded their way on a collision course with the insect-sized man.

Acting out of instinct and fear, not considering the ramifications, Eric ran to the closest shelter he could find. The empty soda can. Not a good idea!

Eric looked out of the opening and saw the mammoth jock's sneakers approaching his hiding place.

"Oh my God, he's going to crush this can," Eric thought to himself, as he stood in the hollow aluminum can, petrified with fear. He waited for his fate. The miniscule Professor was about to be crushed by a gigantic jock's sneaker, or simply trashed as simple garbage.

Justin had picked up trash for five solid minutes. He stopped and gazed at his progress. Hardly a dent. He decided to take a break. Justin removed a bag of chewing tobacco out of his back pocket, took some out and loaded his mouth up. When it came to chewing tobacco, his baseball player instincts took over. The more the better. Justin looked around for something to use as a spit can. He saw an empty soda can lying on the floor that didn't look too grody.

"Cool, this should do the trick," Justin mumbled, as he grabbed the soda can and sat down at the table to relax and have a chew.

Tiny Eric's universe shifted and turned violently and unexpectedly as the giant jock baseball player grabbed the nearly empty soda can. Eric slammed into the bottom of the can, still slightly sticky from the last remnants of old soda.

Eric feared he was about to be thrown away as trash, but he was sadly mistaken. He looked up out of the hollow prison and could see Justin's enormous face. The minuscule professor was puzzled as to why this giant jock was just sitting there holding the empty soda can in his jumbo-sized hand. He noticed the giant jock was chewing something in those massive jaws of his.

Eric was suddenly terrified when he saw the giant jock's enormous mouth approach the opening of the soda can. Eric screamed like he had never screamed in his life. And then everything went dark.

In total darkness, the bug-sized man was pummeled by an endless supply of the titanic jock's disgusting tobacco spit. Eric was covered in the revolting liquid. Choking and gasping for breath, the tiny professor managed to wipe the thick hideous liquid from his face. Eric had about 20 seconds worth of peace and the ghastly event was repeated. Eric was now waist high in disgusting baseball jock tobacco spit.

"Please someone help me!" Eric yelled, half choking on tobacco spit. This was not the way the brilliant professor wanted to meet his demise -- to be drowned in a pool of tobacco spit, and then casually discarded as trash, no one the wiser.

Justin sat at the table chewing his tobacco, not a care in the world except for the moment the task of cleaning up the messy reck room. Oblivious to the tiny life in his grasp, the gigantic baseball jock lifted the soda-can to his mouth again and spit.

Justin....
1441121121121.title: Baseball players need to spit.

choices: Giant Scott comes back into Eric's life
A new giant comes into Eric's life
14411211211211.content:
Justin grabbed the soda can and spit again as his friend entered the room. "Hey, Seth! How about a hand, buddy?"

Seth ran a hand through his dirty blond hair. "I just came to see if you want to go get something to eat."

"I've got to get this mess cleaned up. We could both get it done and then go out for some food," Justin said.

"Lazy ass," Seth said, but he grabbed up the soda can with Justin's discarded chewing tobacco...and a tiny man!

"Not that can," Justin said. He tapped his left cheek, where he had shifted all his tobacco.

"Gross, man!" Seth groaned. "That's a really disgusting habit, you know?"

Seth put the can back on the table. Then, turning to start collecting pizza boxes and old beer bottles, the giant's hip clipped the corner of the table. The soda can trembled, then fell on its side, unnoticed by the giants.

•••••••

Eric had been desperately shouting for rescue when another huge amount of chewing tobacco had been spit into the can.

He was up to his neck in the filthy, disgusting substance. The awful taste got into his mouth and in his nostrils. His tiny clothes were soggy and heavy. One more spit and he would be finished. There was no way he'd be able to remain afloat in the mess.

And then he heard Justin talking to the giant Seth.

"Help! Oh please, help!" Eric screamed until he was hoarse. He tried to slosh through the sludge of tobacco spit to position himself to see through the can's open tab.

Just as he looked up he saw a giant hand coming toward him.

And the entire can and its contents begin to swirl in a maelstrom. His feet slipped out from under him, and Eric plunged under the foul semi-liquid contents.

As he surfaced, spluttering, trying to get a breath, he heard Seth riding Justin about his "disgusting habit."

And then, with another jolt, the can was returned to the table.

Eric feared the volume of tobacco spit in the can was about to increase when he felt a terrific impact and everything turned upside-down yet again.

•••••

By some stroke of luck, the can landed on its side, and Eric crawled through tobacco sludge and exited through the open tab. His muscles were weak. He couldn't manage to walk. He crawled across a massively wide tabletop, seeking some place where he could conceal his tiny body.

•••••

"Fuck this!" Seth said. "I'm hungry. We can clean when we get back."

"Sounds good to me," Justin said.

The two giants walked out of the room. Their footsteps, which caused tiny vibrations to shudder through the tabletop, grew fainter as they left the room.

••••••

After a short rest period, Eric managed to regain some strength. But his clothes were stained and filthy. They reeked of tobacco. He stripped off his lab coat, shirt, his pants, even his underpants and teeny shoes and socks, until he was standing naked on the tabletop.

But his skin was still stinking of tobacco. The filthy spit was even in his hair. Bad enough being as tiny as a bug. Now he felt miserable. He had always practiced a tidy personal hygiene. He hated to feel dirty.

That's when he saw the different-looking label on an overturned bottle. It was a blue and white label. Eric was thrilled by his discovery. Apparently, not every jock chugged beer and soda. At least one of the giants was health-conscious enough to enjoy a bottled water.

"Please, please, please," Eric chanted as he ran toward the open end of the bottle.

"Oh, thank God!" Eric cried. He crawled into the open end of the bottle and ran into the center of the glass container. A residue of several inches of clean water remained.

The tiny scientist splashed in the water, cleaning his naked body. He fell back in the water and let his hair fall back into the water.

By the time he was finished, the water was fairly filthy, but he felt much, much cleaner.

Of course, now he was naked. He glanced down at his bare skin.

He was ready to get out of the bottle when...
14411211211211.title: A Really Dirty Feeling

choices: Falls into the bowl with the pumpkin seeds
is stuck on Scott's hand as he reaches back into the pumpkin
144112112112111.content:
Eric had started climbing back toward the opening of the bottle when he heard and felt more footsteps approaching.

He saw the giant jock Scott who had transported him into the frat house in the first place.
For tiny Eric, the pumpkin in the jock's strong hands looked like a huge, orange globe bigger than a hillside.

"Seth! Justin? Where is everyone?" Scott's voice boomed. He dropped the gigantic gourd heavily onto the table. The impact jarred Eric and caused him to slide back down into the bottle momentarily.

Eric trembled involuntarily while gazing out at the titanic jock and the enormous pumpkin. Scott, in the meantime, spread out an old newspaper on the tabletop. He called again for his buddies. They had promised to help him carve out the Jack-O'-Lantern for the Halloween bash.

Eric had one thought in mind — get out of the way! Scott's hand swept the bottle to the edge of the table to make room for carving the pumpkin. Eric barely managed to grasp the lip of the bottle opening in time to keep from falling back inside. Instead, the sudden rolling motion of the bottle caused Eric to topple forward out of the opening, and he sprawled out onto a vast expanse of newsprint.

Just as he started to pull himself to his feet, Eric heard a loud, wet "squelch" as Scott used a huge knife to carve out a lid in the pumpkin. Next, the jock reached in and pulled out a handful of pumpkin innards. He dumped the mound of stringy pulp and seeds onto the newspaper.

The scent of pumpkin surrounded Eric — a welcome change from the pungent tobacco spittle. Eric stumbled back away from the mountain of pumpkin pulp that had just splattered before him a bit too closely for his comfort. Before he could get far, though, Scott's enormous hand was over him, and a second handful of cool, slimy pulp dumped down onto the tiny professor.

He felt like he might be crushed beneath the weight of the mere handful of pumpkin pulp. Eric clawed his way out from under the pumpkin guts. He had to push aside slime-covered seeds bigger than his half-inch tall body.

Scott recalled how tasty roasted pumpkin seeds can be and decided to set some aside for just that purpose. His hand came down toward the pile of pulp and seed.

Eric squirmed through the mass of pulp and seeds, finally breaking through the surface and gasping in a lungful of air. As he opened his eyes again, however, he saw Scott's huge, pumpkin-smudged hand looming toward him again.

"Good thing mom's recipe for roasted pumpkin seeds came through this morning," Scott mused aloud, licking his lips.

Before Eric could move, Scott's hands scooped up the pile of pulp and seeds, and Eric found himself wedged between two of the jock's fingers.

As Scott dumped the seed-pulp mixture into a waiting bowl, Eric:
144112112112111.title: It's Halloween at the Frat House

choices: Scott lights the candle
Scott fumbles and drops the match
1441121121121112.content:
Happy one-year anniversary to "Testing the Shrink Ray"!
11-04-02 @ 11:05pm

Thanks to Small1 and all of the writers who have contributed so far for a fun first year of interactive adventures. Here's to many more! :)


=====


Eric cowered as Scott's huge hand closed around him. He found himself wedged between two of the giant's fingers, pressed there by a wall of pumpkin pulp.

As Scott released his hold on the pulp and seeds, Eric found that he was still stuck to the giant jock's fingers, seemingly glued there by the sticky juices of the pumpkin.

Oblivious to Eric's presence, Scott grabbed a large spoon and reached back into the shell of the pumpkin to continue the task of clearing it of seeds and pulp.

As he reached inside the hollowed-out gourd, his hand hit against the side of the pumpkin and dislodged tiny Eric. The shrunken scientist fell suddenly, landing on the soft, almost sponge-like bottom of the pumpkin that had been gutted for a Jack-o'-lantern.

The interior of the giant vegetable looked like a dark, alien landscape to the miniature scientist. Strings of pumpkin pulp laced the interior of the shell, and the flesh of the pumpkin had a cool, clammy feel. Despite it's enormous size, Eric had a sense of claustrophobia, as if he had been trapped in a cave.

He looked up toward the opening cut into the strange, orange ceiling of the pumpkin. He looked up just in time to see the huge spoon re-enter the pumpkin.

Eric tried to dodge away from the spoon as it scraped along the interior of the shell. It moved quickly, but the bulk of the pulp and seeds had already been extracted.

Scott tried to scrape the last few bits of string from the sides of his pumpkin. He withdrew the spoon again and shook another spoonful of pulp into the bowl.

Eric ran toward the center of the pumpkin. He stood below the opening and cupped his hands to his mouth. "Hey! Scott! Help me!" Eric shouted. "Get me out of here!" At that moment, as though in mocking response to his cry for help, Eric was startled by the loud sound of an enormous knife blade slicing thickly through the shell of the pumpkin.

The blade sawed through the curved orange dome overhead, carving out a large triangular chunk of the thick shell.

Eric sprinted across the bizarre landscape to the other side of the pumpkin. He stopped and again turned to watch as the section of pumpkin — many times larger than himself — slid out of the hole, grasped between Scott's gigantic fingers. Light shone in through the new window.

Eric realized that Scott must be carving the face on his Jack-o'-lantern. But that didn't make him any less fearful of the enormous, sharp-edged blade that kept plunging into the pumpkin's thick, orange rind.

Eric cupped his hands to his mouth and shouted up at the giant through the hole.

"Scott!! Scott! Please hear me! It's me -- Dr. Brevard!!" But the more Eric shouted, the less he believed that his giant student could hear him — whether from his tiny size, the sound-deadening effects of the pumpkin rind, or a combination of both.

The mammoth knife's sharp blade continued carving out two eyes, a nose and a jagged mouth on the face of the pumpkin's surface. Having added the features, Scott replaced the cap on his Jack-o'-lantern. "Now I just need to find a candle," the huge jock said aloud.

Eric sprinted back toward the newly cut openings. If he could somehow reach the mouth, he might be able to climb out before having to deal with a giant wax candle.

At his half-inch size, however, even the lowest point in the carved mouth was over his head by several body lengths.

With the lid back in place, the interior of the pumpkin was shadowy, illuminated only by the facial openings of the Jack-o'-lantern.

Eric pushed a stringy piece of pumpkin pulp aside — and then had he thought. Perhaps he could use the string to climb higher.

He tried, but the wet, slick pumpkin string was impossible to climb. He fell back, ending up sprawled on his back on the mushy bottom of the pumpkin.

Suddenly, the lid opened and bright light shined back into the interior.

Eric watched as Scott's colossal hand held a huge, black votive candle over the opening and slowly lowered it into the cavity of the pumpkin. The spicy scent of the candle wax mixed with the powerful smell of pumpkin, almost overwhelming Eric. The smooth base of the candle settled onto the pulpy floor.

"Let's see how you look lit up," Scott suggested under his breath, retracting his hand. He struck a match.

Eric could see the sudden flare of light above him even before Scott began to lower the flame toward the candle....
1441121121121112.title: And There, He Kept Him Very Well

choices: The front porch on Halloween night
The table with snacks for hungry jocks
14411211211211121.content:
Tiny Eric felt the heat from the match as he stared up at the giant's hand.

Holding the match between two large fingers, Scott managed to light the candle. Then he replaced the lid on the pumpkin.

The candle gave off a great deal of heat and some smoke inside the pumpkin prison. Tiny Eric coughed as he felt the huge gourd lifted.

Scott looked for the best place to display the pumpkin for the Halloween party.

He considered the center of the table with all the snacks for hungry jocks.

Or, it might look better outdoors on the porch.
14411211211211121.title: The Better to See...

in Ben's, a basball jocks, hitop cleat.

Crawling into the closet, Eric thought he would at least be safe for the moment. There was dim light in the closet operated by a pull string that someone had forgotten to turn off.

It was light enough to see that he was in the guys sports gear closet.

There were foot balls, base balls, bats, all kinds of crap strune about.

Eric thought that if he could just climb up to one of the top shelves, he could wait for someone he trusted to open the door and get there attention.

So Eric Climbed, and climbed and climbed. He shimmied up a base ball bat reaching one of the guys team jackets.

"That should be easy enough to get up he thought"

The fabric was course and made for good gripping until he reached a satin area. His grip slipped.


OH NO ! he yelled as he tumbled downward landing.......
14411211212.title: Safe at last...OR am I ?

choices: to save time, decided to put them on right there.
threw them into his duffle bag with the rest of his wrestling gear.
144112112121.content:
Eric screamed in a panic as his meager little body plummeted downward. He fell into a deep, dark hole and landed on a soft, squishy surface. He stood up on the strange surface and regained his composure. He did not seem to be injured. Luckily the soft bouncy surface broke his fall. But where was he?

Then is hit him. The smell was god-awful. It was strong and pungent, and all around him. He held his breath for a second.

"Oh God, I will never get used to this smell," Eric thought to himself. "Where in the hell am I?

Eric noticed a deep, dark cavern in front of him, and freedom high above. He had fallen into some kind of hole. Eric looked up and saw a giant number 15 on the enormous rounded wall and then it dawned on him. He was in a shoe. "Oh God no!" he thought. He had fallen into one of those giant jock's colossal sneakers.

With all his might, the reduced man ran at one of the sneaker walls and jumped, trying to dig into the smooth cloth wall any way he could. He made it a couple feet, and then fell back into the shoe. The wall of the worn, old nasty sneaker was just to smooth to climb.

A dreadful feeling of gloom and despair fell over the pitiful half-inch tall man. He was trapped. Trapped in the sneaker of some gargantuan young brute, with size 15 feet no less.

If Eric was unable to get the attention of the king-sized athlete when he showed up to get his sneakers, he would certainly be squashed to a pulp under one of his monstrous feet.

* * *

"Hey man, what's the rush?" Scott asked Jason as he stormed into the room headed for the closet.

"I've got to hurry, or I'm going to be late for wrestling practice," Jason replied as he opened the door to the gear closet. "Coach will kill me if I'm late."

"National champion two years in a row, and undefeated as a junior," Greg chimed in. "Coach should be kissin your feet. You are a star."

"Whatever," the ever so modest hulking wrestler said with a laugh. "I've got to go!"

The stunning young wrestler entered the gear closet and looked around quickly. "Here they are."

Jason reached for his wrestling shoes and,
144112112121.title: College Wrestlers Sure Do Have Big Feet

choices: Pray
Try to climb atop the toe...maybe that's safer!
1441121121211.content:
In a hurry, Jason decided to put on his shoes.

“No!” Eric wailed in a long, desperate cry as he saw an enormous foot enter the humongous sneaker.

Of course, Jason didn’t detect the tiny, horrified screams of the bug-sized man trapped in his shoe.

Besides his large feet, Jason had a trim, compact body, kept in fine condition for his wrestling matches. He had large arms, massive pecs and strong, pillar-like legs. He had short brown hair, almond-brown eyes and a dazzling smile.

None of which mattered to entrapped Eric, who from his confinement deep within the jock’s shoe could not see any of the giant to appreciate such impressive assortment of physical attributes.

In seconds, when trapped in a corner of the shoe’s toe, faced with the tip of Jason’s pinkie toe, which was still several times more massive than Eric’s puny body, Eric felt very grateful that Jason’s colossal foot didn’t require every last bit of space within the shoe.

It was still a tight squeeze. Eric feared at any second Jason might flex a toe and crush him.

All he could now was…

144112112121112.content:
Surely the giant youth would take his shoes off at some point. Eric clung to the faint hope, and struggled to prevent being squashed before that happy moment arrived.

But, in the hot, moist, dark interior, muffled sounds still invaded. He heard a loud, abrasive male voice.

"Well, nice of you to grace us with your presence, Jason."

"Sorry, coach!" Jason said quickly.

"Forget the apology," the coach said abruptly. "You know the drill. Do your laps, and then you can join the rest of us at practice."

No! Eric screamed in horror. Not laps! He didn't know if he could survive much more of the punishment being trapped between Jason's giant foot and his shoe.

He felt the pounding begin again, steadier than before. Jason, cursing his coach under his breath, started his laps.

"God, no," Eric moaned.

The sound of a garbage truck rumbled almost deafeningly in the background.

Despite some yogurt in his ears, tiny Eric heard loud male voices outside the confines of the enormous plastic garbage bag. The gruff voices were shouting, but they were still a bit muffled to Eric's ears. "Just a few bags in this dumpster!"

Eric's world lurched suddenly as the bag was lifted, and everything shifted around him once more.

The yogurt container turned upside down, dumping its contents, including Eric, out into the other debris contained inside the bag. He plunged downward with a surprised scream.

The yogurt flowed thickly out of the container and dropped, spattering onto a huge, crumpled piece of paper. The impact sunk Eric into the blob of goo, and he struggled to work his face up out of the substance to catch a quick breath.

Just as he managed to do so, he felt the bag lurch again, as if it had been tossed upward.

The bag landed with a jarring thud, but everything seemed to settle back into place. Still, Eric found finding his footing not an easy task. The rumbling of the truck's engine caused a steady vibration.

With a shock, he realized what must be happening.

"No!" he cried, but immediately realized the futility of screaming. Hearing the cries of a full-sized man would be hard enough over the noise, to say nothing of a bug-sized man.

Eric was jolted once more as something seemed to hit the side of the bag — another bag, no doubt, Eric figured.

He knew he had to move. He didn't want to think about what might happen next.
If he didn't use his brain to figure a way out of this huge bag, he knew his next stop would be at the dump, miles away from his laboratory.

He struggled through the puddle of yogurt past a soggy, wrinkled blueberry and finally managed to grab a wrinkle of the discarded paper. Yogurt trailed behind him as he extracted himself from the glop.

Catching his breath for only a moment, he crawled across the surface of the paper, searching in the darkness for the smooth, plastic walls of the garbage bag.

Before he could complete his attempt, he heard the voices again. "Looks like we're finished here," a man said. "It's a full load. Let's haul this to the dump."

There were two loud thumps as one of the men slapped his hand against the side of the truck to signal all was ready.

A moment later, Eric heard a new sound, the high whine of a hydraulic press. The bag began to shift again as the contents of the truck were slowly being compressed.

For the first time, the shrunken man wondered if he would even make it to the dump. The contents of the bag began to creep closer together.

He scrambled to stay clear of giant objects as they moved in on him. Eric's panic grew. As the garbage compacted around him, he had nowhere to run.

He felt panic rising until he brushed against a smooth wall of glass. Confused at first, he managed to scramble along the glass until he recognized the structure as a bottle or jar. Fortunately, the jar rested on its side. Tiny Eric reached the open lip of the jar and managed to dash inside as objects around him began to get crunched. He slid along the slippery walls of the jar's interior, getting coated with the remains of some rancid mayonnaise in the process.

The whine of the press and the crunching and rattling sounds of compressing garbage continued, and Eric wondered how long the hangar-sized glass jar would hold under the increasing pressure.

Moments later, the noises and the pressure subsided.

The truck lurched into motion again with a loud release of its air brakes as it started toward the dump.
