He felt insignificant and humiliated as he realized his little brother had put him in a petri dish just like he was some lab specimen to be examined. His super-colossal little brother towered over him like an all-powerful god.

After an initial analysis of his situation, Eric concluded he was only about 1/8th of an inch tall. The lint-sized professor looked up at his humongous little brother looking down at him, and trembled with fear as he realized his irresponsible little brother was in complete control of him.

Eric's clear plexiglass prison was about 6 inches in diameter, about the size of a football field for the reduced man. Eric was dead center, and the circular wall was 144 feet away in any direction. Even though the wall was only 1/2 inch high, it was 24 feet for the tiny Professor.

The minuscule Professor's mind shifted from traumatic terror to elated joy from the success of the shrink ray. Eric knew the shrink ray was the invention of the century. If he could get out of this unnerving situation, the brilliant Professor knew he would be rich and famous. Although Eric was less an enthused as he realized his fate was in the hands of his unreliable, not-too-bright little brother.

Suddenly, Eric's world shifted violently as the floor beneath him began a horrific ascension. Zac was lifting him in the air close to his face to get a better look at his reduced brother.

"God, you are so tiny," Zac laughed as he began a close examination of his big brother. "What the hell am I going to do with you? I better not try that machine again or I might shrink you to oblivion. I'm going to have to get us some help."

Zac tilted the petri dish slightly and sent Eric sliding uncontrollably towards one of the massive walls.

"Oops," Zac said with a chuckle, as he righted the little dish and set it back down on the counter. "I'm going to go and try to find Don and get him to help you. Now don't you no nowhere big, oh I mean little bro."

Although Eric was relieved his little brother had the sense to help him, he felt scared and vulnerable being left alone in the god-awful petri dish.

Zac left the room in search of Eric's grad assistant Don. Zac pondered taking Eric with him but wisely decided all the movement would be too much for his tiny big brother. Eric was alone as he stood in the small petri dish in the hauntingly quite ominous room.

Suddenly Eric's assistant Don and another student rushed into the room. They had come to gather supplies for a science class experiment.

"O.K. Dustin, we're going to need 4 lab kits, a bunsen burner, and some alcohol for the experiment," Don informed the student. "Oh, and I almost forgot, some petri-dishes. Here they are."

Don grabbed the stack of petri dishes,
15411.title: Zac Tries to Help

choices: Don explains the experiment
Zac bursts in looking for Eric
Is that speck moving?
154111.content:
From within the football field-sized petri dish, Eric had an unobstructed view as the two giants entered the laboratory and moved toward the counter.
"Oh my God!" Eric recognized one of the flesh-and-blood mountains as his assistant, Don. He didn't know the other behemoth.
A truly colossal hand reached down toward his petri dish. Eric screamed in a futile attempt to make the gigantic men notice him.
His world tilted crazily as Don collected the petri dish in a casual swipe. His terror intensified. He was afraid he would be sent hurtling toward the distant floor. By some miracle, the dish remained more or less stable and upright.
But each of Don's steps felt like an 8.0 earthquake!
''''''''
Don and Dustin entered a classroom and placed their supplies on a lab table near the front of the class.
Miniscule Eric was relieved that the hellish trip from his laboratory to this classroom was over. The entire walk had taken Don and Dustin only a couple of moments, but for Eric it had been a horrendous experience.
Worst of all, Don and Dustin were completely unaware of him. At least Zac had known that Eric was inside the otherwise empty-looking petri dish. These monstrous behemoths, oblivious to such a miniscule creature as shrunken Eric, could obliterate him out without even going to any special effort.
''''''''
Don and Dustin began arranging some of their lab supplies on the lab table. The petri dish containing teeny Eric had been placed off to the side. He watched as they proceeded with their preparations.
"So, what are we gonna do?" Dustin asked, idly taking up a petri dish in one hand, fidgeting with the object.
Luckily, he didn't grab the petri dish containing little Eric.
"I've got a cool experiment in mind..."
154111.title: Isn't Science Fun?

choices: sanitize the rest of the petri dishes.
hand him the sanitized petri dish.
1541111.content:
Eric looked up in horror at the blinding explosion and intense flames. The ant-sized man lifted his hands in a futile effort to block the overwhelming brightness and excessive heat.

Don had merely lit a match to ignite the bunsen burner. He extended the wick slightly, lit the bunsen burner, and moved it out of the way.

"Dustin, put some alcohol on that gauze and sanitize the inside of that petri-dish your holding," Don instructed the eager 19 year old college student. "And when you're done with that, open up one of those lab kits."

"Cool," Dustin replied. "I just hope we get to blow something up with this experiment."

The young college student's hugeness was inconceivable to the minuscule Professor. Eric grew terrified as he watched the gigantic student effortlessly wipe out the inside of the petri dish he was holding with some gauze covered in alcohol. When the young titan got around to "sanitizing" the petri dish teeny Eric was in, it would surely mean his immediate death.

"We never blow stuff up on purpose," Don replies with a laugh. "It just happens."

Dustin fumbled around with the items of one of the lab kits while Don mixed up some various liquids in a test tube. He poured the mixture in a metal cup and proceed to warm the concoction over the bunsen burner.

Eric viewed the massive events in disbelief. He briefly imagined his macabre demise, being effortlessly smeared out of existence by some college kid. Eric had no idea how he was going to get out of this bizarre mess.

Don looked over to Dustin and instructed him to:
1541111.title: The Experiment Begins

choices: Dustin noticed a little "ant" in one of the petri-dishes.
admire their little preserved specimen.
15411112.content:
Dustin handed Don the sanitized petri-dish and observed with curious fascination as Don poured the strange heated mixture into the petri-dish and stirred it with a metal rod. Don added a level spoonful of white powder and the weird concoction began to lightly smoke.

"Cool," Dustin said, mesmerized with the experiment. "What are we making?"

"It's a specimen preservation liquid. We just drop the specimen in the liquid, and it will be preserved indefinitely as the clear liquid hardens as solid as a rock," Don explained. "Reach over there and hand me that jar on that counter."

Dustin grabbed the little jar, and noticed a colorful tiny lady-bug crawling around on the bottom of the jar.

"Do we put the specimen in the liquid while it's still alive?" Dustin asked with a mischievous grin.

"Yes, the specimen will preserve much better if it is still alive when we add it to the hardening mixture," Don answered.

"It really sucks to be you right now," Dustin said to the tiny bug inside the small jar, and laughs.

"Yeah, it's definitely not a pleasant experience," Don explained. "But it's just a bug."

Don poured the clear liquid into a clear square mold and instructed Dustin to drop the bug into the deadly liquid. Dustin unscrewed the lid of the small jar, tilted it and the woeful little insect fell helplessly into the still hot slowly hardening liquid.

The little bug tried frantically to escape but it slowly sank into the life-ending mixture.

"It's so cool how the specimen sinks to the exact center of the liquid," Dustin exclaimed in amazement as he watched the bug's last movements of life.

"It has to be mixed just right for that to happen," Don proudly explained. "And we got it perfect this time. In about an hour, the mixture will completely harden and the insect will be preserved forever."

"I wish we had some more specimens," Don said. "We've still got quite a bit of the mixture left. I hate for it to go to waste. Oh well, I instructed some of the students to bring in some live specimens for their next class. We should have plenty by tomorrow."

Don and Dustin began to clean up their mess and:
15411112.title: The Mixture

154111121.content:
Eric watched the ghastly events unfold in complete terror. He was repulsed as he watched the lady-bug meet its gruesome and horrifying death.

Suddenly Eric was terrified as the behemoth college student looked down and stared directly at him. Within the gigantic clear petri-dish, there was nowhere to run or hide. He was at the complete mercy of the terrifying giants. Eric was fearful that to the giants, he would appear to them as a tiny bug. He was right.

"Hey look, there is an ant in that petri-dish," Dustin told Don in amazement.

"How on earth did that get in there?" Don asked curiously. "Oh well, the preservation liquid is still good to go and it looks like we have another volunteer."

Don hurriedly poured the rest of the mixture into an even smaller square mold.

"Hurry and dump the ant in here," Don instructed. "Before the mixture begins to harden."

"Oh God no, please no!" ant-sized Eric screamed at the top of his insignificant little lungs to no avail. "Please look closer Don, I am Professor Brevard!"

But the giant experimenters were in a hurry to preserve the little "ant" before the liquid hardened, so they did not look real close at what they assumed to be a little "ant".

Dustin carefully tilted the petri-dish and tiny Eric fell into the mixture, screaming all the way.

"Just in time," Don exclaimed cheerfully.

Eric flailed in a panic as he sank into the ghastly liquid. As the horrible liquid engulfed him, his lungs filled with the vile mixture and he was too exhausted to fight any more. He sank to the exact center of the liquid. The last bit of life left the unlucky Professor and the mixture began to harden.

Don reached into a drawer and pulled out a small chain. He stuck one end of it into the hardening liquid. A circular metal ring was attached to the other end of the chain.

"In about an hour, you'll have the coolest key-chain on campus," Don told Dustin.

"Awesome!" Dustin exclaimed.
154111121.title: Preserved

choices: Dustin stacks other petri dishes on top of the one holding Eric
Dustin drops a petri dish
Dustin rinses the petri dishes
1541112.content:
Don had met Eric's younger brother a few
times.

He had never been very impressed. Don soon
learned that Zac's visits to his older brother
were usually motivated by the need to
wheedle a loan of some quick cash.

So, when he saw the distraught younger guy
burst into the lab, he was ready with an
excuse. "I'm sorry, Zac. Your brother's not
here."

"I know. I've been looking for you. You've got to
help him."

"Help him?" Don asked, skeptical of Zac's
outburst. "What's going on?"

"His invention shrunk him," Zac explained in a
rush. "I tried to help him. I must have done
something wrong cause I shrunk him even
smaller."

"Slow down!" Don ordered. He wondered what
Zac could possibly have been smoking.

"I'm telling you the truth. You've got to help
him!"

'''''''

Within the pexiglass petri dish, Eric was an
unnoticed observer of the entire scene.
"Please, listen to him!" Eric screamed. He
knew that only Don would be able to save him
now.

He moved to one of the massive thick walls of
the petri dish and peered through at the
gigantic and distorted images of the three
giants.

''''''

"All right, I will go back to the lab with you,"
Don said. "You can show me Eric and'"

"No, I can't! He's gone. I left him in the lab to
go look for you. I went back and he was gone!"

''''''

"No! I'm here! I'm still here in the petri dish!"
Eric shouted.

The mountain-sized titans moved in slow,
unreal motion near his prison.

''''''

"Calm down!" Don said. He didn't know
whether to believe Zac or not. "We will go to
the lab. If you left him there, I am sure we will
find him."

"Ok," Zac said, taking a deep breath.

Don turned to Dustin. "Listen, this will
probably not take very long." Knowing that Zac
could not see, Don rolled his eyes to convey
his skepticism of Zac's story. "Why don't you
tidy up all this equipment?"

"Sure thing," Dustin said.

He watched as Zac and Don left the room.

Whistling to himself, Dustin began to stack up
the extra petri dishes.

He was completely oblivious to the tiny speck
in one of the dishes.
1541112.title: Comedy of Errors

choices: A professor needs a petri dish
A student needs a petri dish
15411121.content:
Don listened to Zac's nearly hysterical
recounting of the events.
Zac pointed to the device. "That's what did it!"
Zac said.
"Your brother got shrunk, and this machine is
what shrunk him!" Don shook his head.
"I know it sounds crazy, but it did!"
"Well, where is he?"
"I don't know," Zac said. "I left him here on this
counter in a petri dish and went to look for
you."
"What?" Don exclaimed. "Did you say in a petri
dish?"
"Yeah."
"Oh my God! We've got to stop Dustin!"
•••••••
Dustin stacked a tower of petri dishes and
moved toward a cabinet to store them. He had
no way of knowing that his tower's base
contained a dish that held a teeny man.
Dustin began to put away the petri dishes, one
at a time, starting from the bottom of the stack
in his hands.
Inside the dish, Eric slid for yards and yards
across the smooth bottom of the dish. He
screamed for help, but his puny cries
produced nothing audible.
Dustin put the dish containing Eric in a
cabinet. He started to place other dishes in
the cabinet when he dropped one.
The petri dish clattered on the floor but didn't
break. Irritated, Dustin put the rest of the stack
back on the counter and stooped to retrieve
the dropped dish. In an absent-minded
manner, he also closed the door to the
cabinet.
•••••••
"Dustin! What are you doing?" Don asked in a
panicked voice as he rushed into the
classroom.
"Nothing. I dropped one of the petri dishes."
Dustin waved the dish in front of his face as
he rose to his feet. "It didn't break."
"Where are the other petri dishes?"
"On the counter," Dustin answered. "What's
the matter?"
"Nothing," Don said quickly. "We'll finish here.
See you tomorrow."
"All right," Dustin said. He handed Don the
dish he had dropped and walked out of the
classroom.
"I hope he wasn't in that one," Zac said.
Don turned to the stack of petri dishes on the
counter. "Let's find him."
Carefully and methodically, the two men
examined each of the petri dishes.
"They're all empty," Zac proclaimed.
"Listen, Zac. Are you telling me the truth?"
"I wouldn't lie to you— not about this!" Zac
answered angrily.
"But he's not here!"
"Unless—" Zac glanced down at the tile floor.
"Do you think he was in the dish that guy
dropped?"
Don, too, looked nervously down at the floor.
He didn't voice his fear out loud, but he
wondered if Eric could have survived the
impact with the floor if he had been inside the
dropped petri dish.
"We'll have to search," Don said. Zac started to
walk across the room.
"Wait! Don't move!" Don yelled.
"What's wrong?"
"We've got to watch out where we step," Don
explained. "If he's down there, we don't want to
stomp on him. If he is as small as you said,
he will be difficult to see."
••••••
An hour later, having scoured the lab floor on
their hands and knees, both men sat on the
floor.
"He's not here," Don said. "We've gone over
every inch of this floor. I think we should go
back to the lab. Maybe he is there."
Zac, with no ideas of his own, followed Don's
lead.
"Besides, maybe I can look at the machine
and think of something that will help us find
him."
As they left, Don grabbed up the stack of
empty petri dishes, intending to return them to
the laboratory.
•••••••
All that time, unknown to the two men, teeny
Eric had screamed for help from inside the
dark cabinet where he remained trapped in
the one petri dish Dustin had managed to
return to the cabinet.
He screamed until he was too tired to
continue. At that point, he curled up and slept.
15411121.title: Storage Cabinet

choices: Ben takes a closer look
Ben is interrupted
154111211.content:
Light poured into the darkness within the cabinet. Eric squinted and gazed up from a petri dish that, from his scale, looked the size of a football stadium.

What he saw caused him to nearly faint. Ben Westlake, a colleague in the physics department, had opened the cabinet. Eric stared up in astonishment at Ben, who looked like a mountain in comparison to the shrunken scientist. The two men were quite competitive. Eric had managed to get the best of his rival in securing a grant that financed the research into the shrink ray that had led to his current dilemma. In hindsight, he realized, perhaps it would have been better if Ben had won the grant.

"Ben! Help!" Eric screamed.

Ben stretched out a colossal hand and took some items from a shelf above the one that held the petri dish containing Eric. Then, almost as an afterthought, the titanic man grabbed the petri dish.

Eric was tossed about with each step taken by Ben.

Ben began to set up on a lab table. Being very fastidious, he double-checked all the items for his experiment. He happened to peer into the petri dish and saw what he mistook for a speck of lint or dust. He prepared to clean out the dish when the speck moved...
154111211.title: Titanic Colleague

choices: Ben immediately seeks revenge...
Ben attempts communication...
1541112111.content:
Ben Westlake had just turned to reach for a paper towel to clean the tiny speck of dirt when, to his immense - no, honestly, IMMENSE suprise - it moved.

For a moment, he wondered if he was crazy. Had it just moved? Or was it just him? It had been a very long day at work, and he head a headache after an argument he'd had earlier with that stuck-up Eric Brevard. Maybe he was just hallucinating. He reached the the paper towels when in the corner of his eye, he saw it move again. But this time it hadn't just moved, it was moving.

Up and down, up and down, as if the speck was a jumping bean. From Ben's high perspective, the speck looked as if it were barely leaving the bottom of the dish, but...

* * * *

Eric was quickkly tiring himelf out, he felt as if he were doing some kind of a cheerleading routine. He sprinted left, sprinted right, jumped through the air, even waving his arms. He was trying to create any sort of significant motion that his peer would notice. Or at least, he had previously been his peer. Now Ben looked like an enormous god; he was over 3,500 feet tall. Each of his fingers looked to be over 30 feet thick, like colossal airplanes.

* * * *

Ben Westlake searched through the drawers, hunting for a magnifying glass. He quickly located a small handheld one and lifted it over the tiny tray. There, looking up through the glass, was a very familiar face...
1541112111.title: Recognition

choices: Ben encounters Don in the lab
Ben returns to torment his rival
15411121112.content:
For our intrepid speck-sized hero, the brilliant but of late unlucky Eric Brevard, the sight looked like the eye of god.

The enormous silver handle and lens frame of the lake-sized piece of glass resembled some otherworldly spacecraft as it hovered in place over the petri dish containing the shrunken scientist.

For the moment, Eric could do no more than stare at the single unblinking dark eye. Only slowly, one mammoth body section at a time, did the tiny man form a vision in his brain of his titanic colleague.

Ben Westlake, impeccable in his professional suit, tie and coat, allowed himself the faint hint of a pleased grin.

A few hours ago, Eric Brevard, his archrival in the department, had gotten the upper hand in an argument about funding.

Now, in an unexpected but not totally unsatisfying twist of fate, Ben held Eric, literally, in the palm of his hand.

Now the enormous outlays of research expenditures began to make sense.

"You've perfected a shrinking ray," Ben said aloud in a voice that caused tiny Eric to tremble in the vastness of the petri dish.

Ben laughed. "Well, perhaps you've not quite perfected it," he suggested with another rumbling of laughter.

He lowered the magnifying glass an inch closer to the petri dish. He examined every detail of his much-reduced colleague, who looked rather unkempt in a tiny, rumpled lab coat and trousers.

He could see Eric's mouth open and close and guessed, correctly, the tiny man wanted to communicate.

"I can't hear you, buddy," Ben said smugly. "Let's try this. Nod your head for yes, shake your head for no."

"Do you understand me?" Ben asked. He smiled when he saw Eric's tiny hand nod.

"Does anyone else know where you are?"

Eric shook his head, then suddenly thought better of it. Ben laughed when Eric shook his head.

"I don't believe you, Brevard," he announced. "I know you too well. You probably kept this all to yourself, waiting for the right moment to step forward and claim your glory."

Eric continued to shake his head.

"Once I announce to the world the invention of my shrinking ray, I will never worry about toiling in your shadow again," Ben said.

Eric balled his fists and swore helplessly at the titanic giant. He heard laughter that rumbled through the stadium-sized petri dish.

"Not that you would be able to physically cast much of a shadow now," Ben said.

Ben, still holding the petri dish containing his lint-sized fellow scientist, left the laboratory, strolled the corridor, took an elevator down one floor and entered his office. He opened a drawer to his desk and lowered the petri dish carefully into the drawer.

"I think that will keep you out of harm's way while I check out your laboratory and your research," Ben said. "I need to keep you available until I am sure I can figure out how you managed your breakthrough."

"Let me out of here!" Eric screamed. "You can't do this to me!"

The tiny man continued to yell even as Ben closed the desk drawer.
15411121112.title: Ben's Triumph

choices: Eric freefalls and lands on Bruce's shoulder.
Eric falls and lands on the ear of one of the wrestlers.
1541112112.content:
When Ben Westlake gazed down at the ant-sized man, it sent shivers down Eric's miniature spine. His fear increased when he saw the descent of Ben's colossal hand. Eric jumped up and down frantically waving his arms in an attempt to get his giant colleague's attention. But the tiny speck within in the petri-dish had gotten the Professor's attention. Professor Westlake was about to smear the tiny nuisance out of existence. He reached for a small cloth and doused it with some alcohol. With his free hand, he picked up the petri-dish in preparations for wiping it out.

Suddenly four college students stormed into the classroom. The rambunctious young men had come for their remedial lab session. They were all on the wrestling team. Professor Westlake had volunteered to tutor some of the wrestlers that were having difficulties in their Physics class. Being a wrestler in college himself, Professor Westlake identified with the young athletes, and was more than happy to help them out.

From within the rising plexiglass prison, almost microscopic Eric watched in complete awe as the extremely impressive young men entered the classroom. It was clear to the tiny Professor that these guys had spent many hours in the weight room perfecting their incredible physiques.

"Hey guys, only ten minutes late this time," Professor Westlake kiddingly scolded the young wrestlers. "Now get your butts over to this lab table so we can get this shit over with. I ain't got all day to spend with you guys."

The interruption from the four college guys had caused Professor Westlake to pause, and he haphazardly tilted the petri-dish he was holding on its side. 1/8 inch Eric went flying.

A combination of a fan in the room and an intense gush of wind from the approaching college guys caused tiny Eric to soar skyward towards the ceiling. Eric looked down with dread and fascination at the incredible giant men below him as the circulating winds created a hovering effect. The lint-sized daredevil gulped as the saw Professor Westlake wipe out the petri-dish that he had been trapped in with one fatal motion.

"Well Bruce, have you won a match yet this year?" the Professor asked the most physically impressive of the four guys.

"You gotta know I'm undefeated this year Professor," Bruce answered sounding quite offended. "Havn't you been coming to the matches?" The other guys just laughed.

"Let me turn this damn fan off so we can concentrate," the Professor said as he reached over and pushed the off button at the base of the fan. Tiny Eric hovering high above screamed, "NO!"
1541112112.title: Up Up and Away

choices: Philip feels an itch
Eric attempts to climb into Philip's ear
15411121122.content:
The powerful updraft eliminated by Professor Westlake's casual de-activation of the fan, Eric experienced the queasy feeling of freefall. Instead of the distant tile floor rushing up to greet him, he saw himself falling toward the vast head of one of the wrestlers.

Tiny Eric, no more than an eight of an inch tall, nearly landed on the neatly shaven scalp of a wrestler named Philip. Philip was a tall, muscle-bound wrestler standing 6'7" tall and weighing 230 pounds, all muscle and no body fat. He kept his head and body shaved for a competitive edge.

He looked almost nearly 4,000 feet tall to the mite-sized scientist. Eric landed on the side of the enormous dome of Philip's skull on a stubbly field of fine blond hair. He began sliding, trying to grab hold of one of Philip's hair follicles. A strand of hair was too thick for his tiny hands to grasp, and he continued to slide until he came to rest in a wide crevice of space between the side of Philip's head and a wall of flesh.

"Oh, shit!" Eric exclaimed, recognition dawning. He had landed behind Philip's enormous ear.

He appraised the situation and realized that at least he had not fallen more than 3,000 feet toward the floor.

He also had an idea. If he could climb the awesome ridge of Philip's earlobe, could he possibly climb inside the huge jock's ear.

If he could manage such a feat, he could shout for help. Surely, standing within the jock's cavernous ear, Eric could make himself heard.

First, there was the major obstacle of simply reaching his destination.

For the moment, at least, the huge jock was standing nearly motionless, watching as Professor Westlake demonstrated an experiment for Philip and his assembled titanic wrestling teammates.
15411121122.title: Getting a Jock's Ear

choices: Philip reaches into his pants to scratch his balls
Philip reaches into his gym bag to grab something
Philip pats one of his buddies on the shoulder
154111211221.content:
Eric stood in the valley formed by the titanic jock's ear. Just on the other side was his only chance of a human being able to hear him. While barely noticeable at normal size, there was a fine layer of hairs over the skin. While it was a risk, Eric hoped to be able to use them as hold while he climbed around. What Eric didn't count on was that while he could not be heard, he could still be felt.

         Philip felt the tiniest tickle behind his ear. Instinctively, he went to scratch at it. Eric was simply trying to figure out how to get a hold on the skin and hairs, when a shadow began to block the light coming from above. He looked up as a gigantic fingertip descended upon him. The nail touched down just behind him, and began moving forward as Philip scratched. As Eric was overtaken, he was caught up in the slight dirt beneath Phillip's fingernail.

         The itch disappeared and Philip withdrew his finger. Tiny Eric was stuck in the tiny folds of skin beneath the nail. He stayed there, terrified from his near death experience, and trying to hold on to the hand as it constantly moved. He did not come off the hand until...
154111211221.title: Philip feels an itch

choices: Eric makes his way to the eardrum
The jock sticks something into his ear
154111211222.content:
Eric decides to take the risk. He grabs hold of the top fleshy lobe, holding on for dear life. He swings a little and leaps. He lands on the inner lobe of the jock's ear, just before the cavernous canal.

"I guess I should try to contact him somehow," he thinks to himself.

Slowly he descends into the jock's ear canal.

--------------------------

The ear canal proves to be an eerie and sickening place. Tall hairs the girth of trees sprout from everywhere. In Eric's path stands boulder-sized globs of earwax. In places the wax forms moutains.

"Sick!" thinks Eric. "Don't these sports-obsessed morons clean their ears once in a while? No wonder they don't listen to anything."

Eric hurdles over the smaller earwax globs. His hope is to find the jock's eardrum and hopefully shout to get his attention.
154111211222.title: Cavern of Doom

choices: Zac wants to help
Zac wants to help, later
15412.content:
"You stupid, ignorant moron!" Eric screamed furiously at his younger sibling, who now looked more deity than human to the speck-sized scientist.

In trying to restore his shrunken brother, Zac had only succeeded in accelerating the intensity of the reduction, leaving Eric stranded at a mere eighth of an inch tall.

"Idiot!" Eric screamed as he watched Zac take a plastic container off a counter and dump the contents, a collection of paper clips, to make room for his teeny sibling.

As he saw Zac's hand, now holding the container, stretch toward him, Eric began to take a few steps back.

"Zac!" Eric screamed. "You have to be careful..."

Zac, despite having trouble hearing Eric's tiny voice, knew better than to just grab his fragile-looking brother.

So, he placed the container on its side and told Eric to enter.

Tiny Eric folded his arms across his chest and shook his head.

Zac frowned. Not taking no for an answer, he nudged his tiny brother with the tip of his index finger. Ahead of the monstrous digit, Eric scrambled to enter the plastic chamber.

Then, holding the tiny container between two fingers, Zac lifted it toward his face.

Eric began to squirm beneath the intense gaze of Zac's orb-sized eyes.

"I'm doomed," the concluded at the prospect of Zac being able to manage the restoration process of his shrink ray.
15412.title: For Safe Keeping

choices: Scott caught the two brothers and took them with him.
Scott took the documentation of the shrinking ray. (Eric's tests were illegal)
He frightens and ran away.
1542.content:
Eric felt a hard punch. He flew straight through the laboratory and smacked against the metal wastebasket.
"Ouuchh.....!"

1542.title: Trying to get Eric off the platform, Zac shrink...

155.content:
"Brevard! Are you in here?"

The loud voice startled Eric.

Eric slapped his forehead in recognition. Damn, not Ben. His luck continued to go downhill.

Ben Westlake was a fellow researcher in the department. They were both young men. Ben was actually a few years younger than Eric, and every bit as much a competitor.

No rung on the ladder was safe with a guy like Ben always on the scene. Ever since Ben's arrival in the department, Eric had pushed himself to make an extra impression on the department's hierarchy. Still, Ben was their favorite. They all doted on Ben's achievements.

Well, once Eric revealed his accomplishment at building the world's first shrink ray, Ben's glory would fade.

"Dr. Brevard!" Ben shouted.

Eric watched as the giant man walked across the floor. He was dressed in street clothes — jeans, an M.I.T. sweatshirt.

Not only was Ben younger, he was also more attractive. In every way, he outshined Eric, who had known for only a fleeting time how it felt to be the star in the university's science department.

Eric cursed as Ben approached the shrink ray. The giant scientist examined the device, paying special attention to the defective focusing lens.

"I wonder what that guy's working on?" Ben said aloud.

Eric stepped out into the open. "Ben! Ben! Can you hear me?"

Ben did hear something. He stopped, tilted his head and listened for the odd sound.

"Down here! Ben!" Eric shouted.

Ben lowered his gaze. "Well, damn! What happened to you?"

Eric felt keenly his diminished stature in the face of the giant's immense form.

"I was working on an experiment. Can you help me?"

Ben took a few steps toward the shrinking ray and the testing platform. "Is this what caused it?"

"Yeah! It's a shrink ray." Eric watched the giant run his huge fingers along the surface of the mechanism.

"Well, it sure as hell cut you down to size," Ben said, laughing at his own remark.

"Can you help me? I need to have the focusing lens replaced."

"Sure. I could fix your machine." Ben looked down, a sly grin on his face.

Ben felt an enjoyable surge of power, including definite stirrings in his cock. Not that he felt any real attraction toward Eric, but having his main rival standing in front of him, reduced to the size of a kid's action figure toy, fed his substantial ego. He continued to smile as he realized how completely Eric was at his mercy.

And he also began to speculate about Eric's invention. Obviously, the guy had kept his research under wraps.

Eric didn't yet realize how he had made a grave error in judgment by placing his trust in his rival.

He would soon enough.
155.title: Trust His Rival?

One last time, he flew all the way up, even striking the lid of the jar. He wakes up...

15511222.content:
Eric opened his eyes and groaned. His body felt sore from his head to his toes. As his eyes focused, he received quite a start when he noticed he was stretched on his back next to an enormous thumb bigger than his three-inch-tall body.

"Oh, you're awake," said Ben Westlake, Eric's fiercely competitive rival in the university's science department. Eric could not believe he had fallen into Ben's sizable hands.

Eric scrambled back in Ben's palm as the huge man brought his hand closer to his face. Every ridge in Ben's hand looked magnified to the small man's tiny eyes. Ben's thumb looked as thick as the trunk of a tree.

"I've had time to look over your invention," Ben told him. "I truly am quite impressed."

Eric, desperate to escape, dared a glimpse over the edge of Ben's palm. His stomach lurched at the sight of the long drop.

"I wouldn't advise a leap," Ben teased. "At your size, you might survive, but I'd feel terrible if you broke a leg or an arm."

Eric, although he agreed a jump would be unwise, didn't feel as if Ben actually cared about his welfare.

"What are you going to do with me?" Eric asked.

Ben grinned. "I haven't decided," the huge man answered. "But we can't have you running around underfoot. Much too risky."

"I don't care about the damn invention," Eric said. And, he meant his words. His shrink ray had been nothing but a problem for him. "You can take the credit. Just grow me back!"

Ben shook his head. "I can't do that," he said. "Don't fear, however. I'll make sure you are taken care of."
15511222.title: In Ben's Hands

Eric is 33 years old, gay, attractive and
intelligent.

Don is Eric's 24-year-old grad assistant. He
has a crush on Eric.

Tom is Eric's 25-year-old boyfriend.

Zak is Eric's irresponsible 26-year-old brother.
Sexual orientation unclear.

Scott is a 20-year-old straight jock failing Eric's
science class at the university.

A test of his shrink ray accidentally shrinks
Eric, who must struggle to get someone to
help restore him to his normal size.
